Summary: We were in one of the remodeled room.  It was clean and spacious.  We had partial ocean view but the hotel allows for other areas to sit and enjoy the ocea.  Staff was extremely nice and eager to help. Location was great.  Short ride to restaurants and shops. Right across from beach.

Summary Heading: Dana Point Inn by the sea
Summary: I was looking for a place close to the ocean that I could walk to. It was right across the highway. I got my walk in the place is being remodeled so a few things were hard but worked out. I really liked it was cozy and didn't seem crowded. I would recommend on staying I will plan another trip soon want to get ocean view room.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us!  Our team is committed to providing an exceptional experience, and we appreciate your feed back as a valued guest of ours. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: room 105 experience was a bad one. this is my first review, but I have to warn others.  The noise from room above was amplified for some reason. walking sounded like a pounding and that‚Äôs no exaggeration.  m other than that. the room was alright

The best part of this trip was our balcony facing the beach. We experienced the most beautiful sunset I have ever seen. The staff was also very helpful with food recommendations. We definitely plan on returning soon! Also, a great room for the reasonable price.

This Best Western has a great location and is a very well-kept property. The check-in process was a breeze, and the folks who manage the property and service the front desk are very warm and welcoming. The rooms were extremely clean and promptly serviced by their incredible housekeepers. Appreciated the no pets, no smoking in rooms policy. We definitely plan on coming back! Many thanks to everyone onsite for their hospitality. We felt like we were staying at a family friendsüôè

I wish we could have stayed longer.  We had a room upgrade to a huge room with fireplace overlooking the ocean.  A wonderful breakfast and great hosts. Parking is covered and under the hotel: very handy.  A nice open floor plan with beautiful plants.

We were welcomed by the inn owners as we checked in. Phil brought us ice directly to the room and helped any time I had a question. Breakfast was hot and yummy, plus Phil‚Äôs wife was there checking to make sure we had everything needed. This was the BEST Best Western experience I have had. I will stay at BW Dana Point in the future. I‚Äôve told my colleagues about it too. Thanks for a great experience for the days I stayed with you. Plus the view is gorgeous!! The hotel is directly across from the beach and has beautiful views.

This is a nice place, not super fancy, but clean and accommodating. Our balcony room looked out over PCH and the ocean and it was quieter than we expected. Parking was good, and the breakfast was varied. The owners are friendly and they send in housekeeping daily, unlike most other places we‚Äôve stayed in the last year.

Our stay was very comfortable- great size room with complete amenities. Being in SOCAL we got a great view of the ocean with a balcony.  Breakfast was good with enough choices. To top it all, the service is excellent üíñ We will definitely come back. Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Fabulous owners and really nice place
Summary: This is a small (30 unit) hotel. Owned and run by a very accommodating couple who truely care about their guests and their hotel. This is nit a corporate run where no one cares. They're just doing a job. Most rooms are ocean view with a private balcony. Underground parking but limited height for taller vehicles.  Says 6'2" clearance but overall it's taller but under 7'. Rooms are a good size, beds are comfortable, shower is nice. The 3 most important things I look for. They  a full breakfast but the eggs are just hard boiled eggs broken apart and microwaved. I'd still with the whole hard boiled egg. They have real orange juice an a waffle maker. It was chilly outside but the Jacuzzi is set at 110‚Å∞ so it felt great_ My photo of the room is after spending days in the eoom. A real

We loved it here!   This is a family owned business !!  Owners were so warm and welcoming.  Anything we needed they always did with a smile!   We stayed there for 10 days and will definitely return!   Service was wonderful and the hotel was charming!

This is it!  The perfect place.  Yes it has an amazing view, great outdoor seating to watch a sunset even if you don't spend the extra for an ocean view, fast wifi, easy parking, and the friendliest, professional, and happy staff. The staff welcomes you, offers help and ideas for your stay and are available if you need them. The hotel is older but extremely well maintained. the rooms have everything you need microwave, large TV, refrig, and lots of plugs!  BUT the view is amazing. There is a train a couple of times in the early evening, and you do have to cross the road to the beach, but it is worth it. Not busy and beautiful, watch boats, surfers or just the waves with comfort from your own balcony.  Can't wait to return Thank you Mr. Bill!

Summary Heading: Know what you‚Äôre booking or choose another hotel
Summary: The location is across the street from the ocean however the loud street and train tracks are directly in front of the hotel and ocean front rooms.  The walls are thin so we heard everyone else, as though we were sharing our room with all the other guests.  The staff was friendly and the room was clean, however unless you love these things above, I would make a different choice.
Manager Response: Yes,you are correct in your perception. Our true problem is that the property is so relaxing and quiet that every outside disturbance is sometimes exagerrated for certain tastes. After 8 pm on any given night (even during the busiest seasons in the summer) our little corner of the world (south end of dana Point Beaches) is extremely calm & quiet. We thank you for your response and truly hope that you can find it in your heart to give us another try. Be happy & safe! From the family at the Inn by the Sea

Summary Heading: A Friendly Option With a Great View
Summary: My family and I stayed here just before Christmas‚Äîthis location is very clean, comfortable, and convenient. The family that owns this location is highly involved in the day-to-day operations here, and are always very friendly and helpful.  The views of the ocean are beautiful. We saw dolphins right from our (very nice) balcony. We also could walk to the beach whenever we wanted.   Do be aware that this location is next to a highway and a railroad, so if the sounds of cars driving by (not much honking or anything like that), or trains coming by might bother you, this may not be the best option. These did not at all bother my family and I, and we slept very well here.

The parking lot is secure. The rooms have high ceilings. The tap water is good. The elevator is ultra convenient. The staff are pleasing and charming. There is a large outdoor communal patio on the 3rd floor overseeing the splashing tides.

The owners really made a huge effort to make our stay comfortable. Our large vehicle with pod needed a special parking location (underground, low ceiling parking). The owners let us cone it off to ensure it was available when we returned at night. The accommodations were clean, location was ideal, breakfast was decent, and the Holiday decorations were fun.

A really great stay.  The location is amazing, with an ocean view during the day and the Dana Point harbor lights at night.  Newly updated rooms, huge shower, vanity, large king bed, with great bedding.   A very friendly staff who have been at the property for more than 10 years.  We felt very welcome from the moment we stepped on the property.   The continental breakfast is expansive, fresh, with great variety.  Very nice hot tub, that is not only hot, but has a wonderful view of the beach and ocean.   We cannot say enough about our stay and will certainly be back.

The room we stayed in was recently redone, spacious with a beautiful view. However, the best part was the warm staff that manages the hotel. The (I think) husband and wife team were extremely friendly and went out of their way to add little touches to the stay such as warming up the room before we arrived in December. We will definitely stay here again when we come back down to visit family.

Great value!  Clean rooms, excellent breakfast, and a really friendly staff.  Outdoor seating areas offer spectacular views of the ocean.  This place is a gem with all the little touches in the room.  Breakfast is mostly continental but the scrambled eggs and sausage were real and fresh. Best value in the area.

This place is cute, clean, right across from the beach and some rooms include an ocean view and private balconies. The rates are very reasonable and the staff is The Best!!!  *While you are in town check out the amazing beaches and restaurants that San Clemente and Dana Point offer, or a gig at the world famous Coach House Concert Hall right down the road.  We recommend this spot to our guests as well!

Summary Heading: The friendly vibe and nice accommodations make this a perfect place to stay near Dana Point.
Summary: The Best Western Plus at Dana Point was a wonderful get away. Management was friendly and very helpful. Ample parking. Our stay was in a Oceanview King rm with private balcony. The room was clean and well appointed with all needs met. The toiletries even included make-up removing wipes.  We enjoyed the balcony. Windows and plexiglass wind blocks were clean and clear. I saw a whale from the room. Breakfast was good with eggs, sausage, yogurt and other proteins. Holiday lights at the Harbor only a 3 minute drive from hotel. The place has a very peaceful and friendly vibe! We look forward to another stay soon.

The place is located on the main road of the beach line. It is noisy from the road, but if you get a beach view and close the windows, it worth the stay. Very nice and helpful workers. It was great staying there.

The location of this hotel is right on PCH, just across the street is the beautiful Pacific Ocean.   At night, the road gets pretty quiet.   Plenty of restaurants in walking or short driving distance.  The staff of this place is friendly and feels like family.

Clean, most rooms are newly remodeled and the rest will be within a few months.  We booked a room with an ocean view, and we were offered either a newly remodeled room on the ground floor or a yet to be remodeled room upstairs.  I liked the view better upstairs (yet to be remodeled) and the room was still very nice, clean, and comfortable.  The view was great and the hospitality has been excellent.

The staff at the Dana Point Inn-By-The-Sea were incredible!  Everything was great.  The room was nice and the staff couldn't be any friendlier.  I wish my stay was for more than just the 1 night! I will definitely stay here again when I travel back to the area for work.

Summary Heading: Nice view but hotel not adequate
Summary: Bathrooms way too small. Don't clean room completely or replenish. No breakfast had to ask them to make more at 9 when its served til 10. Internet drops. Cost is high for what you get, its an older hotel.

We typically stay at Best Western Plus hotels. This place doesn‚Äôt come close and doesn‚Äôt deserve the ‚ÄúPlus‚Äù category and doesn‚Äôt even deserve being Best Western. Problems include: Poor maintenance  Broken ice machine Unclean spa Breakfast- ran out of food and poor selection Unsafe bed ‚Äî three feet high off the floor.

Comfy room with decent accommodations .  Super friendly onsite owners went above & beyond to assist. Good hot coffee and decent breakfast selections.  Only "negative", which the wife pointed out was floor-level open lower wall holes & dirty/grimy shower stall each side of bathroom door; discernable when sitting on commode. She also thought it was awhile since the floor was mopped & the floor rug was cleaned.

Summary Heading: Not a Best Western Plus quality
Summary: We usually rely upon Best Western Plus to have consistent quality but were deceived with this choice. Quality is not up to usual standard of BW Plus.  We paid for "oceanview" which means we overlooked a coastal highway, railroad tracks, a fence to a cost state park filled with RV campers. A strange bed frame made the top of the mattress to be approximately 3.5 feet off the floor. Breakfast was adequate. Worn carpet covered lumps in the floor. Worn elevator appeared worn.  We will look more closely into motels that have Best Western Plus label from now on.

We found relaxation, quiet and comfort at Dana Point's Inn by the Sea. The rooms were very well kept and had wonderful views of the ocean. The welcoming and helpful innkeepers and their employees made us want to return very soon.

our first stop in California, near ocean, ideal location, good trafic connection, quiet and large room, good breakfast, very good atention, helpful hotel staff, clean, bars and restaurants near by, shopping near by

The stay was enjoyable and pleasant the room was clean and the people at the front desk were very nice I would recommend whole heartly would recommend to friends and family and the ocean view was amazing

The room we had on 2nd floor was very spacious. Wet bar was a plus and liked that there was no carpeting. Beds were clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and very responsive to requests for extra supplies. Location was perfect to walk to the festival each night. Will definitely stay again.

Booked for 2 days in order to be in walking distance of the Ohana Fest. Large room on 3rd floor, refrigerator/micro/bar sink with a window that opened on the trees in the back. Very quiet, could hear the surf. The owners are wonderful people and provide great customer service. I love the breakfast options, esp the WAFFLES (always like those hotel/motel waffles) and there is enough for anyone to choose from. Only complaint was I couldn't find the sleep timer on the Cox Contour TV control..I tried every trick! I look forward to returning again. Thank you for your hospitality!

Stayed here for our wedding weekend, as we got married just a few short minutes up the street and wanted a hotel close by with an ocean view. Several other members of our bridal party also booked rooms there, and the front desk was very accommodating to group us close to one another. Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The lighting was perfect for getting our hair and makeup done, and the covered garage with open parking was very convenient for our makeup artist, photographer and mother of the groom to join us for getting ready. We didn‚Äôt try the breakfast but our bridal party said it was wonderful. Absolutely AMAZING customer service from the owner Phil. 10/10 recommend and will absolutely stay there again in the future.

My family and I had taken a cruise and intended to stay at this location the day we docked.  We had booked online and didn't know what to expect.  We were pleasantly surprised!  It is a small property with just a handful of rooms, under ground parking and a boutique feel. We arrived at about 10:30 AM (long before check-in time) and as luck would have it, our room was ready.  Unfortunately, the purpose of staying was to visit the beach and due to a pulled muscle and the cold the rest of us caught on the ship, we were not going to be able to beach it after all.   The property was also having hot water problems due to work the utility companies were doing on the Hwy.  Helina, the guest service representative on duty, allowed us to cancel under the circumstances at no charge.  She

Decided on a last minute trip to Dana Point before going to Disneyland and was able to book a room at this hotel.  I called over the phone before arriving and the staff was helpful and informative.  I arrived the same day and room was clean and the view was absolutely perfect. I love that they have hard wood flooring I hate carpet in hotels.  The sheets were clean.   I was able to watch the sunset from my balcony and listen to the ocean all evening,  My daughter and I went to the outdoor spa where the owner unlocked the gate in the evening and brought us fresh towels.  They gave my 5 year old paints so she could paint a rock and she could leave in the garden.  She was so excited!  We woke up at 7am and breakfast was ready by the front desk.  We had waffles, bagels, fresh fruit,

This Hotel was beautiful! The view of the Ocean was breath taking from our balcony! Phil and Helen were so kind and thoughtful. A definate recommend. My Grandaughter's first trip and she already wants to return and we are not even home yet!

Summary Heading: Very nice stay, nice room, nice people.
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights in August.  Phil at the front desk was great.  Helena also helped us with any questions.  Room was perfect.  Parking was free and easy.  Location right across street and train tracks from ocean.  Nice view and quiet enough.  We will come back

The title says it all... The only "plus" was the staff, they were very nice and helpful.  This place needs a few upgrades. The elevator wasn't working. The spa was closed. The gnats/flies in the room were horrible. No hot water during our stay which should have resulted to ALL customers a 40% discount. Advertised a "complimentary full breakfast" in reality was continental breakfast.  Ice/vending machine broken.   Call to make sure things are working before booking.

Dated, tiny shower/toilet combo, elevator didn't work, computer was down, street construction noisy (hotel couldn't help that) and carb-loaded breakfast. best part was the view, across the street from the beach

Had a lovely 2 nights here last week traveling down Highway 1 to San Diego.  Phil and his wife were lovey and really looked after us for my aunt and uncles anniversary.  Very helpful with things to do and restaurants.  Breakfast was great with good coffee, fruit and bagels.  Would stay there again, great view and size of room..

Comfy bed, nice view. Cute hotel. Nice to have a fridge and microwave. Staff was friendly. Walking distance to a couple of good restaurants (Italian and Mexican). Balcony to sit on and enjoy a glass of wine and the view.

First and foremost the view was absolutely amazing..Staff and service was phenomenal. Room was very nice and clean. Close to pier and many many restaurant. Did some excursions that was very affordable and fun as well. We will definitely be back!!!

Ms. Helena and her husband, the diligent hard working Marine (I forgot his name), were our first experience in a hotel where the owners are the operators. What a refreshing change from usual hotels where the best intentions of the owners get lost in translation when they get trickled down to hourly staff that don't always care as much as the owners want them too. These guys were right on the money with sharing our expectations for a great visit. We had never been to Dana Point and they shared lots of personal knowledge and opinions of the neighborhood and where to find stuff, and lots of background info on the layout of that area. They really came across as, and you can tell that they are real people who really care about their guests and not just running a business. Helena even

Wanted to do an over night trip to get away from the heat in LA and never stayed in Dana Point before.  Free parking and a working elevator makes is easy to get your stuff from your car. Staff is super nice and helpful. Our double queen ocean view room was roomy and mostly clean. The bath room is tiny and the toilet/shower room is the narrowest we've ever seen. It could have been designed better. That room could have been cleaned better too, you have plenty of time to notice when you are doing your business and trying not to knock the toilet paper holder off the wall because your right shoulder hitting it. The shower doesn't have a shelf so you have to put your soap and shampoo on the floor of the shower which seems silly.  The ocean view is nice but, you are right on PCH so

The rooms were clean, well appointed (not over the top) with business or pleasure covered. Underground parking convenient. Could walk to restaurants, beach. Nice Views. No pool which was okay. We grew up in the area, been gone for 40 + years. Still a destination and now we have accommodations to look forward to our next visit.. the staff exceeded our needs, helped us with computer access and directions to points of interest.  If we needed something, we asked and it was provided.  Thanks everyone....

My husband and I celebrated our first wedding anniversary in the inn. We were greeted by the manager and he congratulated us on our anniversary.He also gave us the best restaurants and sites to see. His advice was right on target.  He said to come down for breakfast every day during our sta. His wife makes the best coffee I have ever tasted (and I am not a coffee drinker). The room was nice and big. We had the best view and enjoyed waking up to the sea waves crashing against the rocks.  The location is is in walking distance of great restaurants and the beach. We will return for future stays.

Celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, my husband and I had a most enjoyable stay.  We were pleasantly surprised by the close proximity parking and the quick and friendly check-in procedure.  Our room had a private outside sitting area with a lovely view of the ocean.  We enjoyed the Mexican restaurant within walking distance, as suggested by the staff.  The jacuzzi was clean and  HOT, as it should be.  My only complaint would be with the swinging chair, that had to be installed for some compliance for handicapped people, as it took up a lot of the space in that area.  Otherwise, the room was clean and had updaated furnishings:) The breakfast was simple and satisfying.  We will return one day.

Staff were extremely accommodating, went above and beyond.  Location was nearby points of interest and attractions.  No pool but there was a Hot tube and I mean HOT, not good during the summer.  Breakfast was simple.

We came for a 3 day stay at this BEAUTIFUL hotel and Phil the owner made my birthday trip absolutely amazing. Some of the best service I‚Äôve ever received! I will be staying here anytime I‚Äôm in dana point.   Thank you again to the amazing staff!!!! üò≠

Summary Heading: Great location. Friendly and accommodating. Great vintage vibe.
Summary: Nicely renovated without spoiling the vintage California seaside vibe.  Right across from the beach and close to a great little Mexican restaurant. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Many second floor rooms had a seaside view.  Comfortable outside communal sitting area with a seaside view, to enjoy a drink and snack.

Great location. Friendly staff. Across the street from beach. Close to many restaurant options. Room was huge but needs work - beds saggy, fridge rattles constantly, front and back door frames (inside) pulling from wall. Breakfast was limited - continental breakfast with waffles. Billing was not done correctly. For price we paid, would stay elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Best Western Dana Point doesn't disappoint!
Summary: From the first communication to check out, my stay was almost flawless! The bulk of my trip was in Catalina, and there are ferries to take you back and forth. There are only 2 a day, one @ 11:45, and the last one is @ 2:45. Check in is @ 3pm at the hotel. They worked with me on early check in, which was phenomenal.  They make you feel welcome, and are super friendly! The grounds, buildings, and rooms are clean, and while older, are maintained thoughtfully! snack and drink machines worked and took cc payments. I felt safe also, and was a solo woman traveler.   I stayed at a beachfront room, and the view was awesome!  There is a metro train that passes by but that doesn't detract from anything! The only thing I would say that was negative was that the plugs in the light fixtures

Amazing view, hotel so close to beach, nice large room, exactly as pictured online. Phil and his wife so friendly, great customer service.enjoyed waffle breakfast on our large balcony with an ocean view. Beach right across the street.

I came for a work trip and really loved my time at this motel.  It was clean, right across the PCH (& an east walk) to the beach!  Great restaurants within 3 minute walk and the staff was amazing!! Phil the owner was on site and went the extra mile to make everything great.  I will definitely be back and can easily make this an easy home away from home when on the road!!  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Great location, next to the beach
Summary: The room was very big, you had everything you need. Very friendly staff. Lots of parking spaces. Location is close to the beach. Breakfast was very basic. Tried to take a shower but couldn't figure out how to get hot water. It was already late so didn't want to bother reception. Everything else was fine!

We decided to drive to San Diego on a holiday weekend after work on a Friday night.  Dana point was a great location to split the drive and the beach is nice.  The hotel owner's are very sweet and care about the guest.  They treated us like family.

Summary Heading: Great stay, beautiful view, quiet and quaint.
Summary: Had a great view of the ocean, the rooms were spacious and clean, housekeeping was on top of it. Front desk associates were very attentive and present. Breakfast area was clean and the food was tasty.

Cozy and quaint is this hotel where you‚Äôll find your oasis long searched for. Treat yourself to the best room available. Breakfast at GW never disappoints. Walking distance to beach via a nearby bridge offers more options for access. Cheerful staff always at the ready. I‚Äôd stay again.

This adorable hotel literally sits across from the beach. Great location and views. You can hear the ocean all day. Staff was incredibly kind and so welcoming. Has a cute little hot tub in front with views of ocean. The hotel is 3 stories with such great views. Will definitely be coming back.

Everyone was so nice. The hotel was clean and well maintained. Got to the hotel a little late so they allowed us to have a late check-out. Everything about our stay was just great. Def. staying here again.

We used four rooms on the the third floor and they were all clean, comfortable and updated.  The management is extremely friendly and helpful.  Housekeeping goes out of their way to smile and say hi.  Very rare for such excellent customer service.   This was a business trip for the the husbands, but us wives came along.  Absolutely no complaints here.  Except for the woman staying at the hotel who used the waffle maker like a college kid in a dorm room.  Broke it for the rest of us on a Saturday morning.  She was the only moron we encountered.  Who would think that training would be required to pour batter into a waffle maker.  Well, common sense, so rare it should be a super power!!!  Thank you!!!

Best western hotel is the place you want to be if you want to be close to the beach right cross street  The staff is really friendly isn‚Äôt so beautiful wake up open your eyes and this beautiful panoramic view

We had some last minute issues and the hotel management was very helpful in accommodating us!  Very friendly staff! Call to book your reservations directly - a much better experience than using other options!  Right across from the beach and close to some restaurants- you can stay in your bubble‚Ä¶

What a cute place to stay. Beach right across the street. You get continental breakfast, and you can sit on the deck watch the waves while eating breakfast. A few restaurants within walking distance. Friendly helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and great view of the Pacific Ocean.
Summary: Staff was friendly and quick to get anything we needed like towels etc. The views of the beach are amazing and has a couple great restaurants in walking distance.  Would like to see a newer mattress, our room it sagged towards the middle.  The hot tub wasn‚Äôt working and would have been nice to use after driving from Colorado. However, these small things wouldn‚Äôt stop me from booking here again. Some have commented about trains and PCH noise, but honestly it didn‚Äôt bother us. The trains are commuters and go by quickly and traffic by sundown dropped considerably.

The staff were friendly and courteous and made our stay extremely enjoyable. The location was perfect, directly across from the beach.  The room was clean and very comfortable.   We will definitely be back!

Helena and Phil made our stay a happy and lovely journey. I needed coffee early in morning when the one in our room stopped working. Helena opened early so I could get my coffee and get out to the beach for sunrise. Phil gave a warm beautiful funny welcoming. And great chat. The rooms are clean, spacious and lovely. The small hot tub out front is a prize facing the ocean front. Great price for the value and experience.

Summary Heading: Found by chance and glad we did
Summary: We were traveling from La Jolla to Los Angeles and found this hotel by chance. It is run and owned by a very friendly and helpful couple who made our stay a pleasure. The room we had included a view of the ocean. We enjoyed our stay so much that we decided to stay a second night - this required moving to another room since this one had already been booked, but the second room also had an ocean view. Both rooms were clean and comfortable. The included breakfast included the usual, but all was well prepared and organized and the coffee was very good. There are nearby restaurants that we walked to, and a bridge to walk to the ocean. Overall, a great stay.

The owners, staff are so welcoming and friendly, made us feel at home! The breakfast was very good, with fresh fruit cups, eggs, and very clean. The room was clean and comfortable, love the ocean view, can overlook the noise from PCH. Hoping to visit again.

I felt a bit like I stayed with family. Phil and his wife are amazing hosts.  So much effort to make me feel at home. In the days of COVID-19 when many hotels put out a paper bag, I was presented with many breakfast options along with toast and bagels all individually wrapped!  And Phil was right, his wife does make the best coffee! I had an ocean front room with a balcony and lovely ocean views and breezes. Go the extra and get that room, other Ocean front rooms are double the price in SoCal!  The room was large with all the amenities and clean.  There are railroad tracks, but it didn‚Äôt bother me, and I slept like a rock!  I definitely will stay again!

Quality room for a good price. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My daughter hurt her hand and the hotel manager showed up with ice in a towel to help. Hot tub was great. Right across the street from the beach and up the road from the harbor.

One of the cleanest hotels I‚Äôve been. Great views, great staff and right on the beach. Lovely couple running the hotel very welcoming. Continental breakfast was good had a variety of choices. Will definitely be returning!

Summary Heading: Sagging bed, noisy refrigerator, inaccurate billing
Summary: We regret coming to this hotel. Did not sleep well. Noisy refrigerator, noisy  passing cars from road, noisy trains up until midnight. Woke up sore due to badly sagging bed. Breakfast was ok, serving waffles, boiled eggs & yogurt.
Manager Response: We truly are sorry to hear about your experience.

Summary: Very helpful staff. Phil wanted to move us to an ocean view on our second night, but we liked where we were and did not want to pack back up. Phil's wife Helena makes great coffee and Steve was very nice too.

This is a great place to stay. Beach is right across the street. so nice to get up in the morning and walk to the beach to see the sunrise. staff is great. Phil ( the manager ) is great. Awesome sunsets you can watch from your room. Hot tub overlooks the beach. Just a wonderful stay.

We had a wonderful stay at the Best Western in Dana point. We received a free upgraded room which had an amazing view of the ocean, the room was clean and super spacious l. Staff was really great too!

The room was unwelcoming and neglected. The bed sat on a metal box frame and bumped your feet every time you walked by the bed. The bathroom had rust around the corners of the floor.  The 2nd night we were there a group of 3 guys next to us were loud and drinking when we arrived bk from dinner. The noise continued until 3:30 a.m.  after several calls ( 1st call was around 10, 2nd 11, 3rd 11:30) to the office nothing was done.  Around midnight the office asked if we wanted to move to another room! Around 1 a.m. girls arrived and the loud music, etc. went on until 3:30 a.m. Never have we ever experienced such horrible customer service at the rate of $250 plus a night.  Beware before you book.

The room was remodeled and very nice, clean, very roomy, great location. The breakfast area was nice however they did not have the hot foods, eggs, hashbrowns, sausage, bacon etc. It was about a 5 minute drive to the Dana Point Harbor.

Check in was great.  Bed just sank in center so assume all beds in place need replacing.  Shower head worked quite poorly so assume all the shower heads in place need replacing.  Breakfast was weak as cramped room and only hot food was make your own waffle.  Could not view final bill as could not check out properly because office door was locked at 11:00 am.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your concerns with me. The office door was NOT locked  at 11 am. we serve breakfast from 7 am to 10 am leaving the front office door open all day. Stop using drugs.

Summary: The BW Dana Point is a quiet, quaint hotel. Close to the beach and harbor. Breakfast has many options (waffles, cereals, bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit). The dining area is a bit small, however, there are several spots to eat outside the dining area. Overall, the room is very clean, but the window treatments need cleaning. The air conditioner/heater is a bit tricky to figure out at first, but the a/c unit is extremely quiet. Although the Metro Link/Amtrack goes by several times a day, you can't hear it throughout the night. The staff is very friendly and attentive. There is no pool, but there is a small jacuzzi. Parking is convenient and there are a few restaurants that are walking distance as well.

Summary Heading: Trust me, you don‚Äôt want to stay here!
Summary: This is one of the worst hotels I‚Äôve ever stayed in. This place should‚Äôve been renovated many years ago. They shouldn‚Äôt advertise free breakfast, Maybe state continental breakfast. Everything from the paint peeling from the walls, the stained carpet throughout the hotel, drywall repairs that haven‚Äôt been painted, broken tiles and stairways‚Ä¶too many issues to list. The staff was pleasant and professional, and the TV worked properly‚Ä¶the only positives.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking our survey . We would enjoy having you return to a new experience.

Summary: My cousin was kind enough to pay for me to stay a night here as a birthday gift. Being from Australia and unable to go home for so long due to COVID just being by the Pacific was comforting. This room certainly didn't disappoint, although it was nothing extravagant the incredible view over the ocean from the balcony of our Ocean View King room made it everything I could want. The room was lovely and felt very spacious, the high vaulted ceilings gave it a feeling of being so much larger. Basic necessities, microwave, bathroom, although there was no 'electric fireplace' as advertised however the room stayed so warm despite the ocean chill and we most likely wouldn't have used it. While the hotel could use a bit of an update who cares when you're in such a beautiful place. The

Summary Heading: stay at best western in dana point
Summary: person at checkin desk was very friendly and extremely helpful.   room was cleaned daily and very nicely cleaned.  we requested a front facing room - view is excellent but you will get road noise and trains going past - didn't bother us but if noise does you might want a room further back.  out room was clearn but in need of repairs.  breakfast is provided but kinda scarce but still it was nice to have something to eat and drinks.

Great hosts!  They accommodated us with every request we had.  Free bottled water, extra towels, more lotion.  They were so nice.  The hotel was lovely too.  On the beach, one couldn't beat the location.  Why stay anywhere else in Dana Point.  Thanks Philip and Helena!

Summary Heading: Actually, a 2.5 rating but was still nice and we‚Äôd stay again
Summary: The hotel is right across the highway from the beach and we actually had a tiny ocean view from our room, which was a pleasant surprise.  It is a hotel with nice guest rooms and parking but the hotel exterior is a bit lacking.  For example, it looked like a piece of siding had been replaced but some of the painter‚Äôs tape was left on it, the piece was not installed properly so one side was sticking out about 3‚Äù more than the other side and then the paint job was sloppy.  Another note, the elevator floor was plywood, but no decorative floor had been laid.  When inside the room, it sounds like thunder when someone rolls their suitcase by, which would have been super annoying if it awakened us.  The whirlpool was locked with a sign indicating it was out of order, but this might have

I expected the quality I have been accustomed to in various Best Westerns. This hotel is below normal standards for this chain and below standards for the price. Given wrong room with no rebate or compensation, even though I was told I would receive it after being given the wrong room. I paid for a room with jet tub on the reservation site and was given a king without jet tub. No refund given to me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback Leah. As was explained at your check in there was no indication on your reservation that you requested a room with a jet tub. The jet tub room was occupied when you were given an early check in. We do so hope that you allow us to serve your needs in the future. Thanks in advance.

Summary Heading: Everything is broken and dirty. Do not recommend
Summary: Easily fits into the top 3 worst hotels I‚Äôve ever stayed at, and at ~$200+ per night doesn‚Äôt even come close to meeting the standards at that pricing. They must be in the middle of the remodel or something because everything is either broken or missing, but here‚Äôs a list recapping our trip so far   -  Asked for a beach view room at checkin and was given one by the very friendly front desk clerk (only good part of the trip so far)  - Room has no AC, was probably close to 85-90 degrees when we checked in. Was sent a fan by the front desk but was not warned about this prior to check in  - Compounding the AC issue, window in the room will not open due to having been recently painted and is stuck shut  -Bed feels incredibly cheap. Not terribly uncomfortable but not great, even for
Manager Response: everyone is made aware before arrival and/or before check in about the A/C renovation, windows are not suppose to open due to the design of windows.  it is not recommended to walk barefoot on tile/wood. thank you for your feedback

Summary: My stay was canceled the day before arrival, despite reserving and confirming 6 weeks before. The assistant manager was unhelpful. The customer service hold time was close to an hour. After offering a different room, the company continued to charge me for another hotel. The room had holes in the wall, a window that could not be closed because of a broken crank, and apparently no hot water--turned out the controls were backward and it took several minutes for the water to heat up. I would never stay at another Best Western.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary Heading: DO NOT BOOK HERE - THEY WILL CANCEL YOUR RESERVATION DAY OF!
Summary: We were supposed to check in today and just got a call, the day of at 10 AM saying that they are having ongoing construction and highly recommend we cancel our stay unless we're OK with loud construction noise and no air conditioning. The guy we spoke to was barely verbal and claimed to be "one of the managers." They offered no help in getting us a new hotel. We had to pay triple what we expected to get into a new hotel at the last minute. DO NOT BOOK!

Best things: ocean view and free breakfast.   It pretty much goes Downhill from there: Missing smoke detector in room.  Hole in bathroom wall.  No heat or AC.  Traffic noise.  Weeds in garden beds. Indifferent staff. General disrepair everywhere you look.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary: I was very dis-satisfied with my reservation. There was a sheet of paper in lobby stating A/C is being repaired, sorry for the inconvenience. You can cancel reservation with no charge!?? Well, they forgot to mention the hot water issues. After a semi-cold shower in the morning, I was happy to leave. My first stay at a hotel since the pandemic restrictions began made we wonder if it's still too soon.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary: Hotel is under construction HVAC system broken room carpet looks like it was 20 years old and not cleans with a vacuum. Great location right across from ocean I would stay here again next year when they finish fixing the place and update their rooms
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary Heading: The rooms need a face lift
Summary: The carpet looked gross and the room smelled, no working air or heat, and only one working lamp. The exterior was under construction and we are sure it will make a difference when it‚Äôs complete, but the rooms need a face lift for sure.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary: The best part about this hotel is definitely the location. Even though the street below is busy and the train can drown out the peaceful sound of the waves, the view was still lovely from our patio. Problem with this hotel is it's kind of a mess. Not very clean, sheets had stains, hair in towels, room didn't smell fresh when we got there. Then random things like our toilet seat was missing the lid(???) Scrapes on the walls, not cover for the light fixtures just exposed wires and ceiling. Just a mess. Also the pictures showed a bathtub but our room only had a shower. There was a faux fireplace heater that worked well after a few hours in the room. The hot water in the breakfast area was not at all hot and ruined our tea and oatmeal. The staff was friendly though.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary Heading: No heat or AC at the moment.
Summary: We'd had this reservation for several weeks and were looking forward to staying here for 2 nights. No one warned us ahead of time that there was no heat or AC at the property because they were undergoing renovations to their air system. There were also bricks and yellow tape everywhere for other renos. Fortunately, they allowed us to cancel on the spot but since we arrived at 6 pm on Friday night, we had to scramble to find another hotel. Annoyed that they didn't warn us about this fairly major glitch.

We checked in after midnight; problems with processing the payment due to poor internet connection.  It was posted that the air conditioning was being replaced and oscillating fans were available.  Explored the property the next morning and multiple areas are being renovated.  The ocean front view is beautiful and the railroad runs adjacent to the property which is a plus for train aficionados.  Property is three levels with a ground parking garage; includes a roomy elevator.  Will absolutely return to this property for a longer stay.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary: We found the room to be clean and comfortable.  Other reviews mentioned the noise from the commuter train to be annoying but we didn't find that to be the case.  The breakfast was typical of a free continental breakfast offered by many hotels and may have been a bit better had it not been for COVID conditions. Parking is onsite and easily accessible.  The staff was courteous and helpful.

Summary Heading: Un Parrelled Views of the Beach
Summary: a great room  the desk staff (john and another young man on Sunday following my Saturday check-in) was so thoughtful getting me ice for my post-op eye surgery wound)   Located at the southern tip of "hotel row" on PCH dana point you are close to other hotels restaurants
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: this hotel was doing some renovating which I was unaware of until we got there, very unorganized courtyard with paint and supplies everywhere. Also no heaters which we were told upon check in so we got a space heater. Jacuzzi room was great , clean but again needed some upgrades and minor repairs.  Great view of ocean, you can hear the waves, places to eat in walking distance, and free breakfast (when not covid) was awesome.

Summary Heading: My new favorite place in Dana Point!
Summary: The staff is excellent:  friendly, professional, quick to help.  I was told that they are in the middle of a remodel.  I hope it doesn't change too much!  There aren't many places like this left.  The motel feels like a family owned beach motel that my parents might have stayed in, not a corporate owned big chain property.  If you stay, pay extra for the beach view rooms with private balconies.  The scenery is incredible!  If you are a light sleeper, this may not be your place-you can hear traffic and the occasional train passing by, but it was not super disruptive.  While the beach and ocean are directly across PCH from your room, you will have to walk about a block and climb a serious set of stairs to cross over the train tracks.  Great value, great place to stay.  I can't

We had a great stay, the hotel was under construction but that is beyond anyone‚Äôs control, and has to be done. The locate was awesome right across from the beach. A little loud with the train tracks but not in bearable (the train went by 4-5 times and maybe once during the night) the rooms were clean and the staff was awesome! The price was decent maybe a little High to charge during the off season and while they are doing construction but we happily paid. We will be back!

I feel compelled to write when a hotel or vacation rental goes above and beyond expectations or fails miserably to meet them.  Unfortunately, my experience staying at the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-at-the-Sea is the latter. I was so excited to be able to book a king size bedroom adjacent to Pacific Coast Highway in Dana Point, California with an ocean view. I knew the vehicle traffic would be noisy and that there was a commuter train going by a few times a day, but I could just close the door to the balcony at night and pull the heavy window drapes. I didn‚Äôt mind some noise.  The day before checking in, I called Dana Point Inn-at-the-Sea hotel to see if I could check in a little earlier since I was coming from another hotel and had some perishable food items in their
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary Heading: Major issues with ants and renovations
Summary: The only reason I‚Äôm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the staff member that was so helpful during our stay. And the beds were very comfortable.  Firstly, the two rooms we stayed in had ants...one even had serious ants so that we had to move (see pics and video). When we checked in, we saw a few ants here and there, mostly in the bathroom area which isn‚Äôt entirely unusual in SoCal in extreme heat, so we didn‚Äôt really worry. But when we woke up the next morning, they were swarming the coffee maker/microwave area! And no, we didn‚Äôt have any food left out or anything. So we alerted the front desk staff and he indicated that they were having ant issues due to ‚Äúhumidity‚Äù. He moved us right away...but honestly...the hotel shouldn‚Äôt be putting guests in rooms with known ant

I really was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Such comfortable spacious clean rooms. A beautiful Garden Courtyard with a Fountain and soft playing music made for a peaceful setting atmosphere. The front desk was very courteous and helpful and my overall stay here was very pleasant. The only regret I have is not having an Oceanfront room which I will book next time I come back.

When we stay at a place we ask ourselves a number of questions. Did we enjoy our stay here? Not really. Would we stay here again? No. Would we recommend this place to others? No. There are a few positives. The rooms are quite spacious and appear to be well-maintained and clean. On the other hand, housekeeping did not come at all on the first day and only came late in the afternoon on the second day. Also, there is no pool and the parking spaces in the underground garage are very tight. And very annoying is the music they play in the courtyard and can be heard throughout the hotel. And they do not shut off that stupid music until 10 PM at night.  As for breakfast, it is more of a sack lunch rather than breakfast. It is pack and go and consists of a bottle of water, an apple, a
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary: The hotel was clean comfortable modernly furnished. Breakfast was better than most. Paula at the front desk helped us in so many ways. I had out of state family visiting Southern California for the first time and we got 2 days of heavy rain thus our plans changed. She helped us make accommodations and changes along with valuable advice. We all loved this place. So convenient to Dana Point where our family was camping!

We booked the king size room with the ocean view and it did not disappoint.  We knew ahead of time that there is actually a road (scenic byway perhaps) between the hotel and the beach but it was fine.  The view was very nice.  At busy hours there was a bit of traffic so we couldn't hear the waves crashing all the time, but if the weather is nice and you sit on the deck it would be pretty decent.  There is also an occasional metro train during the day and a startling freight train maybe once in the night?  The breakfast was good and there is a parking garage right below.  We didn't have any issues and would stay there again.  Our room was also very clean with a wood laminate type floor.  The 4 star rating is just because of the location of the road and railroad tracks.  The rest

We were not told at the time of our reservation that there were some areas on this property that were falling down and unavailable such as the patio area.  We ended up in a different room on our two night stay and the beds in both rooms were not comfortable, worn. They have upgraded some rooms and are in the process of doing more.  Not sure when all rooms will be completed.

The employees were kind and pleasant. The room was clean, nicely decorated, and you have a choice of an ocean view. The have a good breakfast. They hotel has underground parking so you do not have to park on the street. They have an elevator.

The Front desk lady her name starts with M. Needs to learn customer service skills.. She was very rude. Wouldn't stay again because of her. The place itself was decent. Thank you. I stay at best western hotels alot and rarely run into this situation.

Go somewhere else. The room was not clean, the heat did not work and it was a cold night, the structure is rotting and parts of the deck has colapsed, tile walkways and stairs had traffic cones to cover disintegrating sections. The Trip Advisor rating is wrong.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.

Summary: This is a decent hotel, but the pictures do not tell the real story.  The property is directly in front of a major highway, and well utilized train tracks are adjacent.  So, light sleepers like me are in for a real challenge.  Also, charging $10 per night for parking seems unfair given there are no alternatives.  Otherwise, its reasonably clean with a nice, friendly staff.  However, the room rates are overpriced for what you get and there are better alternatives.

the hotels name "Inn by the Sea" should be changed to "Inn by the busy and noisy Pacific Coast Highway and railway". While you can see the Sea, you certainly can't hear it nor get to it easily.  The room was recently redecorate and spacious except for the bathroom which was annoyingly small. I almost had to stand on the toilet to close the bathroom door .... who's bright idea was that? there were several signs the recent Reno missed a few items - rotting wood siding on the patio, door frames in desperate need of paint, antiquainted AC unit.   The daily hotel bill was about twice the rate I paid at BW properties elsewhere in S California. This place is priced high but fails to deliver. You can do so much better elsewhere for less money.
Manager Response: We are deeply sorry that you had a bad experience at our beautiful hotel, unfortunately we do not have control over traffic during the day, but during the night it reduces by 90%.  We apologize for the inconvenience it may have caused you, hope that you give us one more chance in the future to provide you with our excellent service and phenomenal ocean view rooms!

Summary: Great value!  I live locally in Laguna niguel (4 miles away) and i came here with husband to stay by doheny beach.  We had an ocean view room and it was fantastic!  I travel for business, so I am pretty picky about where I will stay, and I loved this place!  I wish we had stayed here sooner, it was great!   Definitely will stay there again! Thank you to John, the front desk guy, he was really accommodating and nice!

The ocean front rooms aren‚Äôt exactly ocean front. The view is there but there is also a street and heavily used train tracks. The chairs on the deck have you view right at the bar rail was hard to see over and take in the beautiful ocean. The rooms was perfect but I think I paid too much for the view I could have booked a regular room if I was just looking for a great room.

This hotel is located on the southern tip of the town on the Coast Highway, across the Amtrak tracks and the Capistrano beach park. There is a pedestrian walkway located near the hotel to easily access the beach. The parking garage is under ground with an elevator to take you to one of the 3 floors. This hotel was different from other BW's. It was all outdoors with small patio gardens interspersed around the property, making it more like a beach villa. Our room faced the Coastal Highway and had a balcony where we watched the sunset. The sound from the highway and train was minimal with the doors closed. It was an unusually chilly evening, so the desk clerk offered us a space heater in case we needed it.  The continental breakfast was standard BW with a mix of hot and cold food.

Just like the title says, very clean and comfortable, very helpful front desk. Within 15 minute walk you can get to the marina mostly restaurants and some small shops, the beach is there also. Theres a couple of fast food places across the street. Out by the jetty there's several pick nik areas also great to just hang out n watch paddle boarders kayakers n small boats cruise by.  Theres a small coastal museum top of the hill n has trails overlooking the ocean and a great picture spot of the Dans Point Harbor.

John was very helpful and welcoming upon our arrival, he even took time to greet my five-year-old, that is very important for me.  We experienced an issue where the heater wasn‚Äôt working in the unit, I do have to say that it rained the last couple of days and being in front of the beach, it was very cold in the room. It only took one phone call and John was with a space heater in less than one minute knocking at the door, that‚Äôs excellent service! The Internet speed was fast and we were also given discount cards for a few restaurants I have at walking distance. We went to Olamendi‚Äôs and we enjoyed our food. I recommend this hotel and I‚Äôm sure John will make anyone feel welcome. I‚Äôm looking forward to going again The Internet speed was fast and we were also given discount cards

Service was friendly and helpful. New management. Discounts for nearby restaurants. I've been coming back to this lovely place annually for 15 years. Interior gardens and fountains gave it a peaceful ambience, now marred by a strobe-flashing light on one statue. They apparently knew my room's built-in heater didn't work but gave it to me anyway. (After I complained, they offered to move me to another room, but the electric space heater they supplied worked fine.) The main view of the ocean was taped off without explanation, so no seated sunset views. At least two water leaks in common areas not fully repaired. Looks like the rooms and office have been repainted and refurnished. No king room luggage stand or other place to keep an open suitcase. Toilet paper was the thinnest.

When we travel, I always try to book a room with a whirlpool tub. Such is the reason for us staying here in Dana Point, and it‚Äôs well worth the price. Only drawback is the lack of inroom electronic chargers, which many other Best Western‚Äôs have incorporated into their amenities. Usually there are USB ports in the lamps and desktop lamps, not so here.

Summary Heading: My husband's birthday was ALMOST ruined
Summary: After researching a month before my husband's birthday, I finally found and paid for our stay at Best Weatern at Dana Point. I was leary because sometimes the rooms are not exactly what they look like on the photos when you don't book directly through the hotel.   Our trip was amazing until the last night. The morning front desk person (Brody) was AWESOME! The night time front desk guy was very nonchalant. No interaction and always on his cell phone. Well after arriving back from dinner, our room phone rang and he told my husband to park on the street... Which is extemely dark and dangerous to cross or pay $10. We totally had forgotten about the $10 parking fee and so we moved the car. He then said there was no credit card on file and he needed one in case of damages. Don't get

My daughter and I had a whale watch trip out of Dana Point scheduled for the morning of Aug. 5. To avoid battling morning traffic, I wanted to stay in Dana Point the night before.   After looking at reviews and photos, I chose the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea. I booked the double queen room directly from the hotel‚Äôs website four months before our visit. I paid extra for an ocean view room. At $225 before tax for a double queen room, it was a splurge, but I thought it would be well worth the price to watch the sun set over the ocean from our hotel room balcony, and to walk to the beach. Of all the hotels I‚Äôd booked for our Southern California trip, I had looked forward to staying at this one the most.  When we arrived, I noticed the outside grounds seemed a bit
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review and share your experience.  It's disheartening to learn you did not enjoy your stay and the room was not properly cleaned or maintained according to the high standards of our housekeeping and maintenance staff.  Reviews like yours are extremely helpful in our ambition to continuously improve and I hope you'll return to see how we grow.  John A.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel right on the Ocean
Summary: Great, clean and extremely reasonable hotel with the Ocean right across the street.  Trains do run across the street but they didn't bother us at all.  Rooms were very comfortable...Great location and great price !

My wife and I go to Dana point and San Clemente  when we can. We love the area. We stayed at in by the sea. From the front desk people to the house maids they where all great. We will be back. Thank you all for making our stay comfortable and enjoyable.

Excellent rooms and A plus service from all staff. A small facility just across from Doheny Beach and ocean. Very good breakfast and just the right amount of selections. Room was clean and stocked daily. Bed was extremely comfortable. Just be sure to make reservations at BW toll free number if wanting to use points for free night stay. Cannot use points if reservation made at hotel.

Affordable, clean, great service, terrific views, great location. Located on the Pacific Coast Highway right between San Clemente and Dana Point. Easy and cheap Uber ride to anywhere you would want to go.

The hotel was in a good location. No pool and the Hot tub was out of order. The air conditioning didn't work at all, we had to leave the windows open all night. None of the windows have screens so bugs can come in the room. The TV wasn't plugged in and we had to contact the front desk to resolve. One of the cable box cables was missing and had to be replaced. We did enjoy the location of the hotel but that is about it. We also found dirty socks in the closet that looked liked they'd been there a while.

Will definitely stay here again. Good service, breakfast and location. We will recommend this for family and friends.  Rooms are newly modern and upt to date desigm.  Breakfast is enough to start your day activity.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing about your time with us. We appreciate your rating and are glad you enjoyed our hotel. We take pride in providing our guests with everything they need for a great stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We are Best Western elite members and this hotel does not provide  adequate accommodations.  Night time check-in makes you think your checking in to a motel 6. Agent was rude and unkind   Room had excessive noise from above,A/C and TV not working properly. We did not receive basic accommodations for what we paid for

Summary Heading: Good Time at BW Dana Point Inn-by-The-Sea
Summary: Only stayed one night at this hotel, but it was nice to be right across from the ocean.  The breakfast area is small, but overall the staff are very friendly and the hotel was good.  The location is what would draw someone to this area.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing about your time with us. We appreciate your rating and are glad you enjoyed our hotel. We take pride in providing our guests with everything they need for a great stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This hotel is rundown and not worth the money they charge! The steps to our room were rusted, the clock in the room did not work, the towels were paper thin, the shower did not drain, and the paint was peeling on the doors. The staff was helpful and the breakfast food choices were adequate, but with only 5 tables, there was not nearly enough room for all of the guests in the small room. We sincerely alert future guests to check out other hotels in the area before selecting this one!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing about your time with us. We appreciate your rating and are glad you enjoyed our hotel. We take pride in providing our guests with everything they need for a great stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The staff was very helpful with any request I asked.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  Easy access to enter the property and easy exit.  Wonder view of the ocean right across the street.  Will definitely stay again.  Close to anything I needed.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing about your time with us. We appreciate your rating and are glad you enjoyed our hotel. We take pride in providing our guests with everything they need for a great stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great view but not worth the cost
Summary: We decided to pay extra for an ocean view.  The view was great but accommodations were very average for $400+ per night with tax and fees.  The bathroom was tiny.  We are thin people but could hardly squeeze in to the shower/toilet room. I have never seen a room so small. Marilyn at the front desk was cordial and welcoming when we arrived.  Be careful on the stairs - they are uneven heights.  There is a nice area to walk next to the beach and the trains did not seem too loud at night. I did not see a pool, but we were not looking for one.  The jacuzzi  was leaking, so not filled part of the weekend.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing about your time with us. We appreciate your rating and are glad you enjoyed our hotel. We take pride in providing our guests with everything they need for a great stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: First time walking in to the room (we booked 4, but one smelled like vomit) and we knew its a vomit smell.  We asked to be moved OR to have a refund.  The manager said she didn't have another room and she would not refund us. She also refused to admit there was a vomit smell, but it was very obvious to all of us.

Clean room and comfortable bed. Breakfast was delicious and many options for breakfast. Young lady at front desk helped us during the breakfast. Big room with nice view. Ocean very close to hotel and restaurant few minutes walk distance. Helpful people work there and ready to help any minute.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing about your time with us. We appreciate your rating and are glad you enjoyed our hotel. We take pride in providing our guests with everything they need for a great stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Young lady was very nice to us and we enjoyed nice view. Walking distance to ocean and room was remodeled. A lot of restaurants close distance.. Will come back next year again and we hope to get room with whirlpool.
Manager Response: Dear Harold, thank you for the great review! We‚Äôre so happy you loved our place.

Summary: This is a pretty nice hotel. We started one night and had no complaints. The beds were comfy, the hotel clean. They seem to be in the midst of remodeling, our room still smelled faintly of fresh paint but it wasn't disturbing at all. Staff was pleasant, the breakfast spread was pretty broad, my daughter was thrilled to see waffles. Access to the beach is a short walk down to a crosswalk but then there is a very large train overpass to climb up and down to access the beach by foot. Plenty of food in easy walking distance for dinner. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,Thank you so much for your kind words. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us

Summary: The location was great‚Äîalthough I did mix up this Best Western with the other one in Dana Point!.The young woman with the accent (Russian‚ÄîI think) was absolutely wonderful‚Äînot only did she help me find some of the light switches that did not see‚Äîlater that night‚Äîshe went out of her way to help me try to fix my broken eyeglasses!!!  Even though it was advertised as a courtyard/garden view‚Äîit had a partial ocean view!  Even though the hotel doesn‚Äôt have a restaurant‚Äîthere are plenty of options close by just up the PCH‚Äîif you are not in the mood to eat out try the Ralph‚Äôs grocery store‚Äîthey have a nice deli.  There was some renovations going on‚Äîbut I did not experience any problems or interruptions in sleep.  Also‚Äîif you are lucky (and the weather cooperates‚Äîyou might catch a nice
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us. We hope to see you again!

Summary: I went during the off season so there were no crowds. There is construction going on at the hotel so don't expect to sleep in past 8am. I had problems with my heating unit and they didn't have a maintenance guy to come into fix it so they did offer me a heater. Talking to everyone I met at the hotel, it seems like everyone was experiencing this issue. Great location. The beach is across the street. If you go off season, make sure to get yourself food before 9pm, because most restaurants close at 10pm. And there is no restaurant on the premise.

Summary: I decided to try this hotel during the winter months to take advantage of the low room rates. If I liked it I would book it again for the summer. The hotel is in a great location in Capistrano Beach. The beach is very clean and scenic in this area. Check in was smooth and efficient and the attendant was very friendly. When I arrived at my room I noticed that it had a musty smell. I also noticed how dated it was. I don't think any improvements or upgrades have been made here since it opened. My bed was fairly comfortable and there was a fairly good sized patio with ocean views. Those were the only two redeeming amenities. In the morning I went for the free breakfast and it was awful. The breakfast consisted of tasteless sausage and eggs. I had yogurt that seemed to be on the

Summary Heading: Amazing view, great room, awesome price!

We had a spa bath which was also amazing with the jets it was so relaxing! Parking was a breeze, didn't have to pay extra. Beautiful location, beautiful property, beautiful view! My husband and l plan on staying here again. This trip was for our 21st wedding anniversary and it was great!

Steven is a very friendly and helpful guy. We hope our next stay will be as before.

When one books a hotel stay, the price is presumed to include certain basic amenities that we all require, such as cleanliness,  room temperature controls that work and drains that drain.  We didn‚Äôt get all that. The heater didn‚Äôt work, and only a thin blanket covered the bed.  My bathrobe and coat became makeshift blankets, inadequate at best. Summary: Avoid disappointment and Avoid this motel at all cost.  By no means an Inn. Hardly by the sea.  Unless you consider a 4 lane busy HI-Way, active railroad tracks and a 6' high chain-link fence part of the ocean front.  Any beach access is more than a mile away.

Walking distance to beach.  Food ok for a continental breakfast.  Rooms clean and nice.  Booked an upper floor suite but was placed on third floor.  Restaurant closed for remodel.  They charged for parking when we have handicap and that should not be.  They don‚Äôt give parking options

Summary: We were totally disappointed in this hotel. The photos on the website looked great but our room was shabby. It seemed like the room hadn't been occupied for an extended period - it smelled musty and didn't feel clean. Although we overlooked the ocean, which was lovely, the traffic noise was so loud that we couldn't leave the doors open or sit outside on the balcony. The sound worked on the TV but there was no picture. We ended up driving home to San Diego instead of staying in Dana Point for the night.

The photos on the hotel website do not accurately represent the property. The room was worn and slightly shabby. It appeared to have sat unused for an extended period of time and smelled musty. We had an oceanview room but the traffic was so loud that we couldn't leave the doors open or sit outside on the balcony. The TV sound worked but there was no picture. The hot tub/spa was out of order. We ended up leaving early and driving back home to San Diego instead of spending the night as planned. Given the general condition of this hotel and room, I felt it was incredibly overpriced.

We had a problem with no sound on some tv channels. We reported the problem 4 times. We were told the cable company would have to reset the system. Four days later the problem still existed. I got the impression that neither the staff or management cared.

The room itself was decent, the included breakfast was good, though small and in a tiny room.  What ruined the experience, and ultimately why I‚Äôd never, ever stay there again, was that my wife was woken in the middle of the night covered in ants! Talk about one of your worst nightmares coming true! I guess its good they weren‚Äôt spiders, but still, ants all over the bed, in her hair, everywhere! They were even in our suitcases when we got home.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback of your recent stay, and we are sorry to hear that it did not exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we hope you will give us another chance and stay with us again. -Best Western Hotels & Resort

Summary: We stayed four nights in room 112 overlooking the ocean.  We stayed here because it was only 1 mile from family we were visiting.  The location is very convenient to San Clemente, Dana Point and Laguna.  Room was clean, comfortable and quiet.  Even though there is the PCH and railroad tracks between the hotel and the beach, it is a two minute walk to get there.  The noise from traffic and trains was NOT noticeable, contrary to other reviews.  The insulated glass windows keep most of it out and the trains do not run continuously.  In fact, they do not run at night.  And besides, we like trains - they are short commuter runs that last maybe 10 seconds max.  Also, the cleaning staff did an excellent job.  The breakfast is mediocre, hence the 4 stars - we ate elsewhere after the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your stay! I am glad that we were able accommodate a room move for you. We hope that you will consider us for your next trip!  Sincerely,

Summary: The hotel was nice, calm, and a has a beautiful view of the ocean. It is right on the Pacific Coast Highway so if you get an ocean view room, you can probably hear all of the traffic. We had a partial ocean view, which was more removed from the highway itself. We had an issue with our safe and the staff was very quick to troubleshoot with us. Our one complaint was that we could hear the movement of the people in the room above us. We head walking around and getting on and off the bed. We didn't feel like switching rooms so didn't mention it to the hotel staff until checkout. I asked if there were people above us the first night and not the second night because we could hear them the first night but didn't hear anything the second night. I was right and the manager just shrugged
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your stay with us and for sharing your experience with other travelers.Please rest assured we have addressed this with the team to ensure we improve on this.  Kind regards,

Summary: BW Plus Dana Point by the Sea was a huge dissappointment. Beach was only visible from the outside porch. Highway traffic could be heard from the room all night, even with the doors and windows closed. Windows were dirty. Basement garage parking had no security and transients were roaming around. Front desk was closed when we arrived. Very disappointing. We booked the room for 2 nights and left after 24 hours.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your recent stay with us did not exceed your expectations. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to make improvements to offer guests a better experience in the future. We hope you will give us another chance and stay with us again. -Best Western Hotels & Resorts

Summary: Clean, quiet and calming atmosphere. Other than Being right on the busy 101 Highway. The  Ocean was literally right across the street. However there are train tracks that you cannot cross.  It‚Äôs a great location to visit the Dana Point area. Close to restaurants and groceries if you need them. Our room was very clean and had a little dry sink area with the microwave  and refrigerator! The room also was spacious and the bathroom/seeing closet area were laid out nicely. Would definitely stay here again and recommend. The staff was accommodating and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your stay with us and for sharing your experience with other travelers. Please rest assured we have addressed this with the team to ensure we improve on this.  Kind regards,

Summary: I was attending a wedding at the Ritz Carlton and could not pay there rates. I ended up here and was very pleasantly surprised. Clean, trendy , quiet with great service at a very reasonable rate for its location. I was even greeted in the morning downstairs with a complementary mini breakfast buffet. The very nice gentleman running the counter made me homemade waffles!!! I believe Fernando?

Stayed here for 3 nights,staff were helpfull as we got checked in early. hotel is situated on the pch1with 3 lanes of traffic in each direction right out front, the room was big with a sofa area and a good size  bedroom and bathroom. Down size was the lack of sound proofing it took me 3 nights to get used to it then we left. There not a great deal to do at Dana point there are bars and restaurants at at the Marina but get bizzy early evening, but worth a visit. If you decide to go to Catalina island on the boat from dana point make sure you book in advance. Hotel has Laundry facilaties which is handy so we are going home with mainly clean clothes.

Summary Heading: I expected better for the price
Summary: Not really in Dana Point. Several miles south. Beach not as nice here. Had to cross busy street and RR tracks to get to beach. Most of the staff was nice and friendly. GM 'Jack' was rude and unhelpful - a jerk. Room was clean overall but somewhat old and felt used. No pool and no morning paper. Breakfast was OK with the usual cereals and breads.
