We arrived with special circumstances and the hotel manager and staff were more than accommodating.  They took care of everything to help us enjoy our stay.  The room was perfect: roomy, nice cathedral ceilings on the top floor room, beautiful deck looking out at the ocean.  The common grounds include locations to lounge and enjoy the weather and view. We will be back and thank you again.

Cute little hotel with very friendly staff!  Although the parking spaces aren't huge, it was free parking, which was delightful.  Most of the other hotels in Dana Point charges for parking.  It is located in an easy walking distance to a few restaurants, but isn't in the hub of Dana Point activity.  You need to cross a bridge to access the beach, but it's worth it since the parking at the hotel is free.

I enjoyed a lot my 2 nights here. Wonderful staff and very nice room! Breakfast was very good too. The outdoor jacuzzi was great. The beach is within a short walk (across the highway). There is a terrace on the 2nd floor with a large table where you can eat outside or have a cup of coffee while you enjoy the view.

We stayed 3 nights and Betsy was a gem.  She kindly upgraded us to the best room she had for our midweek stay when she had light reservations.  Room #202 has fantastic views of Doheney Beach and the Pacific Ocean from the private balcony.  The vaulted ceiling and kitchenette area really added to the charm of this well-appointed room.  The location means you'll hear some PCH traffic and the Amtrak, but honestly we slept so well here, it was hardly noticeable.

Summary Heading: The Old Un in Dana Point
Summary: The Man in charge was extremely helpful and attentive. The breakfast room was small, but we were there during President's Holiday Weekend and the Hotel was full, there wasn't any problem. The room was large and the beds, comfortable.  The Hotel is on a main road and at time, it was very busy. The only way to get across the road and the railway line, to the beach, was by using a bridge which would be a problem for elderly people.  The trains stopped running late evening

Enjoyed our one night stay! Wonderful staff and very nice room! Walking distance to restaurants and even has a little jacuzzi. Would definitely return. Just be prepared for the trains at night since the train tracks are right across the street.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, helpful staff. Freeway and muzak noise.
Summary: Very helpful management.  Great location -- near Ocean Institute if kids are on an overnight from school.  Was able to work using well-working in-room WiFi.  Did have to go to coffee place to escape the Muzak that I think is there to cover freeway noise, but was still quite loud from inside my room.

would stay here again.  Proprieters were friendly and accommodating.  Location and view were awesome.  The breakfast provided was simple but good.  There were several good restaurants all within walking distance.

Stayed here prior to catching ferry to Catalina. Adorable hotel. Well maintained property. Owners very nice. Overall great experience. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance   Perfect place to stay if you need somewhere to stay close to the beach which is across the street and to  Dana Point Harbor.

Summary Heading: Solid 2.5 star hotel, not so sure about 'PLUS'
Summary: We booked based on reviews. The rooms are fairly updated, quite clean, great TV.  The front desk staff were nice. Outside areas of hotel are pretty worn looking & the 'breakfast' room is the smallest I've ever seen! Disappointing food. We've stayed in several BEST WESTERN PLUS hotels and I'm not sure what the criteria is, but this is not a PLUS in my opinion.

Fernando and his team are most accommodating. I always look forward to staying at this Best Western plus by the sea. I love the made-to-order waffles and of course the ocean views. And if you've forgotten something the host will do his best to supply what you need. Simply outstanding!

Summary Heading: BEST EVER!  LOVED our Stay!  Staff so FRIENDLY!  GREAT Location!
Summary: I was moving cross country from NC to CA and my parents needed a place to stay until their flight back.  I choose this because it's proximity to the beach, my friend's place, and price.  I liked the cheerful colors online. The stay was phenomenal and way beyond my expectation. The management, Fernando and his family were so nice and called us by name.  They personally made us waffles each morning. They were so helpful when I had to park a 26' moving van in their oversized lot. Hotel is within walking distance of great restaurants and bars.  I will use them again and highly recommend them!   -Lori B

Summary Heading: Fabulous staff in a great location
Summary: Serving as the launching pad for a multi-night trip to Catalina, the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea offered far more than expected with excellent service from a professional (and likeable) staff. The breakfast was hot and filling. The room was comfortable and clean, and after we left, someone called to let us know that we'd forgotten a charger. (It was set aside and held for our return back to mainland.) In every encounter, the staff seemed to go above and beyond. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed one night on our way up the coast.  We had a partial view of ocean, which was right across the street.  Joined other residents on second story terrace to watch sunset.  Lovely experience.  Close to Dana Point restaurants for dinner.  Good breakfast and WiFi.  Owners were more than accommodating. Highy recommend.

I have to start out by saying I did not head to this hotel in a good frame of mind. I had to gotten it through Hotwire and found that I paid more through Hotwire for a "Hot-Deal" than I would have if I had called the hotel directly. Needless to say, I am done with Hotwire.  That said, let me tell you a little bit about the Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea. It is an older property that has been very well-maintained. There are about 30 rooms which are comfortable and generally quiet. It is right across the street from the Dana Point Beach, but also the railroad tracks for the California Coaster.  Our room was quite dim, but it was very comfortable and the bed was decent. There was a small breakfast buffet every day, and the staff was very nice and helpful.  The best thing about this

Summary Heading: Fabulous views, Tranquil setting, Extraordinary staff
Summary: Step out of your room, and you hear lovely, tranquil music as you view the beautiful garden, and the ocean. Sit on the balcony or in the hot tub and watch the sunset. This place is amazing and quite a value. Not too far from town, great restaurants within walking distance, the beach across the PCH, The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms large and comfortable. Looking forward to next visit.

Wow- the service here has been incredible. The couple at the front desk are so nice and helpful. We are traveling with a toddler and a baby and they offered to help us make waffles since our hands were full. They also asked when we preferred housekeeping! The place is clean and has a really nice vibe. And the location is awesome! Rooms are clean and well stocked.

wonderful hotel, great views, lovely music in the courtyard, spacious rooms, friendly staff. How many times can you sit in a hot tub next to the PCH and watch the sunset into the ocean? This is where to go if you want to completely unwind and relax. Great restaurants and beach within walking distance.

Summary Heading: Awesome stay, quiet, comfortable, great location!
Summary: Just what we needed on our trip along the coast! Great room (ask for 303 for the best view of the ocean), bed was super comfy, and the hotel is tucked away from city noise (but only a 2 min drive along the beautiful coast). Beach is right across the street and there are a few restaurants two doors down. Good for couples, good for business trips (we were on both). Special thanks to Steve who checked us in and offered excellent, professional and friendly service. Happy to highly recommend this spot...We will definitely be back! :D Couple from Auckland New Zealand.

I had business in Irvine but wanted to be by the ocean. I searched and found this hotel for around the same rate as a room near the business I was in the area for. I thought from the map that this place was a block or so from the ocean. When I arrived I was very pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel was only separated from Capistrano beach by the Pacific Coast Highway. You need only to walk out onto the balcony to enjoy a magnificent view of the sunset.   My room was clean, quiet and well kept. Beds were comfortable and plenty of pillows. Parking is included, safe and covered. The staff are friendly and helpful. Standard continental breakfast fare is served in the morning. All things considered, I found this hotel to be an outstanding value for the money. There are three

I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  The staff was incredibly friendly,  even turning on the heart for me in my room before my arrival because it was chilly that night.  They courtyard was beautifully decorated for the holidays.  Free parking in this area was a pleasant surprise,  as well. Rooms were basic,  but clean.

Right in front of the ocean, Awesome view, very nice hotel, very friendly service and just a great place to relax ,enjoy and take in the view . Totally recommend this Best Western! James from Coronado~

The motel is clean, comfortable and they serve a great breakfast. I recommend this motel for your stay. The water is nearby and there are a number of restaurants within walking distance. Also there are shops

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for a Night!
Summary: We stayed here the day after Thanksgiving. It was a nice place to stay! A 2 minute walk away, there's a few restaurants and a sushi place that was delicious. Our room had a hot tub in it. It was kinda weird and had dead ants in it. We didn't use it, except to wash the sand off from the beach (which is across the street).   There were 2 picture frames hung above the bed. I went to sit on the edge of the bed when we first walked into the room and the picture frame fell. Thank God I wasn't sleeping or there wasn't an earthquake because my face would've probably been a mess if that had fallen on me!   It was a comfy bed and the front desk was very helpful and nice!   I would stay here again, but I would remove the picture frames for my peace of mind while sleeping.

Our room had a partial ocean view.  You're right on PCH but you really can't hear the street noise once w/ the windows and doors closed.  Excellent staff.  Well maintained.  Great price for water view, free parking, and free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff goes out of way.
Summary: We have stayed here several times before.  Thus far every room is a tiny bit different as far as size/view.    This time we were in room 301 which is top floor end unit with partial ocean view.  Room was very spacious with a king bed, refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot.  We also had a window in the back with a view of the green hill.  Our room had a jacuzzi in the bedroom plus a tub/shower in the bathroom.  I will not use a hotel jacuzzi so would have much preferred a fireplace.  While the front rooms have better views of the ocean, we preferred this one because it was quiet.  While we did not have our "own" balcony, we did use the large balcony just across our walkway.

Basic room.  Helpful staff.  You're average hotel.  We only stopped to be close to Dana Point in order to catch the ferry to Catalina Island. Very convenient to that.  The hot tub is right on the highway-I'm sure for the ocean view but it was noisy and awkward.  The roof top would've been better. The hotel served is purpose.

Great service by Manager, Steve Wong.  Super location right across the street from Capistrano Beach.   There was a wedding party taking up most of the hotel, but they were well controlled by the staff, with no noise at all to disturb our sleep.

Summary Heading: Trip to So. Cal. for grandaughter'r birthday
Summary: We stay at this hotel every year to visit our daughter and granddaughter.  The staff is always friendly and we get the same room every time.  The view is wonderful and we get to see the sunset every night.  We will definitely stay here again next year!

Summary Heading: Pleasant Place to Spend a few days
Summary: A nice place close to the ocean which was the main draw for our stay.  Pleasant staff.  Adequate rooming accommodations.  Not a new hotel but has been kept neat and clean.    Breakfast room is small but seating was available during the time we were enjoying breakfast.  Not a large choice for breakfast..

We had a really great stay at this Best Western.  The staff were extremely kind and helpful, the complimentary breakfast was better than most I've had, and it's right across from the ocean.  We were able to walk to dinner and enjoy the hot tub after.  Will definitely be coming back if the opportunity arises!

a family based perfect getaway right off the ocean  there is even a bridge to cross to the pebble beach  place is perfect close to great shops marina just a short hop skip up  coast to newport or right there akll that Dana point has to offe   the sleepy little town san clemente with pier and beaches all right there

Extremely clean, Staff very friendly and accommodating.  Love the size and d√©cor of the rooms. Breakfast was above the normal complimentary breakfast.  Will continue to stay here on my trips to area!!! Would recommend to family and friends in a heartbeat!

Pros: 1. the beach is beautiful 2. bed is very comfortable Cons: 1. staff is sexist and rude 2. place has needed a renovation since 1992 3. ants all over our jacuzzi tub 4. freeway traffic directly outside the balcony, noisy all day

Summary Heading: Dana Pt. Inn by the Sea
Summary: Had a very pleasant stay at this Best Western property.  Right across the highway from Doheny Beach and right next to a couple of restaurants.  Only thing lacking was a good spot nearby for coffee.  Breakfast tip: Stacks in downtown Dana Pt.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels we've stayed at near the beach
Summary: We usually stay at Holiday Inn Express as we are platinum members, but we had good luck with another Best Western Plus, so decided to give this a try.  It's right across from the beach and train tracks, but the train noise was NOT an issue EVER! My husband is a train buff, so we enjoyed sitting out side on our balcony over looking the beach.  It was very quiet and the rooms were great.  Clean, modern, bed very comfortable, and had micro, frig, and coffee maker.  Bath was nice sized. Both receptionist and owner were very very helpful for anything we needed, made great recommendations, and treated us great.  We will make it a point to stay here if we are ever in the area again.  We were in room #202 and it was fantastic!!!!

This is an older property but it is clean and comfortable. It would be nice if they added additional vending machines and ice machines. The lighting is dim and the internet isn't the best but the staff does a nice job and the view is beautiful. We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: The most memorable vacation we had :)
Summary: The most memorable vacation we had. Fernando, Amy, Stephen were very hospitable to us. We felt like family there. Great location, clean, beautiful gardens and view. We highly recommended this place to other friends and family. We will be back :)

We had planned a trip to Southern California to visit family and friends.  I must say that or stay in Dana Point at the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea was our most pleasurable.  It is located directly across the highway from the Pacific Ocean in Dana Point.  The sunrises and sunsets were lovely!  The manager of the hotel was such a friendly and considerate host.  Every morning, he would make waffles for each one of the guests.  You didn't have to wait or ask him.  He came to you and asked if you would like a waffle, then start making it for you!  They keep the breakfast bar stocked with everything you would need!  The manager even got us a map and helped us plan our trip beyond Dana Point.  I think that is going above and beyond for your customer's needs!  We would

Outstanding value in Dana Point - right across from the beach with easy access to the business district and freeways.  Friendly and professinal staff - Mr. Fernando Wang should be recognized for his great customer service.

Summary Heading: Dana Point Inn by the Sea
Summary: Nice family run hotel. Across from the ocean and the train tracks.The hotel is located on a busy street but the views of the ocean are so beautiful. The rooms are a little musty smelling, other then that we had a wonderful and relaxing time. The waffles in the morning were very good. Would recommend.

Summary Heading: Great Family operated hotel right on the Ocean
Summary: Every service was as or above expected.  Friendly, courteous front desk staff.  Nice clean room with panoramic ocean view.  We stayed (2) nights just to get away.  Inn is easy to find, free parking was ample and adequately protected (under hotel).  Free Wifi worked well and was simple to logon.  Breakfast was ready and decent.  Hotel is near the over-the-highway walking bridge that takes you to Doheney State beach.  Several restaurants, very close to hotel.  Sunset views from balcony were just the ticket!  Affordable rate with good value.

Summary Heading: Good Location on Rote but noisy
Summary: We stayed at Dana Point as a midway point between Santa Monica and San Diego on our PCH roadtrip. Room was a bit noisy with the road and trainline, but it was comfortable and service was very good. Good parking lot below hotel and breakfast was good.

We stayed at this hotel during our trip for a wedding in Laguna Beach, and it was great! This place was so quaint and private! We felt like we were there by ourselves! The staff was so friendly, and the morning breakfast that they offer was better then other little hotels we have stayed at!  The owner even offered to make me waffles!  This little place is on the ocean, and was very reasonably priced! We will definitely stay here again!

We were in a King bed "partial" ocean view room on the 3rd floor. We were there on a Tuesday and Wednesday night and it was nice and quiet. The free breakfast is what you'd expect for free. I can't eat gluten and it was mostly pastries, toast, bagels and cereal. The hard boiled eggs had literally no flavor. I guess I'm used to eating high quality organic eggs, these were definitely not. But if you can eat that type of thing you're good to go. There is a table on a balcony overlooking the water. We picked up a pizza one night and sat there to eat and watch the sunset. We live in Nevada so any ocean view is a good one for us!

the room was very large. we had balcony.seaside.It can be very noicy because of the train and the highway passing.breakfast was sufficient,but not especially amazing. price to high .to get to the beach, you have to pass e bridge (2oom)not very easy for people with problems to go.The beach in front of the hotel is not very clean.The hotel is ok for few nights,but not to pass long holidays.

We recently spent 3 nights at the Best Western PLUS in Dana Point.  Was the best run hotel we have stayed at in years.  The entire staff was very helpful and friendly.  The rooms were clean and quiet, ours had a balcony with table and chairs for outdoor dining and gorgeous view of the Ocean. Beautiful courtyards with classical music and seating areas throughout.  Were pleasantly surprised at how awesome this hotel was and we are looking forward to returning next year.

What a nice Best Western to stay at. We had family camping at Doheny State beach and this hotel was within walking distance.  Our room had a nice balcony with ocean view.  The free breakfast was great . And Fernando the owner was so sweet to help us carefully make our Belgian waffles. We also have a full size truck, extended cab and all the parking is marked "compact". The owners son was so nice to help us make sure we had a place to park by using a cone to mark our spot. We didn't want to block any one in.  The flat screen was big but we had a bit of a challenge getting the remote to work . You had to sit close to the tv and point it.  I would totally stay there again. We stayed in Vista at a hotel back in July , for the same price we paid here ,and the Vista Inn was nothing

This is a smaller, family run Best Western. They were very nice and very helpful with our early check in. The room was large, with a jacuzzi tub. I had only reserved a standard king, but didn't mind. The bed was very comfortable. We didn't try the breakfast, but it smelled good, and noticed many guests partaking of it, on the seats around the relaxing courtyard. I highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I had the most amazing time in Dana Point.  A great town, not trendy or snobby, whatsoever.  Great restaurants in the area.  The hotel and staff were so kind and gracious.  Fernando and his wife were the sweetest.  Hotel was very clean, continental breakfast was fresh and yummy, comfortable bed, all directly across the street from the shore with a beautiful view of the sunset.  Great memories made there for sure.  We will most definitely be making it a yearly trip, staying at the same spot.  THANK YOU, FERNANDO!!  :)

Let me start by saying, this was a business trip. It was a great location for my purpose as I could walk to my business on hand. When I first walked in wasn't quite sure, as I am used to staying at the big hotels with much activity.I was greeted nicely filled out the necessary paperwork, which that was different too, brought back the ol motel days, DL,make of car etc. they have underground parking no charge for the first car $10.00 for second car.The owner Fernando gave me a spacious room that faced the Ocean and the fresh ocean breeze crossed through my room. Very friendly family owned and operated Fernando wife makes breakfast real scrambled eggs none of that powdered stuff, real pork sausage and Belgium waffles upon request so they are fresh and hot! Very clean rooms with

Summary Heading: Good Value in a Pricey location
Summary: My sisters and I wanted to take a little California trip for a few days and decided on the Laguna Beach area.  This hotel fit our price range nicely.  The staff was extremely nice.  The breakfast was adequate. The rooms are comfortable. The location was just beautiful.  Our four days couldn't have been filled with more fun.  Exploring beaches, hiking, whale watching, San Juan Capistrano, the  Festival of the Masters in Laguna Beach, lovely dinners.

Absolutely wonderful hotel and staff, can't thank them enough for their hospitality, would recommend to everyone, and would book again if I ever come back to Dana Point.  Rooms a great size and so very clean.

The manager, Fernando Wang, was one of the most helpful and gracious hosts we have had the pleasure to meet. Not only did we get a great room but he suggested two restaurants that were withing walking distance.  Grizzly

Summary Heading: Just book it, clean and comfortable!
Summary: This hotel is IMMACULATE. I am a little obsessive about cleanliness and I was very comfortable here. The furniture and set up were comfortable and the room sizes were small but comfortable - not cramped at all.  The breakfast options were excellent. WIFI was surprisingly good. Short walk to the beach, but it was rocky under my feet. Short drive to Salt Creek Beach is worth it.  The owners are very customer-service oriented, they care about their property which is very comfortable, picturesque, and welcoming.  There are places to stand or sit and work and watch the waves (I took advantage of this before the trains and traffic in the morning, it was wonderful).  My son left his jacket and I received an email about it from them - this is a first for me.  There are fast food places

Great hotel.  Spacious with a nice balcony.  We went out one night and ordered pizza the next.  Had a fridge and a microwave, major plus on a vacation!  Made it easy to save money.  Would definitely go back!

I just got back from 3 days at this hotel and can't say enough good about it.  The location was perfect, with Doheny Beach right across the road and everything you need within a few blocks.  There's a highway and railroad track between the hotel and the beach, but once the patio door was closed, neither I nor my grandkids heard a thing.  It's a non-issue.  The room was spacious, well-appointed and spotlessly clean.  The bathroom looked to have been recently updated and everything was in perfect working order.  The beds and bedding are really comfortable.  The only "issue" we had was a burnt out bulb in the patio light which was solved quickly by a call to the office.  The breakfast was about what you'd expect, but had the added benefit that the waffle batter is made by the

The location was great. Straight across from the beach. A short walk to get over the highway to the water. The breakfast area was small and cozy but never got crowded. Everyone we met there was friendly, staff and guests alike. The staff was very helpful and work very hard to make your stay comfortable. The room was very big with a nice view out onto the water. (We were 3rd floor) And opening the front door and back window got a lovely sea breeze going through the room to keep it cool. We barely needed the air con.   The room had a combo of new areas and old/tired areas. For the most part it was good and it looked like a working progress of making things better a bit at a time. A bit of a smell when we first arrived from what seemed like old cigarette smoke. It quickly aired out

Our stay at the hotel was very pleasant. You will like the view and the sound of the ocean and the trains passing by. The hotel is on Coast Highway so the traffic noise takes awhile getting used to. Once you close your door you won't hear any noise! The room is well appointed and comfortable!

Although it costs a little more, since moving away from the ocean over 12 years ago, it is always nice to look out the front window of our room and see the ocean! Steve and Fernando are always pleasant to deal with and keep the hotel in great shape with nice personal touches of tiles with sea shells and great overhead music.

This is a great little hotel. Fernando is a gracious host. Family run and it shows. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The property is clean and they play classical music in the common areas during the day. The room was quiet as well. All in this is a great value, location and we just stayed there for a week.

Very Hot weekend and hotel stay was perfect with A/C.  Across from Ocean and walked to 2 restaurants  plus over bridge to beach.  A "Cool" Place to Stay!  Staff was very pleasant and breakfast had a nice presentation.

Summary Heading: So glad I chose this hotel!
Summary: I hadn't had a real vacation in five years and was looking for an Orange County hotel close to the beach that wouldn't break the bank (not an easy find in the summertime!)  I am SO glad I chose this hotel.  It was the perfect place for me to "unplug" and relax for a few days.  The room was much more spacious than I had expected; it was immaculately clean and furnished with the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in a hotel!  Yes, there was Wi-Fi, but I didn't use it (I was there to unplug, remember?) Parking was free in a garage under the building, and there was a nice selection of breakfast items available each morning (everything from waffles to fruit and cereal).  Best of all, I was able to walk (yes WALK, not drive) to the beach via a pedestrian bridge over the Pacific

I love the beach but not the sand, we had a very cofotable room with a balcony that afforded us an ocean view.  So nice after a day of sight seeing to be able to not be closed into a room.  This was our second time staying at this Inn and we will be back.

Our visit to this unique hotel was just perfect.  We enjoyed the lovely view from our patio, the unique ocean front to the right and left,  and of course many things to do nearby.  The room was clean as were the small patios and alcoves.  The owners and their family were very special people and made the stay even better.  We certainly plan another visit

Great hotel right across the street from what is a rocky beach but very enjoyable. Located close to everything you would want from the region, (better) beaches, restaurants, harbor, tourist destinations and San Diego 30 minutes right down the freeway. There is an Amtrak train that runs by quite often, but is fairly quiet and wasn't a bother. Staff was great!! Free parking too!!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Stay at Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea
Summary: Our stay at Best Western PLUS Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea, Dana Point, CA was a wonderful experience. A beautiful view of the ocean, within walking distance to the beach. The atmosphere of the whole hotel was really pleasant. Courtyard is made for sitting and taking in the beauty of the area. Staff were helpful at every level and went out of there way to try and help more.

Summary Heading: The most friendly hotel owners we‚Äôve ever seen!
Summary: We came to this area for a wedding, stayed here for three nights.  It was wonderful! The owners, Mr. & Mrs. Wong, a super friendly couple, are always smiling and helpful.  They remember you by first name, it's so not like any other Best Western (or chain hotel) I've stayed at.  The complimentary breakfast is excellent.  Mr. Wong fresh made waffles for everybody.  There are hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, sausage, pastries, oat meal, fruit, coffee and tea..... It's very tasty and satisfying!  Complimentary wifi works well everywhere. There is elevator which my husband needs it.  It's an old hotel, they renovated it, maintain it and run it well. The whole property is very clean and neat.  They play nice soft music around which is very pleasant.  Location is perfect.  Its right

This is such a lovely little place!  Front desk personnel super helpful and can answer any questions about the area!  The room I got was nice and spacious and you can hear the ocean perfectly!  I will definitely stay here again.

This hotel was AMAZING!!!! The hotel grounds are absolutely wonderful! Garden areas with seating throughout the property as well as deck seating that overlooks the ocean. This hotel is very quiet and the staff is amazing!!! Upon our arrival, we were greeted and all of our questions concerning local places were answered. Then the next morning as we walked into the breakfast area (the breakfast is phenomenal!!!), the owner offered to make us homemade waffles!! I was so impressed!! The owner and staff went above and beyond in making us feel at home!!! We also loved this hotel at night because you can sit out on the deck and watch the bonfires on the beach. The beach is just a short walk and parking at the hotel is free. The only thing I would possibly change is the office hours.

Balcony overlooks the ocean.  Sunset is beautiful and breakfast on the deck is delightful.  Room was comfy and accommodating for senior citizens. A stroll along the beach to a nearby Mexican restaurant for dinner was a plus for location of Inn.

Summary Heading: Absolutly best experience and an ocean front room.
Summary: We have been to Dana Point and stayed at the Laguna Cliffs for the last 5 years. This year our plans changed at the last minute and we were left scrambling. We were quite surprised when the reviews on trip advisor were better for the Best Western than for Laguna Cliffs... I called the hotel and spoken with Steven that evening about the view, the available rooms, the beds, and the rates. He answered the phone quickly and was very patient with all of my questions. He gave me a better rate then I could get online and guaranteed me an  ocean front room. My wife was thrilled and we all know... Happy wife, happy life. During our stay the service continued to be great! We will be back to Dane Point next year and we will stay at the Best Western vs Laguna Cliffs. Thank you for

A great location for walks on the beach and you can also walk to several restaurants.  The whole facility was extremely clean and well kept.  Steve Wang was very helpful in checking us in.  The whole staff was friendly.  The bed and bedding were great.

I have made reservations for my husbands birthday and Steve Wang at the Hotel was superb in his customer service. He went above and beyond our expectations in describing the property and taking care of our reservations. He even called the Chart House to request VIP service for our birthday dinner since their hotel has a preferred relationship with the restaurant. Customer service like this is a lost art and we are looking forward to our stay now due to this experience!

My wife was at an artist's workshop for a week.  I used the facility, relaxed, read and just enjoyed myself.  Hotel staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful if anything was requested.  Directly across the street from the beach and within walking distance of three restaurants.  Excellent locaton.

It is Saturday evening at the height of the summer season along the coast.  I arrive.  There are signs that say "sold out" BUT, I have a reservation.  Unluckily, I had accidentally made the reservation for Friday night.  Two things follow.  I will be charged as a 'no-show.' I have no place to stay.  Even as I am melting in despair, Steven Wang, at the desk, is fielding phone calls from desperate people looking for a room.  I'm thinking "doom, death."  But I wasn't reckoning with Steven.  He tells me he'd stayed up until 3am the night before in case I showed up.  I believe him.  He's incredibly sorry that they have to bill me, but it is abundantly clear they could have sold the room five times over so of course they have to.  But, in his infinite kindness, Steven undertakes a

The excellent review is partly because of the really helpful attitude of the staff here - we only have Steve's name as he was helpful as soon as we arrived in sorting out paying for the toll road the satnav took us on on the way to Dana Point - his help was much appreciated and a great relief.  Also good parking and a lift to bring up the luggage made a great first impression. The lady who made waffles each morning for breakfast was lovely as were the waffles.  The room was a good size and had really good facilities and was clean and was kept clean. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but manageable.  Our ocean view room had a lovely balcony which we made full use of  - yes there is a highway and a railway between you and the sea but that is what this coastline is like and

Older facility but very well kept, we were in room 206. Close to elevator and to sun deck. All employees were great. Close to everything. 5 minutes to harbor and Catalina Express . Highly recommended. Front desk employees provided excellent restaurant recommendations.

This hotel is a great value. Location is perfect and the rooms are quite nice with both private patios and a larger shared one with outstanding views. More impressive is the staff is super friendly and will do whatever you need. Bikes, mats for the beach, suggestions, etc. Maryann and Steve at the desk are great. We will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Porr maintenance cause us to be up all night
Summary: We stayed in a room with a vaulted ceiling and the fire detector was placed at the highest point. The batteries ran out at 2:00 am and the detector sound a buzzer and was voice activated all night. management was not present at the hotel in the middle of the night and a ladder of significant height was not available. Also, the would have required a crew to fix. Detectors should be maintained on a schedule and not when the batteries run out!

Summary Heading: Best Western One of the Best-Recomend to all people with good taste
Summary: My husband and I have stayed here the past few years over 6 times.  Hard to consider another hotel when this one has been so accommodating and considerate.  Simple yet charming, good views, close to beach and wonderful views of ocean.  Breakfast is steps from your room and no fuss or fancy attire needed.  Parking is off the street and each room is close to an ice machine but never hear the noise from that or from the cars that past by the charming hotel. Beds are comfy and our room opened to our own porch overlooking the ocean!  Due to return in a few weeks.  Not to mention the rates are more than fait for this lovely area!

Room was very clean. Called very nice restaurant re my birthday, had VIP treatment at restaurant. Staff was great. Took care of all my needs quickly. Nice bar and restaurants close by. Bicycle renting across the street, so was the beach. Easy access. Look forward to returning there.

We had a great two night stay.  The staff was very polite, the hotel was quiet, the location was perfect. We liked the soft music they played in the courtyard area too. The layout and size of the room was great too, two queen beds with plenty of space. Our only suggestion is softer sheets and towels.  Try this place, you will like it.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, not all rooms are good
Summary: The hotel is very nice, right across from the ocean. The rooms are lovely with all the amenities. The jacuzzi is small and not that appealing. And there is noise from passing cars and from people on the beach across the busy road. The breakfast was hot, but they didn't do a great job of replenishing food. They first tried to give us a third-floor room billed as partial ocean view that looked at the side of a roof. No ocean view. We complained and they upgraded us to ocean front for another $30. I don't think you should get a no-view room across from the beach for $217. Avoid Room 305! We were not happy with the attitude of the manager/clerk, who tried to argue with us about how we wanted to pay, didn't have a towel at the desk for the spa, and was cleaning it in the morning when

The service we received was top notch! I will recommend this hotel to family and friends. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience!  They provided great service for any and all of our needs.

Summary Heading: The most convenient and relaxing Inn-by-the-sea............!
Summary: We have stayed here before and will stay again this month.  We love the relaxed and spa like grounds, the owners are so helpful and cannot do enough to make your stay a pleasure.  The breakfast is wonderful and the view is heavenly.  Now for the room...........1st rate, I haven't ever found a better value in the area for the pleasure of what you will find here.  It is like staying at a high priced hotel with out the high price.  It won't dissapoint.

Summary Heading: Great San Juan Cap/Doheny Beach Hotel
Summary: What a great hotel for a quick overnight.  We had 4 rooms and were so impressed with the reservation, the front desk, the rooms and the breakfast.  They even helped with cabs to the San Juan Capistrano Mission and the cab was on time.  We will be using the Inn by the Sea as our South Orange hotel from now on.

This was our second year at the hotel and is was just as good as the first time. Fernando and Steven are very accomodating and welcomed us back. The hotel is clean, close to the beach with a great patio to watch the sunset.

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay in Dana Point
Summary: Great staff and great rooms. This place is a very affordable and luxurious spot if you're considering coming to Dana Point.  Also, they have a great breakfast selection to top off the great service that they provide. Check them out!!

We booked this hotel not knowing the area but were traveling from Palm Springs and wanted to be on the coastline for the night. We stumbled on Dana Point Best Western Plus, which is a gem of a place with extremely personable people at the front desk. Steve checked us in and spoke with us about Dana Point. First he upgraded us to a room with a partial ocean view because it was available. When we asked for dinner suggestions he told us about The Chart House that they have a VIP relationship with. He told us the view was spectacular from this point high on a cliff and it was. This restaurant is named #1 for restaurants views in the USA. Steve made us a reservation and sure enough, our table had a VIP card on it and was by a window so we had a beautiful view. The menu had our name

We stayed here one night before heading to Catalina Island. Our room was clean and comfortable and we loved the little balcony. It was just a short walk to the beach and we passed a few restaurants along the way. I would definitely stay here again.

the reason for the trip was to have time with the grandkids. My wife has a disability and I have a cancer stage5 For the disabled the shower head needs to have a hosed shower head. needs a small pool as the hotel down the street has

This hotel is right across the street from the beach and has a deck if you wish to observe the sunset.  The staff was very nice and friendly, the room and grounds clean, and the breakfast very nice.  In spite of being across from railroad tracks, we never heard any noise. We do plan on staying there next year again.

This was a nice hotel with a view of the ocean.  There is parking under the hotel so the car was out of the elements.  The owner was very nice and accommodating.  He let us check in several hours early.  We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Just okay - not worth the price
Summary: The location is decent if you enjoy the beach. You are able to walk to Capistrano Beach in just 10 minutes. The train tracks are directly on the other side of the road so you can hear the commuter train which is very noisy. Everything about this hotel is just okay. The walls are very thin so if you are on the bottom floor you will hear the people above you along with any door that closes. It's unfortunate because the staff can't do anything about it - it's a design flaw of the building. The sheets are very uncomfortable and stiff. Pillow selection was just okay. It had all the normal features of a standard hotel room: mini fridge, microwave, TV, wi-fi. On the positive side - they do keep things very clean (hence why we did not mind staying). I would not suggest choosing to stay

Excellent service, staff was extremely friendly, great location, free parking, decent breakfast, extremely clean rooms, nice hot tub.  The bed was not as comfortable as expected and there is a train that passes by but that impacts all of the other hotels on the strip with ocean view rooms, so it can't be avoided unless you choose a room without an ocean view. We recommend The Chart House during Happy Hour with its million dollar view and really great pricing and generous portions. If the hotel calls in your reservation you get a free dessert

This hotel was beautiful and the staff were so nice and accommodating.  They serve free breakfast, parking is free and so is the internet access.  The ocean view from my room was amazing!  Can't wait to go back to this hotel!

Summary Heading: Quaint California Hotel with Updated Rooms
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel.  The courtyards are quaint and "California" but the room was recently updated.There is no beach access but great beach views.  The owner was very nice and helpful.  No restaurants within waking distance but only five minute drive to San Clemente.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel with a beautiful view
Summary: We stayed the night at the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn by the Sea.  It was an older property but nicely maintained and very clean.  It was right across the street from the beach and had a beautiful view.  There is a major road in between the hotel and the beach so there is a overpass for pedestrians a few yards down from the hotel.  So it was very convenient.  The staff was helpful with directions and even gave us a map to help us find places around.  The breakfast was good, we had waffles and cereal.  But the best part was the patio where we ate.  It overlooked the ocean the view was unbeatable.  There is railroad across the street from the hotel but the noise didn't seem to bother my family at all.  We would definitely stay here again.

Staff friendly and helpful. OK breakfast, they had waffles which was nice, but some of the other selections were limited - but not the worse I have ever seen. Very nice rooms that were spacious with nice size fridges and a real 4 cup coffee maker. The beds were super comfy. They had a variety of common areas outdoors to relax in - one had a great view of the beach. Only downside I can see is that there is no AC, so if you go during a hot time it may get uncomfortable in the room. We were there in June & it was nice.

nice place, beach difficult to reach, but hotel very nice, breakfast is a bit poor but ok, nice service and a good bed but a bit soft everything available and a good room setup, take only rooms of the backside as some are fronted to a noisy street

My husband and I spent the weekend here to celebrate our anniversary. My first impression of the hotel was very favorable--I really liked the "beachy" look of the exterior--lots of wood, plants, fountains, and soothing music piped outside. The front desk staff, including what I believe were the owner or manager and his wife, were extremely friendly and helpful. They wanted to be sure all our needs were met. We came in early and were able to request a room on a higher floor than we were originally given. My husband had ordered flowers delivered to the hotel, and they were waiting for me in the lobby when we arrived under the staff's watchful eyes.  The room was quite spacious and included a king bed, fridge, microwave, and well appointed bathroom. The room was super clean. We had

This is a charming hotel, conveniently located directly across the street from the beach. We stayed on the second floor and had a slight view of the ocean (room 210). It is within walking distance of some restaurants and a short drive to the Dana Point harbor, where we went on a fun whale watching trip. The manager was very kind and accommodating.

x-lint accommodations &  very friendly staff. My wife & I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Plan to return as often as we can.  The rooms were beautiful and spacious and services, (i.e. ice, linen supply, and elevator readily available. Location and ocean view incomparable.  Love this place!!!!!

we came here for a family vacation and loved this hotel! Beautiful view of the ocean, walking distance to beach and really good restaurants, nicely decorate rooms that were very spacious with super comfy beds! Everyone that works here is extremely friendly and helpful and gave us good recommendations and even made us waffles in the morning! I wish all hotels were like this

the view from there at the hotel is unbeatable   you can see the the wind surfers the boats in and out of dana point   unbeatable views   being able to walk over the bridge to the ocean with no parking or fees is priceless  the smell of the fire pits there at the dohemy park alll right within walking distance   love the inn by the sea should be a must for evryone

A great property with a great ocean view. Great location and easy to access. Service was way above normal and I would tell everyone to stay when going to south orange county. The water features and soft music was spectacular.

I like the decoration here. It is very cozy. The front desk people were very friendly and easygoing. Guests have access to the beach, which is just across the hotel. My room was very clean with the ocean view.

We go to Dana Point often, but this is the first time we've stayed here and we will definitely be back. We had an interior garden view room that still had a view of the ocean. The room was very clean, a generous size and very quiet even though the hotel is right on the PCH. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. I left my iPad charger and they called, sent it back and I had it the next day. There is an outdoor patio on the second floor that has a great ocean view. Since the hotel sets across from the day use area at Doheny State Park, there are no buildings to block your view. A wonderful sitting area any time of the day. If you don't want to get back in the car to go eat, there are about 5 restaurants within walking distance including a bar, sushi and Italian. Did I mention

Quick stay here overnight before catching the boat over to Catalina the next morning. The manager (?owner) at the front desk was extremely polite, friendly and welcoming. Location of the hotel is great, right across the coast highway from the beach. Near done great restaurants as well- my fav Mexican spot Olamendis is a quick walk. Rooms are ok, bathroom could use some updates but overall was clean and comfortable. If you aren't familiar with the area, there is train track and the coast highway inbetween you and the beach. Kind of adds to the charm in my opinion, but some may find it loud. Would definitely come back, if nothing else for the great customer service.

Our 5 day stay at Best Western Plus in Dana Point, CA exceeded all our expectations.  The staff, especially Fernando, could not have been more friendly and helpful.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Great price, nice breakfast, and even though it was too hot outside the pool was heated really nicely so we got to enjoy that too. The rooms were standard, nothing special, but met our needs. I would stay here again.

We stayed for the weekend and the room we had was on the 3rd floor. It is a quiet hotel, and great location. We walked to the harbor for dinner and to the beach which is close by.  Unfortunately, the room we had smelled really bad.  I thought if i opened the doors and windows that would help, but it didnt.  We told the girl when we checked out.  Looking back, I should have complained on check in for another room.. so much effort to complain!!  ugh!!  Will go back again because it was a nice place, nice front desk personnel, and great location!!

Summary Heading: Great Small Hotel - Near The Beach
Summary: Was in the area for a few days visiting relatives in Capistrano Beach - was a great small and quiet place to stay - and with beautiful views of the beach & Pacific right across the street.  Convenient to San Juan Capistrano, Dana Point and San Clemente.

Summary Heading: Amazing!! Clean and awesome free breakfast
Summary: We checked in kind of late but there were restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were very clean but did have a beachie musty smell to them. But overall not too bad.  The free breakfast was amazing. Waffles, sausage, eggs and more. It was just great.

This hotel is located directly on the Pacific Coastal Hwy and is very convenient for the busy traveler. The staff are friendly and accommodation was fine.  Our room had a separate bedroom with a lovely sitting area and a balcony.   The room was spotless and very comfortable bed.  The only downfall we experienced was the Buffet Breakfast. We tried it once and that was it during our seven night stay.  Definitely needs some improving.  I would also make sure that they do not debit your credit card before your stay.(Dependent of course on the type of reservation you make).  We experienced an incident that was rectified immediately after we realized we had been billed incorrectly three weeks prior to our stay.  Management  apologized and made the adjustments promptly.  Thank You.

First the good news.  Nice big room freshly updated.  Great bed.  Very friendly front desk staff.  Panoramic view of the beach and ocean just a few steps away.  Very convenient to all of Dana Point and environs.  The bad news.  Between the room and the beach is the very busy PCH 4-lane highway and the train tracks with several trains per hour by day and more than a few at night.  The road and traffic less than a car length from the room essentially make the nice little porch unusable and you won't be able to leave the doors or windows open to enjoy the breeze.  The traffic and the noise make it difficult to recommend this hotel.

I can't say enough about Fernando and his family. They were the most accommodating staff we've ever met.we stay in hotels at least 9 months out of the year and have for the last 6 years. They are constantly working on up keep and hospitality from before sun up to late into the night. We've stayed in many Best Westerns, some are quite nice and some not so. This one was exceptional.  All Best Western Management should be trained here.

My hubby and I love to have "date nights" locally. We loved this hotel. It is practically on the beach and in an area that isn't very populated. My hubby surfs in san clemente so it was perfect. The only thing I would say is if you have a high clearance vehicle, there is NO place to park it. Only underground parking and street parking is unavailable either. Other than that it is great!

very nice hotel right on busy PCH, and across the street from the beach.  Had to walk down the street a little ways and walk over a bridge over the highway to get to the beach.  the beach was very rocky.  there were a couple of restaurants next door.  We ate at the Italian one which was very good.  breakfast was your typical breakfast.

the view is perfect\]  the hole in the wall the locals call it it   is a walk over bridge right in front of hotel takes you into the beach area with tables firepits and charcoal grills   the spa is such an amazing experience  the warm water and splashing waves is amazing   also the gareden un  hotel well kept up

Check-in was very easy, staff friendly, the hotel location is very good. the staff made my restaurant reservation for me. I did not want to drive that night she called the taxi for us. I will go back in the future to the same place and I will stay in the same hotel.

We went for a friends wedding and was able to get an early check in.  Everything around was already sold out.  Found this gem with ocean views, a fireplace, and a great shower with 9 jets and overhead rainfall action.  Only stayed one night, but it was well worth it for the area.

The Best Western Plus is in a great location.  You're able to walk to the shops and restaurants by the ocean at Dana Point Harbor.  Their breakfast buffet has a really good variety, and they are very pet friendly.

My family stayed here for one night on our way from LA to La Jolla. It was the perfect overnight stop. We arrived in the late afternoon, and check-in was quick. The hotel is family run, and all members of the family were incredibly hospitable.   We were given a room with a partial ocean view on the third floor, and they brought a pack and play for our daughter.  The room was larger than average and had a vaulted ceiling. The bathroom was clean but slightly outdated. There was complimentary coffee in the room and a small refrigerator which was perfect for storing our dinner leftovers.    The location of the hotel is good, right across the street from the beach. It is located on a very busy road; however, if you walk about one hundred yards down the street, there is a walkway that

Had a room with a full ocean view. Kept the door open while I worked on my computer. Loved sitting out on the porch and listening to the waves. Trains passed by pretty regularly but it wasn't annoying. Walking distance to food and the beach. Room was great. Bed very comfortable. Would definitely stay again in the future.

This hotel is located across a busy highway from the ocean. Nice view but not easy to reach beach. Hotel is adequately priced and nice enough although our room had a couple problems.We were just passing through so it was adequate for that purpose.

Customer service is good.We only stayed one night as we had booked a dolphin safari next morning.They do not serve breakfast till 7.30am which is an issue as we had to leave by 7. Nice location,decent rooms and good point for the sunset.

Summary Heading: Small Hotel with not enough parking
Summary: We had booked an Ocean view room but when we got there we were told that they were booked solid and gave us an "upgrade".  Our upgraded room was in the corner next to a closet and no Ocean view.  It was considered an upgrade because of the hot tub in the room, which is next to the bed.  The hot tub will fit two people if you have your legs on top of each other or if one person keeps their knees bent.  It was not worth the money that we spent.    There is also a limited amount of parking spaces available and most are for compact cars.  We drive a Titan and it didn't fit in most parking spaces.  There is also a metal bar that hangs low on the majority of the packing spaces so trucks will not fit under them.  It is right in front of the highway and the railroad which can be noisy

My family and I planned a last minute weekend beach camping vacation but but everything was booked. We went to nearly every hotel on the beach but they were booked as well. We stopped into Dana point in by the sea and the Amanda Rose, front desk attendant, was able to sneak us inform a last minute cancellation. Fernando the owner was unbelievably curtious and helped us book the room for the night. It has easy access to the beach, where the kids had fun collecting rocks. And the little spa was perfect us. In the morning Fay, the owner, served an amazing warm breakfast. Great waffles!!! We sat on the sun deck looking out on the ocean and had breakfast. Our room was spacious, clean and the patio was huge! Highly recommend this small diamond of a hotel!!! Thank you for the amazing

We enjoyed our one night stay at the Best Western PLUS in Dana Point.  The room was spacious and clean. It was a great room. The arrangement of the room itself was nice with a nice little kitchenette.  We had a full ocean view. There was no pool, but we did take advantage of the hot tub.  The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and professional. The bed was wonderful. We have back problems and this was one comfortable mattress! I always worry when I stay away from home whether I am going to be able to get a good night's sleep. I didn't need to worry about it on this trip.

We chose to this hotel because of the positive reviews we read and we now can confirm that this is a great place to stay!  Our family of 4 was driving in at night so we could catch the early boat to Catalina Island.  The Dana Point Harbor was a short 5 minute drive.  Parking at the hotel was easy. The staff was so friendly and sincere upon arrival and departure.  The rooms were large and very clean.  There was no a/c, but it was not needed. We opened the window and let the breeze flow through.  The beds were very comfortable, however,  the bedding was very loud as odd as that sounds.  I am not sure what type of material the comfortable and sheets were, but you could hear every toss and turn from the family.  The hotel is located across from the ocean.  We arrived at night, got

BW Plus in Dana Point was picturesque, located on ocean with easy access to beach, Dana Point and Laguna Beach.  Family run operation with great service.  Safe, secure and free breakfast.  Would highly recommend room 206 ---

We loved our stay here. There were 5 rooms for our family and were well cared for in this property. There were so many of us that we took over the deck with our clan, some strangers joined in and we had a wonderful time. Great place to say. I would give it a 10

Our room is a two room suites the bed was so comfortable and had a beautiful balcony overlooking the ocean the jetted bathtub was a lifesaver after walking out all the way on Dana point to see huge Sea cave ! The walk is about 2 miles all over rocks big rocks little rocks in between the rocks are tidepools he saw abundance to see life in the tidepools! Great location very nice staff and a free breakfast

Hotel is on Pacific Coast Highway across the street from the ocean.  We had a "garden-view" room (as opposed to an "ocean-view" room which would have been much more expensive).  However, in case of our room, we just stepped out onto the walkway and there was the ocean . . . right in front of us!  Room was nicely decorated, wi-fi and TV worked well, breakfast was adequate, and did I mention that there was the ocean . . . right in front of us!

Summary Heading: Cleanest hotel room I have ever stayed in
Summary: We were in town for a long weekend and booked into this little gem. The room/bed was very clean and comfortable. Loved the easy access underground parking, and the Pacific Ocean right across the street. Two minutes walk from a great Italian restaurant (Agostinos) and an outdoor bar/caf√©. The hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. I hope to stay here again sometime!

This is a comfortable, clean, friendly hotel.  The staff works to be helpful and make me feel like they are waiting to take care of my every need.  Beds are comfortable. Showers are very good. Pleasant decor. Comfortable deck to enjoy the ocean views. Basic breakfast offering, but good coffee and well presented.

Summary Heading: You take the good with the not-so-great
Summary: The staff, when available, were extremely courteous and helpful. The room was clean and the location, right across from the beach is great. However (and this might not be a consideration for families traveling for pleasure), there were times when the hotel staff were hard to find and it created a bit of inconvenience when checking out.  The overall experience is good, though, and the value is fair - especially for the location.

This is a well run hotel. Great location with friendly staff. Clean rooms, great price, and complimentary breakfast that does not close down at 9am like most hotels.   I see other review that says Fernando and his wife make guests feel welcome. I agree and will definitely come back. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Our king deluxe room was pleasantly spacious.
Summary: We were able to check in a bit early after parking our car in the free underground area.  The room had a view of the ocean, and was located on the same level as a nicely appointed sun deck for general use.  Wifi worked well and was included in the price.  Location proximity to Dana Point Harbor was perfect for us, as it was close but we enjoyed the little bit of distance and view of Doheny Beach Park.  Room was exceptionally clean, and lots of attention was paid to nice details.  The refrigerator and microwave were appreciated and used, as was the coffeemaker and free coffee.  Complementary breakfast covered everything from eggs to oatmeal to bagels and toast, and was fresh and hot each morning.  Even though the MetroLink train passed daily, the noise was not worth mentioning.

Summary Heading: ocean view, kind staff, lovely garden
Summary: short walk to beach, train and traffic were present but didn't bother us, liked the personal patio, liked the ocean view, staff was kind and helpful with directions and luggage, they had a very nice well tended garden in the inside of the hotel, small and cozy, but clean and reasonably priced

Fernando and his wife go out of their way to make guests feel welcome at this hotel. It has an ideal location with easy access to the beach, wonderful continental breakfast and beautiful, clean rooms. I would definitely recommend Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn by the Sea to anyone looking to stay in the San Clemente/Dana Point area for a high-quality hotel at a great price!

We stayed one night and thoroughly enjoyed the visit.  The room was spacious and just as advertised -- most importantly, clean and well maintained.  The owners clearly care about their property and the welfare of their guests.  Though the breakfast room was small, there was not an overflow crowd, and the food was plentiful with an adequate choice to meet everyone's wishes.  Again, the owners were very gracious.  They clearly want their guests to be happy.  We will definitely return next time we find ourselves in Dana Point

This is the perfect place for creating family memories. Every morning we took a walk along the beach to Dana Point Harbor, about a 20 minute walk. Had breakfast, walked on the jetty and just enjoyed the beautiful sunny weather (in February!). There is a great surf shop (Jack's), close by where we rented a surf board and wet suit for our son, and spent the day surfing. The Inn is family run and they are very friendly and do their best to be accommodating. If you have a full size truck, parking was tight. The Inn is located right on Pacific Coast Highway, so there is highway traffic noise, but the view was so awesome, we really didn't mind. The Inn is very close to the walking bridge to take you over the highway and train tracks, right onto the sandy beach and bike path. My son

I stayed here for 5 nights with my husband and despite others' comments this is a lovely place to stay.The atmosphere is chilled and the owners are the most caring couple you could come across....absolutely nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast room can be crowded but then we are not sitting down to breakfast in a five star luxury hotel...it is breakfast on the go. It was great to have proper Orange juice too. Our room was large and very comfortable. So... No complaints from us and we would happily stay here again.

We spent 5 nights here. The Wifi worked in the room and in the breakfast area. The couple who run the hotel are always smiling and friendly. Nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast consists of scrambled eggs, sausages,  hard boiled eggs, pastries,  bread, waffles,  juice and coffee. The breakfast area is a bit small but that is usual for a Best Western. The room was spacious  and comfortable. Showers worked well. There were two bicycles available for use and good free  car parking. The hotel is on the Coast Highway and there are excellent views to be had from its sun deck.

Summary Heading: Overpriced and Too Many Little Annoyances
Summary: This is a mediocre motel that is priced like a nice hotel.  The front desk is not staffed when the day starts and that's a problem.  Breakfast doesn't start til 7:30, that's a problem.  The showerhead is built for people 5 foot 8 inches and below and trains come through and rattle the bed in the middle of the night.  The parking garage is super-tight and it's difficult to get in and out of a spot.  I paid over $300 for a night at this place.  The room was clean with refrigerator and a good, efficient ayout, and i had a terrace overlooking the highway and the beach, but just too many things they got wrong and i feel like it was a ripoff-i would feel much better about paying $300/night if i could get a decent shower, take a hot tob in a "hot' tub, have no noisy trains waking me

Nice, clean hotel overlooking the ocean, very relaxing, beds were super comfortable. Close to lots of activities near and around Laguna Beach and San Clemente.  San Diego is nearby that offers tourists wonderful choices for families.  Dine, Shop, Play!!  It is all within reach from the Best Western Plus in Dana Point !!!

The owners were extremely pleasant, caring and helpful.  Upon check in they suggested a fabulous restaurant; booked reservations for us; which gave us VIP seating and a complimentary dessert ($18.00 value).  It was wonderful.  When asked about local shops they were able to direct us without any problem.  They also offered to set up reservations for another Best Western in another town.  The accommodations were great value for the price; they offered to do everything for us during the complimentary breakfast.  I would stay again.

Summary Heading: Wonderful, quiet and comfortable hotel along beach
Summary: I really enjoyed this peaceful and very nice hotel along the Dana Point beach. My room was clean and spacious, the free breakfast was good, and the lush gardens and vegetation managed by the owners an extra delight. Great value!

I will never stay here again... Stayed here during a business trip. Room was ok .. Woke in the morning looking forward to breakfast... Go to lobby.. Eggs in a warmer not turned on sitting in about an inch of water. Gross.. Sausages lukewarm gross.. Go to the bread/ bagel cabinet they have open and fly flies out gross.. Then the smell of molded bread hits me like a truck gross... At this point i just give up and pour a cup of oj and cook a waffle. Oj tastes sour. So all in all this place needs to be shut down and someone needs to teach them about food safety!!!

The room was immaculate, the grounds lovely and well-kept, the parking convenient, and the employees pleasant and helpful.  Although the AmTrak passes along the beach (which is across the highway, easily accessed), it's not an intrusion. The complimentary breakfast is simple but fresh. There is a lovely deck for sitting and watching the ocean. I would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write an review.  We pride ourselves in having a clean and comfortable establishment and feel lucky to have such a dedicated staff that truly cares.  Thank you for taking notice and for enjoying the scenic Amtrak quietly whisk by.

Summary: The hotel was in a nice location. Overall, it was nice. But the heat (which, mostly did not work), and the lights were dim. There is a very good restaurant, Agostino's, nearby (within walking distance), and it is reasonable, good Italian, and excellent service. And the hotel, for younger folks, may well work very nicely.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are pleased to see you enjoyed your stay.  We do have scheduled maintenance checks on our air conditioning systems but will look into them again to ensure they are all functioning correctly.  Sometimes our Honeywell digital control units can also be daunting at times if they seem unfamiliar, please feel free to check the functionality with our front desk during your next stay.  We look forward to providing you with a perfect stay on your next visit.

Summary: This hotel is directly across from the beach, which was a nice bonus while eating breakfast. The room was really clean and comfortable. The breakfast had a large selection. The staff was super warm and welcoming. I will be returning to Dana Point and will not stay anywhere else.

Friendly staff, good location, great internet service. staff is so understanding and helpful. I spent 2 nights here before my university session. easy to get to, I didnt have breakfast, but great caring staff.

Summary Heading: best western plus Dana point inn by yhe sea
Summary: This hotel is right across the street from the beach. If you're a light sleeper the Amtrak & Metrolink go by several times. It didn't bother me but other family members said it woke them up. Other than that it was easy & convenient to the freeway & close by Dana Point although no within walking distance, you definitely need a car.

Recently we stayed 4 nite's at the Inn by the Sea. This operation is family managed and we have become very appreciative of the hospitality. Rooms were very clean and in repair. Hotel is very quite and continental breakfast was very good.Our room had a nice view of the ocean and we will plan to stay again in 2016. If you like quite this is the place to be!

As a loyal Hilton customer, I was hesitant at booking here, but it's great. It's a quaint little place, and run by a family that cares. Incredible views of the sunsets. By no means luxury accommodations, but clean and spacious. Would stay again if given the opportunity.

Absolutely loved staying at BW Dana Point!  The Innkeepers were so friendly and helpful throughout our 5 day stay.  They are so nice and sweet people.  They really took care of us at breakfast and whatever help we needed.  Beautiful location and property right on the Pacific Ocean and so convenient to walk to Doheny State Beach, get anywhere in Dana Point, along the PCH and even Orange County.  Would stay there in a flash again!

this hotel offers best of both worlds close to marina for easy access to boats  right on the water close to walk over to beach   what a great beach hotel   the campsites you can view from the room have campfires on the beach   what an amazing view totally awesome stay and play

What a great place to stay!  Very clean rooms and extremely friendly staff. The views up on the top deck of the hotel are amazing for sunset watching. You're real close to downtown Dana point attractions and literal steps away from the beach. We will for sure be back!

We stayed here for our honeymoon and really enjoyed the hospitality, clean rooms, peace and quiet, and a beautiful ocean view. We couldn't have been more content and will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a tranquil getaway.

Independently owned and operated hotels are not the way to go. This one was owned by an old school Chinese family that was old school suspicious at every turn. I am Chinese so I can talk about my own people.  From the get go, it was all about money, money, money. Not once were we asked why we were in town or how we were doing. We had a long drive up in traffic from San Diego and could have used a friendly face. The rooms were not how the receptionist described it on the phone. It's not near the beach as described. There's a noisy train track they did not tell us about. Just not a place for fun or family. Just good if you are desperate and need an expensive place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  The purpose of stay was for the school of Wing Chun (The Dragon Institute) where you would be performing a Lion Dance for Chinese New Year.  Upon arrival your party had 7 adults which unfortunately is beyond the legal maximum capacity for any room in our hotel, we can understand if you were upset since you expressed 3 adults were a surprise to you.  For the 2nd room you rented for the extra adults, we deeply discounted the rate, comped the charge for 1 adult, comped the parking for an additional vehicle, and comped a rollaway bed. Our hotel has always been the only 3 star hotel to offered free breakfast, wifi, and parking for 1 vehicle.  We hope your next stay in Dana Point will allow you to see the tremendous value we offer here.  Our close proximity to the Ocean is rare for any hotel in this area.  As a note, our staff is multinational ranging from Asia, Russia, Mexico, El Salvador, and a proud Michiganian, but none are Chinese.

Summary: I cannot speak highly enough of the owners and staff. We had a problem with the in room TV which was dealt with immediately.  Great location opposite the beach.  Breakfast provided is good and sitting on the second floor patio with coffee watching the sea cannot be beaten. I saw whale spouts about a mile offshore. There is great bar and grill within easy walking distance where you can sit and enjoy the sunset. There is limited underground parking. The hotel has 3 floors and there is an elevator from the garage level so loading /unloading is easy

Summary Heading: Had a great weekend get a way!
Summary: The staff is amazing. The rooms are up to date. And very comfortable. We had a room with a balcony and a unobstructed view of the beach. The bathroom is a little narrow but other then that the rooms are big and roomy. Center courtyard with plenty of seating.

We went whale watching at Dana Point and were extremely pleased with this sweet hotel across from the beach. We enjoyed kind and friendly staff and a clean room. We will stay at this hotel again on our next whaling watching (Capt. Dave's) trip!

This is a GREAT place to stay.  Comfortable, clean rooms, great location!  There is a train that goes by a couple times in the evening.  However, the train whistle DOES NOT blow.  Just a quick passing of white noise.

Summary Heading: Nice property, great location, hidden fees
Summary: Hotel has a great location, right across from the ocean.  The property is very nice and clean, and well maintained.  Has a "garden" feel to the landscaping.  Parking is provided in a garage below the hotel. Staff was friendly.  Room was just average, but clean as well.  The safe in the room was broken, but didn't need to use it anyway.  Free continental breakfast was provided in the morning.  Unfortunately, I would not return to this hotel because of the fee that is charged to you when you check out if you booked the hotel anywhere other than directly from the hotel.  This is a deal breaker for me.  I selected this hotel only because it had the lowest rate of any hotel in the area.  Once the fee was added at check-out, this was no longer the best rate and had I known about this

First time guest and not the last time.  It was very pleasant, clean, professional, but most of all, very personal! The staff took the time to give us personal service. This is a great hotel. Also adorable! We are DEFINETLY coming back again!

Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Great location close to Dana Point Harbor, Laguna beach and San Clemente Pier! Ask for room with an ocean view! We rode our Harley as this is a "rider friendly" hotel

We were SO impressed by the quality of this hotel.  The staff was wonderful and so helpful.  It was clean, modern and had all the amenities (refrigerator, coffee maker, iron, hairdryer, etc. in the room).  There was a full breakfast downstairs with a waffle machine, etc. The view of the oean was great--what more can I say other than "We'll be back...

I just finished my second SoCal surf trip and my second stay with this hotel. The hotel is family owned and operated and very convenient to a number of great surf spots nearby. The staff goes way out of their way to accommodate any need you might have and the rooms are impeccably clean. Another big factor is "bang for your buck". This hotel, the quality of the rooms, and its location are very difficult to beat for the money. (Hint: If you're a surfer, and you let Fernando know that, he may accommodate with a room big enough for your boards.) Will be back for a third trip at some point for sure.

We liked this hotel mainly because of the clean rooms and very pleasant staff that were courteous and eager to help us with anything. The breakfast area was small and selection was limited but was still comfortable. The internet was cumbersome but available and the oceanview room had a great view of the sunset.

Summary Heading: Like staying with family...family you like.
Summary: I could stay at the Marriott, Hyatt, or St Regis when I travel to Dana Point on business, but I prefer to stay at the Best Western Inn By the Sea.  The main reason is that the manager, Fernando, and his family are people I trust and like.  The hotel is always clean and comfortable...and the location is great.  But, the kindness and genuineness of staff keep me coming back.  If you are a skeptic, all I can say is "try it".  I bet you return!

We needed a place to stay and found this hotel on the internet.  I was impressed with the location.  We had a great view of the ocean from the private balcony of our room. The staff was friendly and very helpful with all questions.  The best thing is I needed a toothbrush and called to see if the front desk had any fully expecting to go get one.  The next thing I know a hotel person was knocking at my door with a toothbrush in hand.  What great unexpected service!
