We stayed overnight. Super bowl party and did not want to drive.  the Inn has a very nice decor. The room was clean and comfortable. The shower and toilet were small but very functional. It is across the road from the ocean.  Nice deck to watch the ocean.  Breakfast was good. We will come again.

Highly recommend; We enjoyed having a big bedroom facing the ocean and a large kitchen counter area with microwave and refrigerator. All employees are very professional and helpful in many ways.  Certainly would stay here again on our next vacation!!!

Nice room, clean and well decorated. Comfortable bed so you can get a good nights sleep to enjoy the beach community. Across from beautiful beach area.  Please put a count on this so it easy to know if you have reached the about the you want.

I stayed here for five nights in January, and chose this place primarily on the strength of its location.  It's about a 20 minute walk to the Dana Point harbor, in case you want to take the ferry over to Catalina Island, or dine at one of the harbor-side restaurants.  There are some reasonably good restaurants practically next door.  And you are right across the Pacific Coast Highway from a state beach.  Top marks for location.  The Dana Point Inn-By-The-Sea is a small hotel, which suits me fine.  It's all open air.  Your room door doesn't open into an interior hallway, it opens to views of the Pacific Ocean and sea breezes.  It has an interior court yard with some nice, manicured gardens and outside seating areas for boat watching or to catch the colors of a sunset.  The

After two days of long hard driving, we were ready for the quiet care we received at the Dana Point Best Western. The location was central to so many places; the beach was just across the street; the commuter train ran along the beach with the station very nearby in San Clemente. Our room was clean and quiet. Our hosts were genial and helpful. Altogether it made for a wonderful stay.

Recently enjoyed a relaxing time in Dana Point visiting the harbor, many restaurants, and family. This hotel was welcoming comfortable, and conveniently located to everything. Relaxing on the patio, or in the room, I let the waves soothe me.

Summary Heading: You Should Definitely Stay Here When Visiting Dana Point or San Clemente
Summary: I stayed for two nights (Sun & Mon), checking in without a reservation.  Fernando, the owner, gave me a large top floor room with a great view of the ocean.  By the way, Fernando and his wife were very gracious, allowing me to check out a little later in the day and were really nice to talk to.  Free Wi-Fi was great, compared to the $9.95 I pay at various Marriott hotels.    This is a great place to stay and I look forward to coming back in two months.  The location works perfectly for me in between San Clemente and Dana Point and right across the street from the beach and the jogging path along PCH.

Summary Heading: very nice hotel and service was great
Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel to stay. For the money it was hard to beat. It was a short walk to the beach and the views were very nice. Also convenient to the Dana Point harbor with many sights to see. Being on the main highway was also nice. The management went out of there way on service. The breakfast served was again very nice.

This Best Western's location was the key to our making a reservation here. You can cross the highway and have your feet in the sand in minutes! An overpass about 1/10th of a mile north makes that possible. There are good dining options within walking distance. We opted for Italian and walked to Agostinos--a family run place with decent food. The room was clean with a comfortable bed. The sheets were kinda "swishy", so if 100% Egyptian cottom sheets are your thing, this isn't your place. The management was very responsive and pleasant. Breakfast was the usual fare (scrambled eggs, toast, cold cereal) so we opted for Stacks Pancake House in Dana Point--which I highly recommend! I would definitely come here with the kids for some beach time.

We stayed for 8 nights recently and enjoyed our stay. One thing to note if booking through hotwire/expedia or other travel sites, you will likely be charged a resort fee of $14 per night by the hotel - it is not included in the rates quoted by these travel sites.  After talking to the very nice manager at the hotel, he suggested that we would be able to get a better rate by booking direct.    We received an upgraded room at no extra charge (except for the resort fee).  Our room was very spacious, very clean and quiet. We weren't at the front on the PCH side, but could sometimes hear the traffic, but it didn't bother us.  The beds were very comfy, rooms nicely furnished, flat-screen tv.    The breakfast was just ok - we tired of it so didn't eat there every morning. Waffles were

Stayed here for the night while hiking from San Clemente to Newport Beach. Location was perfect and the staff was outstanding. Would definitely recommend. Great value. Room was very clean and well furnished and beds were very comfortable.

We recently stayed at the Best Western Plus for five days, and had a very nice visit. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location across from the beach on the Pacific Coast Highway was terrific, and the room was very spacious and clean.

We had a street facing room with view, the room and bed was clean, comfortable and as expected. The sofa in the living room was dated and some of the furniture was drab, but the value and quality was good. Breakfast room is crowded, and they need to expand it because there was a crowd and some people couldn't find a place to sit.

Hello, I travel to south Orange County for business 2 times per month, I always book last minute, and I am able to get a room at a discounted price. Excellent customer service, comfortable beds, quiet property and all the staff are very friendly!!

For my 50th birthday, my mother gave me a 12 day trip to southern California, which is where I lived for many years but had to move back to Ohio a year ago. I've missed California like crazy! This trip was very special for me! I was able to see my dear friends, celebrate my 50th birthday, and enjoy the wonderful things that California has to offer.  Within this gift from my mom, was a 2 night stay at the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea. I loved this place and wish I could have stayed longer! I think this was the highlight of my trip! Fernando, the manager, was so accommodating! I had a room on the end with a partial view of the ocean, which was great! The room was really nice, and very clean! The beds were very comfortable! And being right across from the ocean and

The location and views are very nice.  The hotel was not large but very nice.  The room were big, comfortable and very clean.  I believe this was a family operation and they were proud to present this as their place of business and your home away from home.  There were restaurants within walking distance.  The Dana Point Harbor is a short distance away.  Overall the staff made this trip very pleasant for us and we will definitely stay here again if we go back to that area.

Summary Heading: Stayed here while on business in San Juan
Summary: People at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. The hotel itself is nothing fancy but price was good and people were nice. Free WiFi right across from the beach.

The location is beautiful, the rooms big and comfortable, breakfast is great and the staff are very helpful. We travelled by bike and they helped reinflate a flat tire with their electric pump. Nice balconies overlooking the beach.

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-by-the Sea
Summary: A really cute hotel on a street facing the ocean.  The operators of the hotel were very nice and very helpful.  The hotel has a balcony overlooking the ocean.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  There is a complimentary breakfast served in the morning.  There are also restaurants within walking distance where you can have lunch or dinner.  A very enjoyable experience.

I am a Dana Point local, and I love to stay at the BW Plus Inn-by-the Sea.  I have stayed here for a few "Girls get-away" midweek trips.  Also a great local place for when extra relatives visit, as it is affordable. The Inn-by-the-Sea is clean and well-maintained.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Beds are comfortable.  They make  great coffee, too!  Be aware that this hotel is on the other side of the road from Doheny Beach, but the sunsets are just as beautiful.  There is a bridge that allows a walk-over to the beach.  All around, a good hotel for a good price.

This hotel was located on PCH close to interstate 5. The hotel was nicely kept, inside and out.  The gentleman who checked us in and out was professional, helpful and very glad that were part of the Best Western rewards program. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here on future trips to the area.

you can walk across the street to the beach, which has walk/bike path.  patio area on 2nd floor, you can take your breakfast up there and look at the ocean.  breakfast not a big variety,  but keeps you from getting hungry (bagels, bread, scrambled eggs, sausage, dry cereal, coffee, milk, yogurt,  waffles). very clean, big rooms.  updated. quiet. underground parking. close to harbor, food, parks.

Summary Heading: Nice Ocean View, but beware of the traffic noise
Summary: This really is a nice hotel, but just not a great hotel.  I bought a room through hotels.com, as the price was very reasonable for a nice weekend getaway.  While it was nice, it did not quite live up to all the great reviews.  Yes, there's a nice view if you have an oceanfront, balcony, but the street noise really negates the serenity of having an oceanfront view.  However, you can walk across the bridge to the beach and that's a plus.  The rooms are nicely lived in, and could use an update.  The service was fine, but not great.  The was parking onsite, which is nice when you're near the beach.  I got what I paid for, and that's always a good thing.

Summary Heading: Exterior is nicer than the interior
Summary: This was just okay. You definitely pay for the accessibility to the beach. I would not purchase a "partial-view" room - it's not worth it. You can barely see the ocean so would advise getting the ocean view room (be aware that you're overlooking the highway, however) or a garden view if you're not planning on being in the room much. Also worth noting is that the hotel is right on the highway so it's noisy. Walls are paper thin as well so you have to hope for very quiet neighbors. The eggs and sausage links (if you can call them that) are terrible so beware of the full breakfast advertising. It's a not very good continental at best. To access the beach, you have to walk along the highway, then cross a bridge. It's convenient but not beautiful. I wouldn't pay more than $120/night.

Summary Heading: Convenient location with nice ocean views
Summary: We stayed here over Thanksgiving because it's close to the kids.  The management is very accomodating and tries very much to please without being in your face.  Our room was very spacious (202) and in the front so had a great view of the beach and the turnaround place for the Turkey Trot.  However, there is street noise in the room even without the door open.  The train also goes by frequently but is not really bothersome--it is short and fast.  The room was well equipped with a small refrigerator, microwave, wet bar and coffee pot.  There are several restaurants within walking distance and the hotel does offer a simple breakfast in the morning from 7:30-10:30.  The "bathroom" sink is in the entry to the bathroom rather than inside the bathroom which I do not like.

Summary Heading: Ocean View for a Good Rate and Outstanding Service
Summary: The ocean is across the street with a walk-over bridge to the long, scarcely occupied beach.  Steve, the manager, offers personalized service and singular advice for restaurants and sights.  (He seems to read his guests well and gives recommendations and instructions accordingly.)  There is easy access to the Mission de Capistrano and other historic sites.  The off season, of course, is the best time to wander freely and get the best rates.  In November, our modern room in this quaint motel with an ocean view was only $97 per night.  We're anxious to return.

The rooms are spacious (but the bathroom is very tight quarters). Definitely spring for an ocean view room; you get your own deck, and the price differential is small. The hotel has free underground parking and is a short walk to the pedestrian walkway over the PCH to the beach. Breakfast is about standard for Best Western. My only beef is that there are only three tables in the breakfast room, which is fine for the summer, but not so great for a breezy morning in November (they have tables outside in the very attractive courtyard). At least, the hotel should provide trays to take your breakfast back to the room. Pretty good mattresses and nice bedding. There are also several restaurants within a block or so, so it's easy to spend maximum time at the beach.

I chose to stay at the Dana Point Inn based on it's location in close proximity within walking distance to the sportfishing marina. The hotel had perfect accommodations and the staff were very helpful. I will stay here in the future.

This hotel is so nice and inviting!  It is on Pacific Coast Highway, and the ocean is across the street.  They maintain the grounds and it is beautiful.  The owners are so friendly and can't do enough to make your stay enjoyable.  My family and friends stayed here for my brother's burial at sea, which was at Dana Wharf.  It is so easy to get to the Wharf from this hotel and did not cost us a fortune, either.  I would really reccommend this hotel.  Oh, and the continental breakfast includes waffles, which I love!  The owner helped me make my first waffle.  Love this place! I opted for the garden view, which was lovely.

Summary Heading: Worries are thrown in the Ocean and relaxation begins here!
Summary: We've had the pleasure of traveling every 3 months this year and have stayed at a handful of hotels. This one was the best, because it helped us de-stress and enjoy and very relaxing weekend! The accommodations were incredible! Thank you!

For the price and for the size of the room, this is a great place to stay.  It is not luxurious by any means, but sufficient for a short stay. We were visiting with family who lived nearby, so we were not particular about the room. The parking lot was very convenient since it is right at the bottom floor of the building.  Our room was extremely large as it was a handicapped room.  It had a living room area and a bedroom area, almost like a suite.  I would not recommend it for a romantic weekend away but it is perfect hotel if you just want to stay in the room at night and be out for most of the day.  It is very easy to get to downtown Dana Point and close to Laguna Beach without paying the prices of Laguna Beach.  Our room was very clean and the people at the front were very

This two story hotel has been updated and had all we needed at a very reasonable price! It has a great deck to watch the sunset/sunrise.....so if you're afraid of coastal hwy. noise book a room in the back......NO noise at all..........very convenient to the beach and Dana Pt. harbor.......the beds were  comfy and towels soft.......has overhead stair access to the beach so be ready to climb......staff very friendly and accommodating. FREE parking!

First you arrive at an under ground parking lot, which is important because the hotel is on a busy street.    When you reach the reception desk--there is a warm welcome and an easy checkin.  I then noticed the well maintained grounds as well as the view of the ocean across the street.  The room was large and neat.  Breakfast was great.  Thank you to everyone (including the house keeping staff) for making a great weekend.

$270.00 a night with a discount and I can't even purchase a bottled water! Dirty hot tub, clogged bathtub, sandpaper towels, stale candy from vending after it stole our money, view of the ocean trough disgustingly dirty and cloudy plexiglass.

My husband and I were very pleased with our stay at this hotel.  The staff are very kind and like some of the other reviews I see, they will go out of their way to make sure you are treated well.  The parking garage is a bit tight so if you have a large vehicle it may be a problem.  We booked our room with a view of the ocean.  We enjoyed having a deck to look out at the waves.  The only problem is HWY 1 runs right in front of the property along with the train with its commuter trains that run fairly often.  This is not anything peculiar to this property though.  All of the hotels in Dana Point have the same trouble so it's not the hotel's fault.  Just be aware that you will hear highway noise and also some train noise.  The hot tub is very nice and well kept up which was nice

The manager there is so on top of things and I gave special requests for my sister and her husband and they went out of their way to make their trip very special.  It's clean, comfortable and close to beach and shopping, great for early hikes in the morning too! Everything was well tended to and if you want anything special, call Peter(?) the manager, he seems to be very on top of things and wants everyone's stay to be the best. Great views and location. Caring owner!!

We stay at Best Westerns once a month. We like the Plus ones by the ocean. We picked this one through HTonight and Trip Advisor reveiws help make the decision. The hotel did have ocean veiw across the busy HWY 1. We didn't get the BW gold elite member welcome either. The unfriendly clerk questioned our third party choice and told us we would been better to have booked through him. I felt our outside booking was going affect our location and room. We got  bottom floor room with door connecting to the dining room.  Within a hour there was people above us stomping around and smoking outside our door.  I was not feeling well and wanted to go bed. I did call later in the night the desk clerk about location of their hospital was not doing well. He seemed to be a different clerk with

The staff was so friendly and helpful. Everything was clean and fresh. We were visiting family and will definitely stay here again!  And, the balcony overlooking the ocean is a great place to enjoy the view.

This is the best hotel in the area across the street from the beach for the money hands down. Very caring owner that will bend over backwards to make your stay the best.  The only issue I can see is if you have a large truck with camper. Check with hotel as parking is underneath hotel and can be a tight fit with a tall vehicle such as a camper.

First: My husband, six your old daughter, and I only met one staff member - a gentleman in the front office. He was so nice and helpful and accommodating. He helped us with checking in early, upgrading to an ocean view room, mats and chairs for the beach, directions, advice, etc.  Second: the hotel is surprisingly cozy, and very clean.  The atmosphere is lovely and they even softly play music in the courtyard.  The price is phenomenal for what you get.  Thank you for a lovely stay!

It was fine.  The staff was nice but the spa and hotel lobby were almost non existant. For the cost it was good enough. It was also  in a convenient location.  I reported ants the first day to the manager in the morning.  I had to go back and remind him later in the day because nothing was done and they were actually worse.

What a great experience we had on our trip and stay at this hotel. The hotel is aesthetically perfect for this SoCal climate, in a very good location, and the staff could not have been better. "It was perfect" and I could only wish I will have another trip like that next time I travel anywhere. Thank you very much.

Staff is friendly and was helpful in directing us to our next Best Western on our trip .  Very warm and inviting.  Close to wharf, shops and dining. We will definitely return on our next trip to the coast.  It will be our go-to place in Dana Point.  The care and cleanliness of the surrounding area was a pleasure to see and enjoy.

Summary Heading: It was not as shown on line
Summary: It was right on the highway.  The room looked a lot better in the picture.  The carpet was lumpy and the shower was gross. Our balcony faced the highway, and we had power lines that were buzzing and sparking right in front of us.. and it blocked our view. Not that there was much of a view.  Do yourself a favor, spend the extra money for a nicer place.

Let me start by saying "my wife does not like hotels" so it is very difficult to find something she fells comfortable with. We have to show up and get a feel for the place, check the room, etc then book room and then sometimes we only stay one night. So, with that being said she fell in love with the place instantly. You walk into a beautiful courtyard that has a home garden feel, the rooms all open into the courtyard. Room was spacious and clean. Our room had a faulted ceiling which reminded us of home. Beds very comfortable and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful with local area attractions. Walking distance to beach, restaurants, they even had a cooking class in one restaurant. Breakfast was typical with a few little extras. Note: we didn't even check the room before

Summary Heading: We really enjoyed our short stay
Summary: We only stayed here for one night and it was kind of last minute but we really enjoyed this place.  Check in was fast and the employee was polite and courteous.  The view was amazing!  Right out over the Pacific Ocean.  The walk to the ocean was less than perfect, over a long, high walkway over the pacific coast highway, but even that was kind of neat.  The hot tub was nice, the rooms were clean and large for a standard hotel room.  The balconies were small but, again, a plus for a standard hotel room.  It was a short walk or drive to wherever we needed to go and there is the worlds best Mexican restaurant just down the street called Olimendi's(sp?). That is for another review.  All in all we really enjoyed our stay and will probably stay there again on our upcoming trip.  Worth

The Best Western inn by the sea is well situated on PCH1 across the road from the beach and a short walk from the main area of Dana Point. Rooms are of a very high standard with a high level of cleanliness. The beds are super comfortable and aid a really good nights sleep. Communal areas and landings are well maintained. The hotel has no pool but has a lively hot tub overlooking the ocean. Although the hotel is  on the highway you don't notice any road noise. A great stop off point between LA and San Diego.

A great spot for an "old" hotel that needs a little more updating. The site is right across the street from the beach -  albeit quite a walk over a tall overpass that crosses the Amtrak tracks. It is withing walking distance to a few restaurants. A pleasant but too brief stay.

Our original reservations were with the Double Tree by Hilton just up the street, but when we checked in we found out that our reservation with an ocean view was not the case.  Instead, we had a freeway/hotel view from our balcony.  In addition, the room was in need of repair, and the furniture needed a good scrub down.  We immediately went downstairs and checked out.  Through my research for our get-away, I also knew about the Best Western, so we drove to the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea as quick as possible, because it was Labor Day weekend and we wanted to make sure we had a room.  As fate would have it, they did have an ocean view room left with a king bed and balcony!  We ended up getting the best room in the house with vaulted ceilings, a fireplace, balcony,

We have stayed at this hotel numerous times.  The owners really make you feel welcome.  It is very clean, quiet.  There is a train track right in front but the trains do not blow whistles and it stops about ten at night.  It is not an issue,  The view is awesome.  Dana Point offers a lot of recreation and great restaurants.  Try the Wind and Sea restaurant at the Marina.  Great view and good food.

This place is spotless, right across the street from the beach.  Owner upgraded us to an ocean view room.  The beds were awesome.  The beach across from the motel is rocky but a few hundred yards north is a very nice sandy beach.  Breakfast was good too.  Owner made me a waffle and the sausage was great quality. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

I really felt personally cared for - all interactions with the staff were positive. I loved my room and would request the same one next time I went. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The make -up mirror was a special add and the shower head was great. The hotel is kept beautiful and there were many open spaces with chairs and tables to enjoy the view.

Great value for what you pay!  Comfortable, clean rooms and very attentive staff.  Location is convenient, close to the harbor, beach is across the street and parking is a plus (at the hotel and beach).  Can be a little noisy with the highway and amtrak train but overall, well worth the price.

room very clean with a view of the ocean. hotel owner very pleasant and helpful for all our needs. hot breakfast was good,  I would highly recommend this hotel , room was quiet and price was reasonable

I had booked this stay because of the location on the Pacific coast Highway. What I did not know at the time is how amazing the set up was. The rooms are located in a way of a little " village". With a garden of plants, water fountains and soft music playing in the middle court yard. Having my room across from the 2nd floor deck- where we ate our breakfast and morning coffee, and watched the ocean being so alive. The crashing of the ocean waves for a night beverage music was relaxing. Our room was bigger than my living room at home, clean in every aspect. Leaving our room door open to invite the ocean breeze with no worries of other patrons being nosey, as everybody did the same. My 14 year old daughter was also excited about this stay, which says a lot about the new teenagers.

Mega Good!!! Mega Nice!!! Mega Friendly!!! No matter what stay here!! ^.^  Mega Good!!! Mega Nice!!! Mega Friendly!!! No matter what stay here!! ^.^  Mega Good!!! Mega Nice!!! Mega Friendly!!! No matter what stay here!! ^.^  Mega Good!!! Mega Nice!!! Mega Friendly!!! No matter what stay here!! ^.^

What a dreadful mistake choosing this place!   Having read the glowing reports from Trip Advisor we had really been looking forward to our stay here.  I was certainly aware of the proximity of the motel to the coast highway and the rail line so had no illusions about that.  Any road and rail noise did not mar our stay.  But at the start the owner/managers attitude shone through.  One of our children touched a small fountain in the reception area and his smile immediately turned off as he told her not to touch the fountain  in a very nasty manner.  No harm was done and no water displaced.  But from that point on we got the gist of this VERY overpriced accommodation with draconian rules.  We had two rooms ‚Äì one of which was suppose to have a ‚Äògarden‚Äô view but had the view of a

Summary Heading: All the charm and comfort of home
Summary: Seeking a place that was quiet enough to relax and actually hear the ocean isn't easy, yet Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn by the Sea was exactly that place.   Arriving late into the evening due to flight delays, we were welcomed warmly.  The open, well cared for property showed its age with charm and the comforts of home.  If we had a question, there was always someone to greet us with a smile and explore our options for what to do next.  You can tell the management and staff of this hotel made a difference and really cared about those of us that chose to stay with them for a few days.  Recommend this hotel highly.

I accidentally booked this hotel when I meant to book the other one in the area. I'm so glad that I did! Much nicer room than the suite that my family got at the other location, closer to the beach, great view and amazing staff!

Our stay was ok. The room was clean. Our bathroom was clean but the tub needs to be recaulked. The beds were nice and comfortable but the pillows were too high. The hot breakfast could have been better.  there was not much to choose from. Overall the hotel was ok for what we paid.  We liked that we were so close to the beach.

My family and I stayed here for only one night during the July 4th Holiday week. I must say we are glad to have only stayed for one night. The hotel itself was fine. It is irksome however to be charged a 'resort fee' for WiFi. I feel much better about hotels that simply roll that into the per night cost. The breakfast was middling and not very abundant. I did notice that the staff only put out a few pastries. Once those went, a few more were added. Seems cheap and totally inconvenient for guests. The breakfast area is small. The location is strange. It is directly across the street from the Pacific Ocean. And you can have nice views. However, there is a busy road and an even busier passenger railroad track between you and the sand. Not far from the hotel there is a pedestrian

I chose this hotel on the back of the  other reviews and we were not disappointed. The staff were very courteous, very helpful and knowledgable of the area. Our room was a great size and was very clean, with a lovely view of the ocean. We will come back.

Summary Heading: Worth the few extra dollars for the area
Summary: We started at another nearby hotel that cost a little less and had bigger rooms, but also had ants in the room and didn't have any charm. It was definitely worth packing up to move. Also, it has a fridge, microwave, and separate sink, which was great with a newborn. Owners were really nice

Fernando, the manager, was very professional and friendly.  His greeting and assistance was excellent.  The location of the hotel is absolutley beautiful.  The Pacific ocean is just across the street.  It is within walking distance.

This hotel is a little further away from the downtown area of Dana Point but right across from the view of the beach and water. The rooms were extra large and very clean. The service from Fernando was more than excellent. He made sure we had really nice rooms for our group and any questions or recommendations were answered. There is a train that runs right in front of the beach, never bothered us but know you cannot walk across the beach but go down two blocks or so to the overpass if you want to go to the beach. There is also a campground and fencing in the same area across from the hotel. The view from the large patio is awesome, you can see the lights and Dana Point from the large deck. Great value and price, nice for families looking fir a little larger room with

Our host went out of his way to make our stay wonderful. First, he sent me an e-map of how to avoid traffic to Pageant of the Masters. Second, he got us VIP treatment at The Chart House . Third, he mailed me my expensive jacket promptly, when I left it at the hotel. Best Western was one of the least expensive hotels, during our 11 day California vacation, but the service exceeded all other hotels.

Summary Heading: Wish I Could Give It 6 Stars!
Summary: My family and I stayed here for three nights, and didn't want to leave. Not only do Fernando and his wife (the lovely couple who runs the hotel) take pride in their facility, they made us feel like family. I had several options of hotels to book for this stay, and opted for this one, due to the reviews I read regarding characteristics of a hotel that are relevant to my family and myself. I had high expectations because of the rave reviews given on Fernando and the way his establishment is run. Our experience exceeded our expectations by far. I did read some reviews that were less than ideal, and was glad I didn't invest too much time and energy in those. You will not be disappointed in your stay at the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea. We will be back sooner than

Summary Heading: Location and views are great, otherwise just an old hotel.
Summary: The parking here is an issue if you have a large vehicle, the eastern side of the garage has a yellow warning bar set lower than the warning bar at the entrance of the garage.  My Yukon XL hit the warning bar and this scratched the roof leaving permanent damage.  At night the garage gets so full that with a vehicle this size it is almost impossible to maneuver or even find a parking place.  The room was booked through Expedia for $269 add taxes and it is $301, for the money there are much better options.  The rooms smell old and musty, in the bathroom there are ants crawling all over the bath tub.  The patio furniture is old and weathered.  The lights in the room have outlets to charge your device however if the light is not turned on your device will not charge.  There are

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in Dana Point area
Summary: Everytime I travel to southern California I stay in this hotel because the staff is so amazing.  Staying in this hotel reminds me of the kind of service I get in small, family run inns throughout Europe. The owners truly care about the comfort of their guest and reputation of their hotel.  They want you to be happy enough to come back, and they put a tremendous effort into making sure your every need is met.  The Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea is a great place to stay and I highly recommend it.

Just wanted to boost the ratings because this place deserves it.  Spent ten nights all around California and this place deserved two nights.  Friendly staff, cute area.  Rooms were large and comfortable.  They made me feel welcomed and attended to my every need.

We spent one night there last Thursday and were really impressed with the friendly service of the staff there! Very knowledgable and helpful recommending places to visit for short stay. Room has microwave and working fridge. And continental breakfast included too!

We had a fabulous time at the Best Western Plus Dana Point! I honestly have never felt so welcomed, valued, comfortable and safe as I did at this hotel. Fernando and his family treated us with such care and kindness. They are there night and day working around the hotel and making it just right for your stay. They have a great free breakfast every morning, a fun little hot tub, and a balcony with a fabulous view where you can have your morning coffee or watch the sunset in the evening. We went to the beach several days and Fernando had beach chairs and mats for us to use. The rooms are super clean and the beds are comfortable. I hope we can come back again in the near future. Miss it already!

This is one of the smaller Best Westerns that I've stayed in, but it was as nice. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, the breakfast was great, and the ocean view was well worth it. I thought the room would be noisy because it was close to the street (Pacific Coast Highway), but the double-pained windows drowned out the noise and we slept just fine.

Summary Heading: BY THE SEA - RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET
Summary: This hotel has a boutique feel to it.  The staff is very friendly and so accommodating.  Very refreshing to have staff interact in friendly yet professional manner.  LOVE the view from the ocean view rooms, great balcony for a large group, quiet sitting areas throughout.  Quick walk over the pedestrian bridge to the beach.

Summary Heading: Local feel in a tourist destination
Summary: A friendly staff greets you here, and the courtyard setting is charming.  This hotel lacked a small convenience/gift shop for items like aspirin or toothbrushes, but is in walking distance of SUNSETS BAR CAPISTRANO -- a great restaurant/bar with open air indoor & outdoor seating, great service and a distinctive menu.  BW Dana Point is only a couple of miles from San Juan Capistrano's edge, and a short walk to the beach over the PCH on a pedestrian bridge.  The hotel is relatively near the John Wayne Airport by car.

Summary Heading: This place is beautiful and reasonably priced
Summary: I've stayed here a few times and always had a great experience. The staff is very nice and helpful, can't beat the view, right across the street from the sand and ocean and just a few short miles up PCH is Doheny State Beach, plenty of great restaurants, shopping, water sports etc. The beds are very comfy and it's obvious they care about decor and ambiance throughout the hotel. I'll be back!

Be aware of the reservation service with Best Western.  Made a reservation and had an illness in the family which made it necessary to cancel.  Called the toll free number on the confirmation email 5 hours after the cancellation period was up.  The agent said that we could not cancel.  Really?  "Yes, you cannot cancel the reservation".  No supervisor to talk to and no way around it, but said that I should call the customer care number, which she gave me.  Same answer from them and no suggestion that I should contact the hotel directly.  So, I let it go, thinking there was nothing else I could do.  I get a call the day after our arrival date asking what happened and if we were going to show up for the rest of our stay (2 more nights).  Apparently the reservation center, (even

There is no better stay for overall value if staying in South Orange County, CA. Great views and staff. I highly recommend staying there. Fernando and/or Steve will insure everything is to your satisfaction.

Summary Heading: We enjoyed our stay at this quaint hotel in Dana Point
Summary: This Best Western was lovely!!! Great location, great view and we love the size of the room! It was a pretty good price for the location, breakfast and size of the room. Very convenient walk to the pedestrian crossing to the beach. Has a lot of restaurants nearby. Lovely area to begin with. Breath taking view. Parking is included and it's on the basement of the building. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

Came in late at night, and was instantly greeted by Fernando, the ever happy owner/manager. Over the course of the three days I spent there, including 4th of July I was extremely happy with the stay. The staff was friendly and had anything I needed from bandaids to a corkscrew for my wine bottle. Would definitely stay again if I was in the area, it had a cottage feel and peaceful garden. I had a garden view and didn't even mind because there was a gorgeous community balcony and across the street were fires on the beach. Delightful!

This is my second stay at this hotel.  I was extremely satisfied each time.  The office staff is very friendly and helpful and most importantly, our room was very clean! It is a small hotel and has very charming, serene gardens that surround all of the rooms.  If you are bothered by street traffic or the occasional train passing by, this might not be the place for you.  During the day traffic noise can get heavy.  I did not notice it at night.  Our room was on the street and the view was beautiful.  Nice to wake up in the morning and see the ocean!  I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and returning to us again.Your kind words are appreciated and we look forward to serving you again.

Summary: I have found stays at this hotel and the Costa Mesa Best Westerns for business purposes to be excellent. Both have great staffs and clean comfortable rooms. I am impressed what Best Western has done with its' PLUS properties. Mostly renovated with great beds and appointments at the best prices in the area.  These are not California "resort" properties but extremely nice, functional hotels
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review for our hotel.  Over the years we have made our rooms more business friendly by providing Herman Miller chairs, spacious desks from Thomasville, and charging receptacles on our table lamps.  We are glad to see they are being enjoyed for their purpose and look forward to seeing you again on your next visit.  Thank you for your continued business.

Summary: I have no complaints. It's just an average place. Front desk seems to never be at the front desk. I found it surprising there was a $14 resort fee. One, it's a motel, not a resort. Two, it was for parking (is there a shortage of parking here? I think not) and wifi. Not high speed wifi, normal, horribly slow hotel wifi. This fee covered breakfast as well. Breakfast was extremely little as well. When we went there were 6 small bagels and a pastry and another cut up pastry. There's the usual cereal as well, and a waffle maker. It's not bad, but not worthy of an extra fee. It's not like it's an inexpensive hotel and that's how they keep the prices low.

Summary Heading: Peaceful Garden Courtyard, Open Ocean View, Busy Hwy.
Summary: Stayed with my children. Clean nice room.  Comfortable beds, a good nights rest. Friendly and courteous staff/management. Peaceful gardens in the courtyard and a unobstructed view of the ocean.  Good value for the money. For me personally I would choose another Best Western up the coast in Laguna just because this particular location with children was more difficult to access the beach and dining (and there is no pool, just a small jacuzzi for a couple).  I noticed comparable hotels off of PCH in Laguna that had better access.  But overall this is still a nice place to stay especially for adults w/o kids or adults with older teens.

This hotel is close to the beach,has nice views, clean rooms, great breakfast, and no parking fee! Doheny State Park is right across the street with restaurants close by. We had a wonderful stay. We will for sure be back next summer.

I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews. I was extremely impressed with the service.The manager-owner Fernando was very friendly and accommodating. He warmly greeted me and allowed an early check in. The room was comfortable and clean with a partial view of the beach across the street. The property has a lot of chairs to enjoy the garden atmosphere. This stay was a much needed get-away and I was not disappointed. I would visit this hotel without reservation!

We booked many rooms at this hotel for our wedding for an outrageous price.  I stopped in to see what on earth I was getting for my money and found out it was a we don't want you here attitude from the general manager named Steve.  Once he appeared at the desk from some back area after we stood there alone for a few moments, I introduced myself and fiancee as the upcoming wedding party booking.  He had no smile and asked what we wanted.  I told him I wanted some general pricing information on how much we were saving for booking multiple rooms (I was already  weighing my other options just based on how much they charge even though that would put us at a different hotel than our wedding guests and family.  He was evasive for several minutes and began to get condescending.  When we

I read the reviews and was curious if hotel was going to live up to its reviews. The reason I say that is we were traveling from Phoenix to the south Orange County area for a wedding, we stayed Friday night in Palm Springs at the Best Western Las Brisas and we were not impressed so I was skeptical. We arrived about 12:45pm and since our room was ready we were able to check in, again, we were placed on the first floor, normally I will not accept this but this hotel was very small and we actually could see the ocean from our room. Compared to our stay in Palm Springs, this Best Western was much better than the Best Western Las Brisas. Room seemed cleaner but it did have a musty smell but that can be excused as we were right across the street from the ocean. The breakfast in the

Located right across from Dohney State Beach. Great location.  We liked our end room #210 with patio chairs out in front of room.  We had a partial view of ocean.  Best breakfast where manager Fernando & wife will even make you waffles with your breakfast.We liked the parking there & size of hotel (not too large). Will definitely return.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay if you don't mind rude, inconsiderate staff/owners who skulked around their small premise.
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights, and the first night was uneventful except they changed our reservations from 2 rooms with 2 queen beds to 2 rooms with 1 king bed and called it "upgrading" us free of charge.  When I complained, they promptly changed it back but the change took 15-20 minutes which added to an already long day.  The second day was the start of a miserable stay.  After we finished eating the complimentary breakfast, which was average, the front desk person, aka owner, chased us down to complain about the sand/pebbles that were found in the bathroom.  He proceeded to show us a small baggy of sand and pebbles.  He then continued to complain about the hair that was found in the u-trap that was clogging the drain.  All of this was occurring during a very chaotic scene where my

Stayed there 2 nights and found the room clean and the bedding new.  The property is across the street from the Pacific Ocean so beach time is right there.  This is a great value for anyone who wants to stay in Dana Point

I stayed at this hotel because I had a nearby conference and i did not want to face the morning traffic from San Diego to Orange county.  The bed was very comfortable and except for the cleanliness cover on the extra pillow which had hair on it, it was very clean.  The thermostat did take a while to cool the room but that didn't really matter.  I appreciated the goodie bag my Rewards status earned for me (the water was very welcome!).

This is a Family owned and run property.  Fernando, the owner, and his Family know how to treat guests!  This was a great stay!!   The room was very nice. We had a very nice view of the beach and ocean. The room came with a micro, fridge and coffee maker complete with real coffee cups!  It also had a large, flat screen TV with a clean, crisp picture. The bath and shower were very nice.  The bed was extremely comfortable. All-in-all, this was a great place to stay and is now my favorite place to go to the beach.  I love to stay at Best Western Hotels and this is one of my faves!!

Our experience was very pleasant. The rooms were clean, attractive, and the staff was excellent in providing information re: places to visit, etc. The Inn is close to the beach which one can easily walk to.  The hot breakfast was quite adequate.  However, if feasible, I would recommend adding hot potatoes and peanut butter for those  who are vegan.  This would help to make it an outstanding Inn!.  I would highly recommend this Inn, which is central to other communities such as San Clemente and Laguna Beach.  (We did not have a chance to visit the fitness center.)

Summary Heading: Excellent value, wonderful staff, nice views!
Summary: This a bit of a belated review for my stay in February, but had to write one: this Best Western is a great deal for the location. The room was pretty standard - basic amenities for a Best Western - and very spacious and clean. Sam, the manager, went above and beyond to make the stay comfortable. The view from the patio was lovely, particularly of the sunset.

We pulled in at 5:15 after a long drive down the coast.  We were tired and hungry and the young man at the desk asked if we needed a reservation for dinner.  We really did so he recommended a wonderful place a few doors up the street.  They are extremely busy and he was able to get us in at 5:30.  The meal was wonderful and he was an absolute life saver.  Thanks

I was stayed a couple nights in March because my friends were getting married in Dana Point, CA.  The hotel was close to the beach, it was family operated (very friendly), had a wonderful (included) breakfast, and the best courtyard ever.  It's very relaxing-lots of plants, shade, and chairs to soak it all in.  The only compliant was my room had a strange oder.  I complained, but they were fully booked so I was stuck.  The wedding party had several other rooms at the hotel and none else had a funny smelling room, so it was unusual.  I had a non-smoking room, so my guess is someone smoked in the room and they sprayed something to cover the smell.  I was able to leave the door open and open a back window for a cross breeze to air it out.  The location, courtyard, and breakfast

Brought the In-Laws, and treated them to the Dana Point Inn-by-the-Sea, They fell in LOVE!!  A big "Thumbs-UP!!"  Had cousins and more relatives visit us while we there, AND THEY LOVED IT!!  The weather was perfect, the hotel and staff made our visit great!  Can't say enough, about the staff!  Very polite and courteous!

This was my first time staying by the beach and it was a great experience due to the staff and the quality of the hotel. It was a great hotel set up and not your regular hotel design. Very unique and exquisite.

wonderful stay...very clean, great staff, breakfast was abundant. The inside garden area was wonderful. There is a nice patio that looks out on the ocean thats perfect to sit and relax.  You can walk right across the street and take the beach access directly to the beach.

There was not a single thing I could think of that was not exceptional. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was great. I had a wonderful night's sleep. The view was spectacular. My hats off to the management and staff at this Best Western. I will definitely make this the place to stay when I come back to this area again.

Just stayed at the Best Western Plus for four nights.   Fernando was extremely welcoming, kind and very helpful.  The breakfast was good, scrambled eggs, waffles, sausage, bagels.....perfect for a quick bite. I was pleasantly surprised.  Free parking and near a wonderful italian restaurant.  Refrigerator and microwave in the room.  Very clean.  I was VERY pleasantly surprised.

This hotel has become our home away from home.  The management goes out of their way to ensure that our visit is perfect.  They continually add upgrades and improvements to the rooms. We are offered our favorite room no matter how full the hotel is. They are extremely accomodating from the time we check in to the time we have to leave. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else!

This hotel is awesome.  The people who work there are just the best you could ever hope for.  Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay the best it can be.  We asked for late check out and no hesitation at all to grant this request.  We will be back again.

Summary Heading: Best kept secret by the sea
Summary: Friendly, accommodating staff. Small, beautiful boutique type hotel. Very clean, comfortable and cheerfully decorated rooms. Lovely courtyard and patios upstairs and down. Elevator from parking to all levels. Unobstructed ocean view. Sat in spa and watched sunset over ocean. Good breakfast nicely presented. Really great Italian restaurant within walking distance, Agostino's.  Excellent experience at hotel and  we will return.

located on Pacific Coast Highway street-front, our room was very quiet; even the Amtrak across the road did not disturb the serenity of our sleep! Sitting on the balcony the sunset was spectacular over Dan Point.

We recently had the pleasure to stay at the Inn-by-the Sea. The staff was extremely courteous, helpful, and appreciative of our business. The room was excellent and the view of the Pacific can't be beat. The prices were good and courtyard is charming. We would definitely stay here again.

Every year my sister and her family goes to doheny beach campgrounds and camp. We, on the other hand, prefer to enjoy the beach during the day and sleep comfortably in a nice hotel at nights. We stumbled upon a few hotels in the area. What caught my eye about this hotel were the good reviews. So we thought we would give it a try since we had a good experience at the last best western in San Diego. The pictures seemed like an old motel like feel on the outside, but the rooms were very modern on the inside. We called ahead to confirm our booking, and asked to add my husband so he can checkin for us. The front desk began to tell me it would be an extra $10 charge for the 2nd adult. I was under the impression that since I booked a two queen bed room, that would mean there would be 2

My experience at this motel was mixed.  I had a pre-paid booking & was surprised to find there was an additional $14/night "resort fee".  I'm not sure what service was provided for this extra fee & also don't know why it was hidden in the small print rather than including it in the room price, taxes & fees.  I found the helpfulness of the staff to be mixed also.  Some were very friendly, helpful, & courteous.  Others seemed to have a bad attitude & a request for a 2nd room card key turned into more hassle than necessary.  Bottled water appears to be complimentary for some & not others....

This is one of the best motels I've ever visited.  The layout makes unpacking and repacking your car very easy.  The staff were especially friendly helpful.  The ambiance is very restful with plants and fountains all around (very Southern Californian) in spite of being right off the busy Pacific Coast Highway (don't get me started on that).  Our room (the cheapest) was spacious and comfortable.  The beds were firm without being "motel hard."  We could have opted for a room with a view of the ocean for a substantially higher price but those rooms are right above the highway and the comfortable patio provided us a beautiful sunset watching experience.  One caveat: Capistrano Beach (across the highway via pedestrian overpass) is a rocky beach which is not as nice as other

The room smelled so dank that I had to open the unscreened front windows to air it out.  TV remote controls were primitive and difficult to use.  The place has some nice common area decking with views, though.

Great hotel, clean, friendly staff.  It is right across the street from the beach! Beds are comfortable. Free WiFi, free parking. Nice garden areas, ocean viewing. Fit our needs perfectly. Close to harbor, San Juan and more.

We were going to Catalina Island for the weekend and chose this location for the night before the Catalina Express.  Steve, the Manager on duty, was Super friendly!  The room was very clean and the location was in walking distance of some restaurants and bars that Steve gave us a complimentary drink for.  When Steve heard we were leaving early and would not be at the free breakfast, he asked us what we could like as far as bagels, fruit, etc and brought us up a plate that night along with our bill since we were leaving before the office opened.  It was 1 mile from the Boat landing for the Catalina Express and it was honestly the perfect start to a perfect vacation!.  Thanks again.

A great view of the ocean from the balcony. PCH and railroad tracks are between the hotel and the ocean but it's close and quiet enough at night to hear the waves . The courtyard area is very tranquil filled with fountains, flowers, and seating. The rooms are large, the free breakfast has a good variety, free parking below the hotel, and a very friendly, accommodating office staff. I needed to extend my stay and Ferdinand made it possible for me to keep the same room. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Ocean views for a decent price.
Summary: This place is a gem, I imagine it isn't $500 a night is because of the road between you and the ocean, but the views are still fabulous. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the room had a balcony facing the water. The owner was extremely friendly and was always welcoming. Not bad for $170 a night off of the ocean!

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay!
Summary: In February, while travelling southern CA, we booked into this hotel.  The staff were fantastic, always cheerful and willing to help with anything.  Everything was clean and well kept.  The bed was super comfortable.  The location is great as it is just across the street to the beach and they have a nice cycle trail that guides you all over the beach area.  We spent a wonderful two days here and hope to return.

This was a perfect experience.  The entire property is immaculate.  You notice this the moment you drive into the parking garage and ride up the elevator to the lobby.  Everything is sparkling clean.  Our room was lovely, the furnishings and decor are modern, and the beds are super comfortable.  I slept like a baby both nights!  Service is top-notch.  From the minute we arrived, Fernando was so welcoming and hospitable.  When we had breakfast the first morning, he was kind enough to show us where everything was located in the breakfast room and even offered to show us how to use the waffle maker.  Breakfast was yummy...we enjoyed sausage, scrambled eggs, toast and bagels, muffins, danish, fruit juices, and hot coffee.  The landscaping of the property is beautiful...there are

Summary Heading: Inn by the Sea Best Western
Summary: The owners were very attentive and did all they could to assure our stay was very enjoyable.  They were very informative about the area with restaurant recommendations and responded to any issue we had to correct or explain the situation.  We had an ocean view with a fireplace in our room.  The room was very clean, comfortable and roomy.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the Dana Point area.

Summary Heading: A quick turn around from Phoenix!
Summary: My daughter, her boyfriend and I made a quick trip to see my son who was granted liberty from camp Pendleton for Saturday.  We left Phx at 3am Saturday, picked Tyler up at 0830, ate breakfast and REALLY wanted to check in and get settled.  Normally, check in isn't until 3pm, but I figured we could go see if we could check in early.  If all else failed we could relax on the beach until check in time.  It was about 11am when we all walked into the little lobby.  The gentleman behind the desk was so SWEET!  We shared our story with him, and he had a room cleaned and ready for us in 20 minutes!  We were so grateful!  The hotel is older, but the room was clean and comfortable for the four of us.  Our room had a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker and a nice tv (March Madness). It

I loved this hotel.  The staff was so friendly, especially Fernando. We arrived early and the rooms were being cleaned so we started to walk down the street.  He chased us to let us know a room had just been finished and we also we moved to a better room!  Loved the view and restaurants nearby.  The location provided a quick walk to the  beach and spectacular views of sunset from the hotel. Yes, I would recommend this hotel.

Memories and Expectations, - FULFILLED!!  Love this place, and the staff.  No doubt in my mind about recommending this facility to others.  Great location to beach, restaurants and other attractions.  We love San Clemente, Laguna,and San Juan Capistrano.  And Dana Point is a jewel, in its own standing!  You can't loose, if you enjoy the beach side atmosphere.  Dana Point Inn by the Sea is "Frosting on the Cake"

Summary Heading: As Close to the Beach as You Can Get
Summary: Serene hotel setting across the street from the beach.  Close to the pedestrian walkover and within walking distance of restaurants.  Comfortable room with fridge, microwave and big screen TV.  Hot breakfast with ample offerings. Short drive to Dana Point and San Clemente.  Very friendly hotel staff.

This was our second time staying at this location and we will keep staying there whenever we visit the area. We had an issue with the truck of our car and the young man behind the counter offered to help try and get it open. Even though we were not successful the young man offered us tooth paste, tooth brushes, razors and shaving cream since our stuff was in our truck. For us that was going above and beyond his job description and for that we are grateful. Those little things help when you are stressed out about not having what you need when you are out of town and hoping the trunk will eventually open. We just wanted to say Thank you very much to the staff at The Best Western Plus in Dana Point, it was a pleasure to stay at your location!

We stayed at this location for our Presidents Day long weekend.  It is right on the PCH and not too far away from Dana Point Harbor.  This is a pet friendly hotel and we took our little Chihuahua with us.  It was great to take our little for a walk around the harbor.  The staff were very friendly and the room was very clean.  The beds were also quite comfortable.  We were given a third floor room that faces PCH and was a bit noisy when the window was open, so we had to close the window and turn the AC on.  It would be nice to have some fresh air.  We thought that there were fridge and microwave in the room when we made the reservation, but it turned out that they had removed them from the rooms.  We had brought some food with us in our ice chest and we had to go down the stairs

The people at this Best Western are very kind courteous and helpful. However, the hotel suffers from a tough location. Dana Point is a beautiful place, but this Inn is on the highway and therefore VERY noisy. Besides that the amenities are very basic.

The staff very helpful and welcoming.  The view was beautiful even though there is a street between the hotel and the beach.  There are no hotels in Dana Point on the beach so the view was the best you could get.  The room was very spaciaous and comfortable.  Enjoyed our stay.

We recently had a wonderful stay at this small,well maintained hotel. We had a  balcony room with an ocean view. Although the room is at the front of the hotel it was remarkably quiet. There was very little street noise from the highway. The hotel has a quaint feeling with lovely small gardens. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom although small had a great  shower. We found the hotel to be very clean. Fernando takes great pride in the hotel and we found him to be most hospitable and helpful. He gave us some very helpful suggestions for dining, sightseeing and secured our tickets for us for Catalina Island. He went out of his way to make our stay in Dana Point memorable

also the frige was so noisy we had to unplug it very unhappy with our overall stay the food was very poor quality will not be back there are to many other places to stay to be unhappy so on and so forth

This was our first time staying here and won't be our last! Its a small quaint inn across the street from the ocean. The grounds are so pretty with fountains and flowers and it had the best free breakfast. My husband and i will be back!! Clean and cozy!

We have stayed at this hotel several times and always make it a point to stay their whenever we are in the area.  Fernando, Amy and Steve go out of their way to make sure your stay is a pleasant one.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay when in the So. California area.

Greta place to take a short getaway vacation. Comfortable rooms with incredible hospitality and wonderful proximity to a number of venues for eating, exercising and viewing. Would, and have highly recommended this hotel to friends and family.

The hotel is operated by owners' family and they pay attention to every details.  The court yards are clean and very peaceful.  Excellent personal service.  Breakfast was Simple and well stocked.  The dining area is cozy, but seems a little crowded and dark.  Overall it was a very good stay.

The best part of staying at the best western was the bed.  It was a great pillow-top bed that was extremely comfy.  Unfortunately, the bathroom area (without the tub) was probably smaller than the closet and left barely room to turn around.

Our son had hip surgery in December.  He has a college student and lives in a small apartment.  We live in Seattle and flew down to be with him during the surgery and help him recover during the first week of his recovery.  This hotel was on the ocean  and they made our stay with our son a wonderful, caring experience.  Put us in the most convenient room for easy access.  Brought extra ice, made additional coffee, checked in on us frequently.  They were incredibly attentive -- not in an overbearing way but one of general concern and a willingness to help.  The hotel was spotless and our room had an incredible view.  They recommended several places for us to have dinner within walking distance.  Even though we were there for a serious reason, our stay at this hotel felt almost

Summary Heading: Greatest find in a long time
Summary: Not often do you find a hotel that offers value and location with a staff that's all about making your stay enjoyable.  This is such an experience.  Sure, it's not brand new, but it's been well done and continues to be updated.  The Owner/manager is all about customer service.  We stayed in a balcony room with a view of the beach.  The occasional train and traffic noise was no big deal considering how comfortable we were.  5 star, no.  Value and comfort, yes.

The Best Western property at Dana Point is very interesting.  Its location is fantastic.  Along this stretch of the beach front, the railroads got first dibs, then the roads, then the buildings.  The noise is inescapable, but luckily the layout of this compound cleverly tuck the rooms around 2 adjoining courtyards.  It is quaint and gives a great sense of a ‚Äúsecret nook‚Äù for relaxation and rest.  The rooms have been remodeled and for the price we received (it is low season after all), it represents an excellent value.  Parking is free, and the rooms are much larger than expected.  There are quirks and things beyond our control, but all in all this property is the best mom-and-pop motel I have encountered in a long time.

Booked multiple nights here, thinking nice ocean view for a reasonable rate....Eh - not so much.  Clean...well maintained garden...ok breakfast.  We were prepared for the commuter train and highway separating the hotel from the beach.  But missed the fact that you have to walk along the busy highway just under .5 mile to reach a pedestrian walkway-overpass that takes you to a beach area.  So, though you can see the water, you can't easily get there - nor can you hear the waves, due to the roar of constant traffic flow.  Our "upgraded" room was large, but fronted on the street level hot tub, which kept lights blazing all night.  We kept the drapes pulled and deck door shut, to keep out the glare and the noise.  Not a lot of choices in Dana Point - just the way things are

Summary Heading: Quiet and clean near Doheny Beach
Summary: My family of four stayed one night at Inn-by-the-Sea.  This hotel is not particularly luxurious, but it is clean and comfortable with a pleasant central garden and a few public seating areas with ocean views. The room was spacious, remodeled and very clean. The front desk clerk was friendly and attentive. I like that this was one of the few hotels in Dana Point with free parking. The breakfast is your standard hotel self-serve bland, but well stocked and clean. I recommend guests grab a bowl of cereal to tide hunger over and then head up the PCH to Stacks pancake house! The main drawback of this hotel is that the ocean view is past a busy street and train tracks, and the hot tub area is right along the noisy road. However, traffic settled down in the evening. It is an easy walk

I enjoyed my stay in Dana Point. The property was clean and well maintained. I can say enough regarding the Great hospitality!!  It is very unfortunate that the review requires 200 characters because that may limited the number of individuals taking the time out to complete one.

Fernando and his people run  top-notch place to stay. A great location for access to Dana Point, Capistrano, San Clemente, and so much more! Clean and spacious rooms and grounds. As friendly and helpful a staff as anywhere. Excellent complimentary breakfast. Ease of access.

One of the nicest places, friendly, clean and customer service is beyond A+. The staff continually goes above and beyond, they truly want you to enjoy your stay. The room was beautifully decorated,spotless and having the ocean across the street was unbelievable. I would recommed this hotel to anyone who would like a great experience. I will be back a few times a year, it was that great!

Hotel staff were outstanding and very polite.  We had a room with view of ocean and a balcony - with a great sunset view!  There is a bit of road noise from the adjacent highway, but it dies down at night.  Thee is also the trains that periodically go back and forth, but they are actually pretty quiet.

The hotel location and ambiance is excellent.  Clean rooms and beautiful outside areas/gardens.  The gardens are beautiful and music plays all around.  We appreciated outside areas where we could sit and enjoy the sunset, enjoy the music, eat, drink and relax in first class patio furniture.  The ocean view is spectacular.  Everyone was helpful and professional.

The owner very kindly checked us in early, we were most grateful and hadn't expected it at all. The room was clean exactly what you expect of a Best Western. The linens were in good orders with on exception one face cloth although freshly laundered did have the remains of someone's cosmetics.   It was a quiet location and the local bar was superb for the sunset and Agostinos was close by and excellent for dinner.   The breakfast needs work. We asked for more scrambled egg and our request was unmet until we were about to leave and the owners wife asked us if we'd like more egg, we said no it was too late. The doughnut was simply awful. The only edible item was the bagel and cheese. We did try the Danish pasty that wasn't too good either.   Check out was polite and efficient.

This hotel was way more than I expected. I knew being across from the beach was the selling point but... rooms super clean and decorated nicely, staff beyond friendly, parking was easy, great little buffet breakfast, AND an ocean view from room. Steve was perfect w/making our companies reservations and not one mistake was made. Also, beds are SO comfortable. Felt like I was at the Four Seasons. Only 1 negative, needed more blankets. If that's the only negative I could come up I think this hotel has really made an impression on me. And I AM PICKY! I will be back to this hotel!!! Hopefully SOON!

My wife and I had a great trip and a lot of fun in Dana Point and we really enjoyed the Dana Point Inn-by-the Sea hotel, and surrounding area! We had a nice ocean view and balcony, and a really nice bike ride along the coast.

We enjoyed our stay here. It was right across the street from the beach and enjoyed a couple of beautiful sunsets!! The room was comfortable and the breakfast was hot and satisfying. The staff was very nice and helpful. We had a couple of mishaps during our stay (lost wallet and keys locked in car) and they were helpful. (although I wish they were more willing to look at the video cameras in the parking garage). Otherwise, we would definitely stay here again!

Both the hotel and staff are excellent. The location is close to anything one may need. The views are great. Sitting on the patio and watching the sun set over the ocean is very relaxing. Fernando, Steve and the rest of the staff can't do enough for you to make your stay memorable.

We had a great stay. The hotel is located in distance to some great restaurants. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The manager came in and set up a DVD player, so that we could watch a family movie. The service was beyond my expectations.

I stayed at this hotel, based on trip advisor reviews, and was not disappointed. Yes, it is an older hotel, but quiet and private, with a lovely courtyard. My room was large, with a very comfortable king bed, and a balcony viewing the ocean. Easy walking distance to 3 restaurants, with more available nearby. There is a pedestrian overpass close by for easy beach access; great sunset views! (Also, very easy access to highways.) The hosts are efficient and service-minded. Breakfast is included, and includes hot items as well. My wish list would include a gluten-free item like raisin bread for toast; but I was able to enjoy yogurt, fruit, scrambled eggs and coffee each morning. Thank you for a great stay! :)

Great clean rooms at affordable price.  The beach is just across the road and is very pleasant.  The weather is great.  Also many other attractions are near.  The city of Dana Point have great restaurants and the people are very cordial.

Summary Heading: BEST place to stay in Dana Point and surrounding areas
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and it is always FANTASTIC! The family who runs and owns the hotel consistently go above and beyond for their guests. In addition, the views and sounds from the rooms cannot be beat especially given the price you will pay for your stay - EXTREMEYL reasonable in comparison to the other hotels in the area. Anytime my family or I are visiting Dana Point, there is never a question as to where we will be staying - our favorite little hotel by the sea. I LOVE IT HERE!

Room was very comfortable. We had a King room with a Balcony facing the ocean. Great view & nice place to sit after a good meal in town. Bed was excellent. Microwave, refrigerator & coffee maker for those who want to stay in the room. Didn't really look at the Breakfast that was served there. (We went to Stacks Pancakes in Dana Point for breakfast because of the reviews we saw here.) The staff was very friendly. Gave us some directions & info about local restaurants. We would definitely stay here again when we're in the neighborhood.

Summary Heading: Best Western Dana Point Inn By the Sea
Summary: Outstanding!  More than expected, Staff wonderful, view was wonderful can't say enough good things..  Bed was very comfortable.   We left medine in refrigerator and discovered it missing the next day.  (our fault)  We called and Fernando personally went to our room and looked for it. The staff couldn't do enough to please us.

My favorite thing about this hotel was its location.  It was just out of a busy part of town, close to the Dana Point Harbor shopping areas but not in the middle of the hubbub.  I loved that it was right across Pacific Coast Hwy. from the ocean.  The building is charming, and it was lovely to walk out of the room in the morning and look at the ocean.  Staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. The entrance into this hotel is directly into the parking garage, not up by the office.  I missed the entrance the first time, but once I went in, I appreciated having an inside parking space. The hotel has an elevator to all floors and to the garage area.  I would definitely come back to this hotel, especially if I had more time to spend at the beach across the

Stayed here with four teenagers and my husband.  They were great!  They kept all three rooms close to each other, as per our request.  The location was ideal for us.  We were doing some college visits and the location put us between all the colleges and that really helped us out for the week.  The staff were great about answering questions about the area and giving my duaghter some ideas and things to thin about as she plans to attend college here in Cali next year!  I would definitely reccommend the hotel to others.  Normally my husband and I tend to stay at the Crowne Plaza, but the service here was excellent.  The rooms are older, and one had a musty smell, but I think it was because it was just closed up.  You are on the ocean.  The rooms are going to smell like the ocean.

Summary Heading: Quiet, well kept, pleasant hotel close to beach
Summary: This hotel is located  south of Dana Point and is across from Capistrano beach.  Very well kept, Operator is always busy working to keep it in good order.  Background music was very welcome and soothing.    Easy access to Interstate 5.   Eateries are mostly in Dana Point.  We found an excellent Thai Restaurant at San Clemente.

I stayed here in September 2013, with a baby and a hubby.  Our room had a jacuzzi tub, Bath & Body Works shampoos, and the breakfast was insanely yummy....ham, eggs, potatoes, toast, yogurt, pancakes, muffins, etc.  For the $80 ish dollars we spent through Priceline.com I was floored at what we got.  This was 5x nicer than the Disney Hotel/Paradise Pier Hotel, we stayed in the night before.  And, Disney was only about $200/night. :(  I would give this hotel 10 stars if I were given the option.  There are stores and the harbor with food, etc. within walking distance (but we did drive to get yummy sushi up the road).

This was an excellent place to stay.  Fernando, the manager, is most helpful, friendly and attentive. He has breakfast waiting every morning. The rooms are clean and the bed is great.Overall,a wonderful experience

Excellent place to stay. Very clean and friendly service. Updated rooms and well kept facility. Very kind and attentive staff. Will come back again soon. Highly recommend the location accross the street from the beach. Nice views.

This hotel is excellent.  The beds are awesome!  The staff is the best at making you feel welcome.  The hotel is quiet and peaceful.  Have stayed three different times and will go back.  Went out of their way to help make an anniversary weekend so very nice for all of us.

It was a most pleasant stay with excellent serivce and courteous personnel. The owners were most helpful when I called the hotel directly for reservations and the courteous attitude remained. Breakfast was hot, varied in it's selection and inclusive of something for everyone.  A delightful experience

We stay in romm with ocean view. Room was nice and big with full comfort, small kitchen - microwave. Romm was well furniture. The view to ocena was wonderful. Small inconvenience was the road and train line. But trains don¬¥t go in the night and noise from cars was small, acceptable. Staff was very frendly, polite. Free wifi has good signal. We was wery hapy and can recommend stay in this hotel.

If you're looking for a quaint comfortable and clean option when staying in Dana Point, CA this is the place.  If you're not afraid of staying directly off the highway, that is. I was willing, and loved it!  Very close to bridge walkway over Pacific Coast Highway; giving me direct access to the ocean and Doheny Park.  Walking distance to restaurants.   Would stay there again, and recommend to other adventuresome spirits.

Unavoidable:  The car traffic and the train traffic if you want the view. We had an Oceanfront king room. It was extremely nice. Nicely furnished...refrig, microwave, easy chair, business desk, flat screen, balcony etc.  Very friendly staff, underground free parking, free wi-fi, free breakfast. I would 100% stay there again and deal with the traffic noise to have the view. No pool but an oceanfront hot tub.

Summary Heading: A pleasant place to stay between San Diego and Los Angeles
Summary: I found the Best Western at Dana Point a very pleasant place to stay when you need to be close to Laguna Beach. Laguna Beach was expensive and crowded so we booked a room at Dana Point.
