This was convenient to Laguna Beach and best of all, was very comfortable. The rooms have been attractively decorated in pleasing colors. Choose a room away from the street so you'll avoid street noise.

Overall, we had a very enjoyable experience.  The room had plenty of space and we had a lovely view of the ocean.  There was free parking - a nice perk since many of the hotels in DP charge for it.  They served a hot and cold breakfast with a variety of choices.  There was a beach was across the street and a 10 minute drive to the DP Marina.  Loved walking around the marina - good for a fast walk or a run.  If you're not looking for a high-end resort, this BW is a great alternative.

Whenever possible we make the trip from WI to CA and visit our Marine son at Camp Pendleton.  We've stayed at the Inn by the Sea two times in the past seven months.  The owners and their employees could not have been more hospitable towards us.  All were very friendly, courtious, and helpful.  Ferdinand and Steven remembered us from our first visit.  The property is very well kept and clean.  The rooms we occupied were spacious and the beds were very comfortable.  In comparison to other hotels that we haved stayed at the Continental breakfast that they serve is one of the best that we have had. The Hotel is on the PCH with easy access to the beach and easy access to the Interstate.  Our son will return to the states in May of 2014 and we look forward to staying with Ferdinand

tell anyone about this hotel cuz it will end up costing me a weekend at this hotel from overbooking.This hotel is first class in everyway,it is family owned and they take great pride in their hotel,the place is spotless clean,the rooms have flat screen tvs hd etc,the location is ideal from our balconey we had a an unobstructed view of the pacific ocean,Doheny st park is right across pch1 at this park you can park your car less than 50' from the beach rarely did we see more than 30 people on the beach very quiet and relaxing,for dining less than 5 miles away is dana point harbor that had at least 8 restaurants that serve fresh seafood,we sampled 3 of them and all were excellent,the rooms are alittle old but well maintained  and clean well stocked with nice coffemakers etc.we had

The entire staff was very attentive and helpful. The location was very nice with a few mitute walk to the beach, which was visable from our room, and large deck. A very nice stay overall, and the owner, Fernando, bent over backwards to ensure was smooth and enjoyable. Very nice people.

My girlfriends and I attended the Pageant of the Masters, galleries and exhibits in Laguna Beach. We were looking for a room for 3, that was clean, within driving distance (approx. 10 min) to the day activities and knew we would require a late check in ...Fernando, the owner, the room and parking were waiting for us when we arrived at 11pm.  Fernando and his wife were helpful, courteous, pleasant...  They serve a complementary breakfast full of assorted foods that filled the appetite of the hungry and not so...this was a great choice for our purposes and if the beach had been our goal we were right across the street...thank you for your hospitality and we will be back! Mary-Ellen Robinson

This is a great hotel with a great location, a super nice staff and nice rooms with great sunset views. There are many options for dining within walking distance and some high end dining a short car ride away. The hotel id family operated and they go out of there way to make sure your experience is stellar.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Trip, Nice hotel, and friendly/knowledgeable staff
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for a mini-vacation. The staff was extremely knowledgeable about the amenities offered by the area and seemed to have an endless list of recommendations. The room was really nice and I recommend the ocean view. Waking up to the sound of the waves in the morning is awesome. I also love the City of Dana Point; we went biking around the marina, kayaking in the marina, and walking along the beach. Only piece of advice is that there is PCH and a rail line that creates noise during the day; definitely quite between 8:00 PM and 8:00 AM, but if you plan on sleeping in late or going to bed early, you may be disappointed, especially if you are a light sleeper. This did not affect my vacation, but definitely take this into account for your trip. I highly recommend

This "Best Western" didn't meet my expectations as far as view of the beach.  Train was right across the street from hotel which ran several times day and night.  In our room we had fruit flies really bad and complained, he said there's nothing he could do.  For "$259." plus it wasn't quite up to a class A room.  The view certainly wasn't worth it traffic noise and trains, no pool.  Parking was rough Friday night with other folks taking up two spaces.  So, would I go back the answer is absolutely not nor would I recommend it to anyone I know!! I JUST GAVE AWAY 500.00 DOLLARS.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us while attending the Pageant of the Masters with you mother.  Most of our guests are very pleased with our location, especially the beach and ocean, so we are saddened that it was not to your expectation.  The Ritz Carlton is the only location in Dana Point to have a better view and access to the beach.  Typically, fruit flies are not found in hotel rooms, they are attracted by exposed fruit, which was the case during your stay.  We removed your trash with the fruit immediately and aired out the room to allow them to leave.  Spraying or fogging the room with insecticide is not our preferred method, for it would be excessive, and hope you understand our use of more natural methods to reduce adverse impacts for any future guests.

Summary: Great place to stay while attending the  Pageant. Service is very good. Fernando (at the desk for breakfast) was very solicitous to all. Laguna Beach (Pageant site) is 7 minutes away. Very crowded there and traffic is slow. Use the trollies. They are free and run quite often. No long waits. Dana Point has fine beaches,marinas and restaurants. A slower pace.

My entire family booked rooms for a wedding weekend, and the service, accommodations and friendless was wonderful.. Steven (manager) and his staff went out of their way to make everyone comfortable.  I will definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Dana Point Inn By the Sea
Summary: Very nice family that runs this hotel.  They are caring and pleasant. The waffles at breakfast were great.  Something different than the usual fare. Definitely needed the personal lesson they gave on how to make one.   There were fresh scrabmled eggs, sausage, bagles, raisin bread, pastries, fruit, fruit juice, and cereals for variety too.  Love the fact they had skimmed as well as regular milk.  Good value and a convenient location to my activities.  The restaurants within walking distance were tasty and reasonably priced.

We'd intended to stay at the other Best Western in town, but GPS brought us here instead. The other hotel is larger and less expensive, but the desk person told us this one offers upgrades that the other does not: 36" flatscreen TVs, pillowtop beds, free parking. So we figured it was a wash and we were already here, so we stayed. The vaulted ceiling 2Q room was nice and roomy, and the beds comfortable. This was a fine launching point for our whale watching tour, which is why we were in Dana Point at all.

Clean room, comfortable bed, free WiFi, close to restaurants, courteous helpful staff.  It's located just across the road from Doheny Beach so there's a great view of the Pacific Ocean plus you get to watch the activity at the beach.  Serenity garden in the common area is very calming and relaxing!  Hot breakfast in the morning is wonderful.  There are several other hotels in the same area but we always choose this one.

Hotel served the purpose of exactly what I need, near the Ocean clean and inexpensive, staff were also very nice to deal with.  I was told I would be able to check in early on my arrival but had to wait till after 3.  That was only negative.  The area is nice but not many options for shopping resteraunts within walking distance.  All in all I would go back to this location as the being near the beach and cost was my top priority.

We had planned on checking in to hotel next to best western but we were unable to because of the power outage.we couldn't find the lobby nor was any phone being answered.  The manager, forgot name think might have been fernando, saw us standing outside with flashlights trying to call and came out to see if he could be of assistance, he offered us a room at half price and it being late allowed us to stay an extra hour before checking out so we could get some sleep.  Showed us to the room with bright flashlights and lent us flash lights for the night.  Free continental breakfast complete wtih eggs and waffles was a plus.  Room was roomy and nice all and all an excellent experience

Summary Heading: worked out well for us with a wheelchair
Summary: The staff are very attentive to make every detail of your stay as comfortable as possible.  We wound up having 2 adjoining rooms with full ocean view.  We were pleased with the stay and the service.  The rooms were nice, with a nice 'mini' kitchen area with a microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot and even a sink, with a couple of drawers and cupboards.  The private balcony patios were very pleasant.    The owners are very detail oriented and have made the common areas very nice and attractive.  We drove to the State Park and borrowed a handicap wheelchair from the lifeguards for free and it made our dreams come true.  Mom was able to put her feet on ocean beach sand and even get her hands a feet wet (albeit from a bucket filled with an ocean wave).

As a teacher, I can't afford the luxury of staying at an overpriced hotel. Every time I stay at a Best Western, I am reminded that I do not need to overpay for excellent service and great accommodations. Thanks Best Western for making my family and me feel like we are on vacation and deserving of great service.

Summary Heading: A great place before our wedding!
Summary: We checked in here so that we would have a place close to our wedding venue.  It proved to be a terrific choice.  The hotel has an awesome beach setting and the staff was very helpful.  They were aware of our wedding plans and worked to ensure that we and our guests were provided with the best of rooms, that everything was clean, and that all amenities were available to us.  A great, helpful staff!!

Summary Heading: great experience, focus on personal touch
Summary: We enjoyed our stay and particularly the warm, personal, yet professional attention to detail of the staff.  We enjoyed the view from the room and the common spaces of the hotel were very pleasant.  The beds were very comfortable.  It was nice to have a mini kitchen area w/ a frig, microwave and sink in the room.  It is obvious the owners of the hotel take great pride in their property and do everything they can to make their guests comfortable.  We appreciated the recommendation of dinner at the Chart House. The Chart House has a great sunset view of the harbor. We were pleasantly surprised to have personalized paper menus with our name on them, and a complimentary dessert based on Steven of the BW Plus making our reservation. The food, presentation and view at the restaurant

We picked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed.  The location was great- right across the street from the beach and an easy drive to the Dana Point Marina.  Beach access is with a pedestrian bridge - I have knee problems, but I took the bridge slowly and was fine.    We happened to stay there on July 4th and had an amazing view of the fireworks in the bay.  The staff were friendly and courteous.   The rooms are clean and roomy but aren't fancy.  The only thing (and it was my fault for not checking) was no pool.   But with easy beach access, my son had plenty of water time.

My son called at the last minute and wanted to bring his family to stay at the beach for the 4th of July weekend. We wanted Laguna, but there was nothing to be found that was under $500 - $700. When I found this location it stated that it was right across the road from the beach. That is true, but the walk to the overpass that goes to the beach is quite a little hike. The beach there is rocky and uncomfortable. Everyone ended up with bruises and scrapes. To be fair, the staff was lovely and very accomodating. The breakfast was varied and good. The host was helpful and the rooms (we had two) were clean. There is no pool and only a little spa that closes at 9:00 PM. They did make an exception and let us stay until 10. So, some good and some not so good. We do not plan to go back.

Right on the Pacific Coast Highway... cross the highway and you're on the beach in Dana Point. Request a back room where it's a little quieter from traffic.  Yes, the train does go by, infrequently, but it's bearable... this place is great value for money.  Staff is super-friendly and helpful, and the included breakfast is delicious and plentiful.  Rooms are motel-style, but clean and well-maintained. Definitely recommend.

The staff, is very welcoming, and nice. My husband took me there, for our 1st Anniversary, surprise, and what a surprise it was... Read further.  Furthermore, if you do book the front rooms facing the ocean (which we had), little something to keep in mind: 1- Yes, you do have your own patio off the rooms, however, they failed to mentioned no privacy wall. The people next to us, could here, and see our every move. Not to mention look into our room, if we did not have the curtains closed.  2- No AC. in our rooms. They only had a fan. Our weekend was not only hot, but moggy. 3- Railroad 20yrds from the hotel, and the noise from the cars, off of PCH, made it hard to enjoy the patio. We had to raise our voices. Due to this. Our first night there, the people next door, were out on
Manager Response: Thank you for including very helpful tips on access to the beach.  Our location does have its share of vehicles but fortunately it is only residential commuters and not the typical congested traffic usually experienced on Pacific Coast Hwy.  We do understand that everyone has a different level of sensitivity of what they consider to be a disturbance, but we ensure you that we always do our best to minimize disturbances from other guests.  Please inform us if a guest does not comply with our initial request so we may take further action.  All rooms are outfitted with a digital AC controller on a central "green" system. For future reference, please inquire with the front desk on how to use the AC if there is any confusion, we would be happy to assist you with the functions.  We sympathise with your discomfort and will use this in training with our staff to reinforce our customer service.  There is just a bit of confusion as to how all of this discomfort is "Miss leading" as your title describes.  If there was anything that led you to believe something about our hotel was falsely represented and was not what was received, please call me at the hotel.  We value all feedback and are always looking for ways to improve.  Again, thank you for taking the time to write a review for us.

Summary: This is the nicest Best Western I have stayed at, from their beautifully-tended quiet courtyard to the little extra touches that made their breakfast a real meal, a nice little picnic patio high up overlooking the ocean, and excellent local advice from the front desk staff.  Note that all of the hotels along this row are actually across the road and railroad from the beach, not really directly on the beach.  But it's as close as you can get in the immediate area, and easy access to the ocean, and Dana Point has some other lovely beaches for swimming within a very close drive.  When I am in Dana Point again we will definitely stay here - a good family vacation place.

My wife and I stayed here during our wedding anniversary getaway. On an earlier anniversary trip we stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Resort. We'd choose this hotel above the Resort hands down for our next time in Dana Point. At the Resort you get great views and amenities, but you pay through the nose for them and the service comes with the attitude that they are doing you a favor by simply being there. An no sour grapes here; our stay then was fine. But this one on the other hand is a family run hotel where they treat you like it matters to them that you are happy with every aspect of your stay, and they'll do anything to make you want to return. Well, they succeeded. They arranged a VIP table at the Chart House for us, the room was immaculate, water, temperature control, and did I

Summary Heading: Best kept secret in Dana Point
Summary: My wife and I have stayed in this hotel  a few times before and always had a great stay.  The owners, Fernando and his family, are gems in the Best Western chain.  This hotel is more like a boutique hotel than a typical Best Western.  Best Western could take a lot of valuable lessons from Fernando.  The well-manicured courtyard is meticulously maintained and has an incredible view of the ocean, but the attention to detail is what catches your eye and creates such a memorable atmosphere.  We stayed there recently and while we were there we received a knock on the door - Fernando was presenting a gift to my wife because they remembered from a previous visit that it was my wife's birthday.  It was a small gift but an amazing gesture from a family with hearts of gold.  But it wasn't

The service really sets this hotel apart!!! I have stayed in many, many hotels for both business and pleasure and I ALWAYS return to hotels that set themselves apart by the service they give. Wonderful, spacious room with a great view of the ocean. I was also surprised at how quiet it was given the fact that PCH is at your front door and the train tracks are close as well. You are right across the street from the beach and a stroll down the street for restaurants and bars. Really no reason to even get into your car.  I WILL be back!! Shannon B.

Excellent lodging for rest and relaxation. Ocean view rooms are the best. the accommodations are worth the rates. The room I had on my last visit was roomy and comfortable. Service OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!!!

I would stay here again just for the service. Both Fernando and Steve were great.They made sure we had a great room and anything we needed. The room was fantastic. The location is great for long walks on the beach. I will stay here again anytime I get the chance.

loved the Ocean View room w/ fireplace! beautiful room, SPACIOUS, awesome ocean view (sunset so peaceful on balcony even w/cars passing below) n just PERFECT for our night away! We went for walks on beach (just cross the bridge & u r on the sand), relaxing sitting there for hours too w ocean waves so healing!  Went to Agostino's (100 yards down street) for dinner.  Excellent service @agostino's btw!  Staff at Best Western was GREAT! When I checked out rooms before reserving (I live locally & this was surprise for my husband's bday), office staff showed me all my options to help me make decision. When I saw fireplace ocean view room, I knew it was perfect! Total escape for us to get away for just 24hrs. So needed n so healing n I recommend this place highly. It is very

I wouldn't imagine staying anywhere else in South Orange County. The staff is incredibly friendly, the rooms are always pristine, the location is perfect for solo, family, or group stays. Beach across the road with several delicious restaurants and bars within walking distance. I always look forward to my time there, its one of my favorite hotels nationwide. Small family feel and they're willing to go the extra mile for each of their guests. I hope you experience the same joy I do when you visit.

I had an amazing stay.  The staff was very warm and welcoming and the room was perfect.  I couldn't have asked for anything more.  I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting or staying ion the area.

Summary Heading: Great service. Clean room. Superb view.
Summary: Steven was very helpful. Offered some good tips on the local restaurants. Was able to get us a balcony room at the last minute at a good price. We look forward to going back there. Wonderful secluded courtyard.

great caring staff. clean. nice breakfast. fair price. protected underground garage for our car. we have been staying there for 6 years on the same week end foe an event at the state park. it is very convienient. fairly priced and a good value fo the area.

I can usually find something wrong with a motel/hotel. Happy to report NOTHING wrong here. I can't even believe I'm saying this. Room was great (we did have an ocean view w/patio). It was super.  A/C worked and was quiet. Internet/Wi-Fi was excellent. Mini fridge had a freezer. Bed very comfortable. Patio facing ocean is super and if you are lucky you may see a great sunset. Hot breakfast. Good location with many restaurants and attractions nearby. As I said in the beginning I can't believe I am saying this but... 5 Stars on all counts. We will be back for sure.  OK, I must find something wrong....It's not $50/nite  ;)  but worth every dollar over that...

Summary Heading: Outstanding location, breakfast, room and customer service!!
Summary: This was a great hotel to stay in for our spring break vacation.  Conveniently located across the street from the beach and close to I-5, this hotel has good access to almost all that there is to do in Southern California.  The street in front of the hotel is a little busier than we had hoped (not the hotels fault),  but the sidewalks are wide enough that it was not a real concern.  The full breakfast was very good and had a wide variety of food options for the whole family.  What sets this hotel apart from the rest is the super nice, friendly staff / owners!  We left there knowing the owners would do anything for us to make our stay a great one.  We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to stay in the Dana Point /
Manager Response: Thank you for finding our location central to all Southern California has to offer.  We are grateful that you allowed us to be a part of your vacation plans and appreciate the notice of our customer service.  We hope you will let us serve you for future memories.

Summary: This was the best of five hotels we stayed in while visiting California. It was impeccably clean and comfortable. The free parking under the bldg was fantastic and the free breakfast was delicious and offered everything from make-your-own-waffles to cereal, eggs and sausage, muffins and bagels, juice, coffee and tea and fresh fruit! Great way to start our days! The hotel manager could NOT have been nicer and was incredibly kind and accomodating. Little tip - if you are too tired to go out and eat, there is a great Italian restaurant in walking distance! Eat there or pick it up and eat in bed!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel.  We are grateful when a seasoned traveler and highly ranked reviewer leaves candid comments about their stay.  Agostino's Italian restaurant is only a few steps away and is a local favorite, thank you for feeling at home enough to dine in your room.  Whether enjoying the afternoon sun, having dinner, or just a night cap, our ocean view balcony rooms are enjoyable for their spanning Pacific Ocean views and relaxing sounds of waves crashing ashore.

Summary: We stayed just the one night (March 23) at your Dana Point Inn by the sea and were greeted by a very pleasant young woman at the desk by the name of‚Äì‚ÄìI think‚Äì‚ÄìAspen.  She was particularly helpful in securing a suitable room for us and offering advice on restaurants and local activities in the area which we investigated during the later part of the day. A very enjoyable stay and a charming and personable employee to deal with.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel during your trip from Canada.  Aspyn is a great front desk agent and we are proud to have her on our team.  Our staff is trained to be courteous and we encourage them to be familiar with the local area so all of our guests may maximize their time during their visit to our uncommercialized ocean front town.

Summary: A very nice place with friendly people (staff). Beautiful and peaceful landscape (garden, flowers and fountains). Big and clean room. Nice breakfast.  A place where we spent good moments and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind comments and taking note of our garden areas.  Our basic room is called a Garden View room so we do pride ourselves in having beautiful flowers and well groomed plants around our neptune and mermaid fountains.

Summary: Read about BW Dana Point IbtS on tripadvisor and decided to book. Beautiful grounds in a tightly built location. Free parking and WiFi. Carpet was worn,but clean. PCH and train noise blocked when patio door closed.  We booked the Quality Inn immediately next door on our return night from Catalina, nicer room and better price.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your trip to Catalina, we hope you had a good visit to the island during one of our warm sunny days this year in Southern California.  We appreciate you bringing the worn carpet issue to our attention but unfortunately I was not able to see wear in any of our ocean view balcony rooms.  Our carpet is fairly new since we are newly renovated and we have a regular carpet cleaning schedule to keep everything fresh and clean.  If you have a moment, please call us with a little more detail on the carpet issue.  We value feedback like this so we may constantly improve.

Summary: This was a wonderful hotel. I usually don"t stay at Best Western so i didn't know what to expect. We got a terrific value for the money. Cleanliness is very important to me and this place was top-notch! Super clean. Very comfortable beds in an over-sized standard room. The grounds were landscaped very nicely with Asian touches. Very zen-like with various sitting areas and fountains. Soothing Asian music playing in courtyard area. This was overlooking the ocean and provided an outdoor patio with oceanviews. This was where we ate our breakfast. This was one of the nicest places I have stayed. Staff was very welcoming and helpful with directions. I would definitely return here, and recommend it for anyone visiting this area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay.  We are very pleased to hear that you stay with us was a relaxing one and we left a positive impression as your first Best Western PLUS hotel.  Welcome back any time.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with pleasant and helpful staff
Summary: The hotel is south of Dana Point proper so not within walking distance of many restaurants, grocery stores, etc. Still, there were a few restaurants nearby. Free WiFi worked well in the rooms. The breakfast was good.  The good news is that you can see the ocean from the hotel. The bad news is that there are train tracks between the hotel and the beach although there is a pedestrian overpass nearby.   Amtrak and Los Angeles commuter trains use the tracks and need to blow their horns due to a road crossing. We were there on a weekend and the trains started at 7:30 AM and ended and 10:30 PM so they did not disturb our sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel and the great comments about our free WiFi and Hot Breakfast.  As travelers ourselves, we understand the importance of a good hearty breakfast in the morning and having fast reliable WiFi connection to command the day.  You will be glad to know that the Train will no longer blow it's horn on your next visit to our hotel.  After working for 3 long years with the local residents, our area is now a quiet zone and the trans can zip right by without a sound.

Summary: Wonderful hotel and great location. Very relaxing. We were in town for a soccor tournament and plan to go back when we have more time. Everyone was friendly and accommondating. The ocean view was very beautiful.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel.  We are pleased that we were able to offer you a relaxing stay here in front of the Pacific Ocean.  Our view is unmatched in this area and we are very fortunate to have such an unobstructed direct view of the water from our property and private balcony ocean view rooms.  Please keep us in mind during your next visit or tournament in town.

Summary: We spent 2 nights here for New Year's Eve. Except for the train noise, which didn't bother us, it was quiet and clean w/ a wonderful view of the ocean.  Staff very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was typical for these hotels...  waffle maker, cold cereal, packaged pastries, scrambled eggs and sausage. I'm not crazy about this food but for most Americans it is fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing in the New Year with us and allowing us to be your hotel of choice during the celebration.  We are sorry to hear that the train was a disturbance but you will be pleased to hear that the train will no longer use their horn when passing our hotel.  Our area is now considered a quiet zone for trains, which allows them to pass silently.

Summary: We were in town over the Christmas/New Years Holiday and had a two night stay in Dana Point.  I chose the Best Western for Value and Location.  I booked through EntertainmentHotelBucks and got a great deal, we actually were going to extend our stay but I could not get the same price again but the hotel was willing to match it, but we opted to continue with our Original plan to go back into the Desert (Palm Springs).  This is right across from the Beach - there is nothing but a few passing cars to obstruct your view.  I love that Best Westerns include waffle and eggs breakfasts, along with other Continental Breakfast Items.  And that they include Free WiFi.  This particular location had a underground parking area, which when its full it would be hard to move around if your not a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a detailed review and noticing our completely renovated rooms.  We are constantly working on our hotel to make sure things do not feel dated, but are fresh, contemporary, and clean.  I will make sure to commend our front desk for their efforts, they do enjoy their jobs and it definitely shows.  We are proud that they embrace our motto of "treat guests like family."

Summary Heading: A good start to our holiday
Summary: We flew in Los Angeles and arrived late so phoned the hotel to advise it would be about 11pm When we will arrive at 11.30pm there was someone there to greet us and was very helpful. We had an Ocean view room which was very nice. But the down side was the noise from the trains and road but to be honest  this may be that the wife is a light slipper and we were both Jet lagged.Plenty of parking under the Hotel, great free breakfast.
Manager Response: We are delighted to be your hotel of choice to kick off your holiday.  Thank you for taking the time to notice our newly renovated rooms and hope the Sealy memory foam pillow top mattresses helped you to sleep after the train disturbance.  You will be glad to hear that during your future visits, the train will no longer toot their horns when passing.  After a very long process, we were able to create a silent zone near our hotel so all of our guests will be able to receive a good nights sleep.

Summary: I might have rated this hotel average if it weren't literally across from the beautiful Pacific Ocean, but I can't because of that fact.   I was curious as to who would rate this hotel "terrible". I always find it a bit suspicious when terrible reviewers only leave one or two reviews.    First off, I don't know anyone who pays for breakfast here. Maybe that was under old management because now the breakfast is included in the hotel stay and it's not horrible, but it's nothing amazing either.   If you're staying in Dana Point please venture outside of your hotel's continental breakfast and dine at one of it's great breakfast/brunch locations.   Our room/ semi-private balcony was facing the ocean. Yes the main road is right in front of the hotel, but I've never seen it busy enough

Summary Heading: One of the "Best" "Best Westerns I've been to recently
Summary: Great room, great rate.....less than 150/ night midweek, across the street from the "Blue Pacific"  Great sunset.  Spacious room, micro, very cold frig, small bathroom but very adequat.  Nice deck overlooking theGreat Pacific.  Plenty of parking under the Hotel, great FREE FULL breakfast, eggs, toast, muffins, juice, coffee, tea, hot choc, freash fruit.....very helpful staff

This hotel was such a pleasant surprise! Very clean, beds clean & comfortable. Nice granite, clean fridge & microwave in room. Super cute well kept courtyard- Hot tub was clean. The breakfast was better than average, As well. Totally recommend & hope to get the chance to go again. Our room was right across the the way from ocean. Gorgeous views!

We were visiting friends less than a half mile away so we were not expecting much even with all the good trip advisor reviews. We were pleasantly surprised and feel we can safely say we stay no where else when visiting Orange County again. Our room was large and the bed was the super comfy and not just on hotel standards - it was a good bed. And good pillows which is such a rarity in hotels. Parking was easy and it was great to wake up and get a cup of coffee and cereal from the breakfast bar and sit looking at the ocean. For those not familiar with this part of southern CA be warned that you are right on PCH and right across from the train tracks. But so are most of the other places so do yourself a favor and stay here.

my wife and i stayed here in september for three nights. i'll give you the bottom line first...there are much better choices in the area at lower prices. i can only blame myself for waiting to the last minute and doing too little research. we had enough time while there to visit other hotels for future visits to the area. i have traveled quite a bit and have done trip advisor reviews for at least three years. the positives for this property are decent staff, some rooms recently renovated, free underground parking, and little else. knowing what we were paying (>$200/night), we were dissapointed on arrival and was frankly a bit embarassed in front of my wife. the negatives are: dark and musty rooms (albeit with recent furniture/carpets), a general feeling of run-down and

This is an older hotel but is well kept and the owners a friendly and accommodating. I recommend getting a room with a fireplace even if you aren't needing to use it, because the room is bigger and has a high ceiling, as well as being on a higher floor. The highway noise on the first floor is worse, but is constant no matter what-otherwise we could have listened to the ocean right across the street. We were usually only there during the evening-and the train didn't bother us at all. If you want to take any cruises or go to Catalina, the harbor is only about five minutes away. The room does have a musty odor so you may want to take some air freshener or incense. I think it is just due to the age of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable!

I spent a weekend there recently to just recharge and enjoy some beautiful scenery and relaxation. The staff was very attentive, nice beautiful gardens with lovely classical music playing; very nice rooms with comfy pillow top beds and balcony with spectacular ocean views and sunset. The only drawback (which has to do with location) is the amount of traffic noise from PCH. It dies down later at night and I would have loved to open the windows to get fresh air and hear the ocean waves at night but the porch light was so bright and could not be turned off so I had to keep A.C. on all night instead.

Summary Heading: Avoid: Paid for breakfast, got no breakfast
Summary: This funny hotel: I checked in and was told by the lady that I needed to pay an additional USD 14 for breakfast. I could not opt out of that fee. Well, the next day I had to catch an early flight, so I went at 7.10am to the breakfast room. Everything was locked, no one was there. At 7.10am I couldn't expect to get breakfast which I have paid for?

This was our second stay. We come for an annual family event at Doheny State Beach. This Best Western is walking distance to the beach and bon fire, close to the overpass. It is a great location. This is a family-run hotel, clean, well managed. We really like the personal attention from the owners. Also, the beds and pillows are terrific, soft any comfy. We'll be back.

Summary Heading: A hidden gem, wonderful ambience, great location
Summary: We recently stayed at the Best Western Plus Dana Point Inn By The Sea for a short mini vacation. What a wonderful surprise!  Great location minutes from the beach, free continental breakfast, caring staff, and soothing gardens. Convenient to adjacent cities--Laguna Beach, San Juan Capistrano, and San Clemente. Ear plugs are provided just in case the Amtrack doesnt lull you to sleep. What is nice is that the rooms have a balcony with views of ocean and you dont have to walk forever to get to your room. Rooms are tastefully updated and comfortable. You could take the overhead walkway to get to the beach quickly. All in all, a nice stay.

Summary Heading: NOISE from room above, train tracks and Pacific Coast Highway
Summary: To be fair the rooms are well appointed and clean.  The staff was very helpful.  The garden [less expensive rooms away from the highway] were much quieter and cooler.  The high price rooms [facing the ocean] were noisy and hot.  Every time the folks in the room above us took a step it sounded like a drum beat.  The hotel is removed from the beach by both railroad tracks and the Pacific Coast Highway.  The tracks serve both passenger and freight so can be quite noisy both day and night.  I have had better breakfasts at much lower price and quality motels.

Summary Heading: Not for light sleepers or believers in the Constitution
Summary: I booked this hotel over the St. Regis because of it's great and consistent reviews and thought that there was a value play here.  Everyone who rated this hotel highly must be deep sleepers and don't care about their freedoms.  Upon checking in, Fernando, who I'm assuming is the proprietor, wanted to scan my driver's license.  As a staunch believer in my privacy, I refused.  He gives me this BS about how it is for my protection.  We compromised and I let him enter my D/L number in the computer.  Then he wanted the license plate of my car.  What next?  My blood type?  You allow yourself to give up a little bit of freedom each day until you wake up one day without any.  The garage was woefully short on parking.  Worst of all, there was a trailer parked in the handicap spot which
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and choosing to book with us over the St Regis.  As an establishment which is a part of one of the worlds largest hotel chains, we ensure you that your safety and security is of the utmost importance to us.  When we ask for your ID during the check in process, it is to ensure that you are in fact the owner of the credit card.  Your ID is never scanned here at the hotel.  Please understand that if merchants did not ask for proper identification with a credit card, it would leave identity thieves an easier means to using your credit card without authorization.  We apologize if you find this to be a nuisance but we will continue to practice strict security measures to ensure the privacy and security of all our guests.

Summary: We loved this place! We are use to large hotels with big lobbies and lots of amenities, but we did not miss them as this quaint little hotel was comfy, quiet, and pleasant. The small sitting areas are surrounded by well kept gardens. The beds were a true Queen size, and the location was close to everything we wanted to do. The staff was pleasant and helpful from the time we called to make reservations until we checked out. The 'warm breakfast' is simple so don't expect a big buffet. Added plus: no hidden cost - free parking, and a staff that gave perfect recommendations and directions to the best beaches, restaurants, etc.

Summary Heading: BEST WESTERN PLUS Dana Point Inn By The Sea
Summary: WAY overpriced. Friendly staff. Nice location. Over $400 a night! Totally not worth it. My husband booked this and was told it was a much nicer room than what it turned out to be. The room looked like it was incomplete/in the middle of a renovation. Jacuzzi closed at 9pm (even on the weekends) so we couldn't go for a soak after dinner. Nice place to ride your bike but we had to lock them to our car as there wasn't anywhere to store them. The bathroom was so small that the bath mat didn't even fit on the floor. Some mildew in the shower.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid comments. From the description of your stay, I am slightly confused if this stay was at our hotel. All of our shower areas have plenty of space for a floor mat and all of our rooms have been completely renovated for a year now.  Our hotel has a bicycle locking area that is secure and is available for use by all guests.  There is another Best Western PLUS that has recently joined our brand only a few weeks ago and I have been told that they are still in the process of finishing renovations.  This converted hotel is only 1.5 miles away from us on the same street in Dana Point so it is very understandable for a possible confusion in hotels.  Many guests have arrived at the wrong hotels only to be directed back to the correct one.  If we are the correct hotel, please call us so we may understand which part of the room seemed under renovation or what we can do to ensure a more comfortable stay during your next visit.

Summary: Very nice place.  Great service (looks to be family owned and operated).  We did like the location because it is close to everything in Dana Point.  Note: It is very close to the beach, but not right on it.  Although it has an ocean view, you need to walk down the street and across PCH to get sand between your toes.  The train tracks are across PCH, but we did not hear a train at night.  All of the hotels on PCH are the same from this perspective, so it's not a plus or minus for this property.

What a wonderful staff!  Manager Steve and Fernando went out of their way to may everythng special.  Outstanding restaurant reservation.  Room was terrific and could not have been any better!  The grounds were immaculate and their assistance was especially nice as we did not know the area!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful comments.  We do pride ourselves in our customer service and appreciate it when our guests take notice.

Summary Heading: Great find! Great room! Great view!
Summary: One night on our way back to LA. Wish we could have stayed longer as the room was great, spacious with all that we needed and more! Didn't have time to use the sauna or take full advantage of the outside seating...what a view too!  The breakfast was better than expected with selection of cakes, bagels, cereals, sausages, eggs and make your own waffles! A really attractive arrangement of balconies, seating, water features, gardens and fantastic views of the sea...beautiful!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time in reviewing our hotel and posting a picture of the Mermaid garden.  We are very pleased to hear that we were able to provide a comfortable and relaxing stay for your trip back to LA.  Please let us know the next time you are in town, we have fabulous deals with the local restaurants and there are many different ocean view romantic hideaways in Dana Point.

Summary: We came here late one night after the place we checked in next door was uninhabitable.  I wasn't really familiar with the Best western brand and expected just a clean, comfortable room, IF there were even any available.  Luckily there was, and the manager on duty was extremely nice and let us look at the room first.  I think he felt sorry for us knowing somewhat about the place next door and took $40 off the list rate.  The room was spectacular!  Very modern, very clean with Memory Foam matresses. I was VERY impressed.  It was probably the nicest room we stayed in on our 9 day trip down the coast.  It also included breakfast.  I would definitely stay here again.

Excellent place, spacious, clean, BIG flat screen TV; a room with all the amenities (microwave, fridge, iron), very comfortable beds, and excellent breakfast (included). We just finished two weeks driving through California, staying at a different place every night, and this was the best place by far for the money. Plus - great ocean view, beach access, and a hot tub - what's not to like!

We were planning our first family vacation. We wanted to stay on the beach and in a nice area but still affordable. This hotel for all our needs. They provided a pack and play got our infant son. The view from our room was worth it all. I enjoyed eating breakfast on the deck while watching the beach and people. The dining area for breakfast Is pretty small but with such great weather and views, who wants to eat inside? Being such a small hotel, it was quite. One downfall was no pool, but they have a hot tub with beach views. Would stay again if ever back in the area.

Our impeccably clean  room on the second floor with its high ceilings felt roomier than anticipated. The owners and staff provided excellent service, and the continental (expanded) breakfast was a nice surprise.  Very refreshing to find a place were great care is given.

We just returned from an overnight stay; my husband and I were celebrating both of our birthdays.  Upon check-in we met Fernando, who is truly wonderful!  He checked us in, and gave us our room key.  The room was on the first floor facing the ocean and had a nice, private balcony.  I had just finished telling my husband that I wish I had requested a room on a higher floor when the phone rang.  It was Fernando upgrading us to a bigger room on the second floor!  He was at the door 30 seconds later with the new keys and mentioned that he saw that it was my birthday and wanted us to have an upgrade.  He then mentioned that if we would like, he would make reservations for us at the Chart House up the street, where they will treat us like VIPs, provide us with a great table and a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time in writing such a wonderful review.  We are happy to see that we could play a small part in making your birthdays just a little more special.  The Chart House is one of the best restaurants in Dana Point with spectacular ocean views and also a local favorite.  We are the only 3 star hotel in this area that does not charge for parking and our beds are top of the line Sealy memory foam pillow top mattresses.  Thank you for taking notice in the quality  and value we provide and allowing us the opportunity to serve you.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel in Sept. 2011 for 6 nights during a visit from Scotland and can honestly say it was one of the most enjoyable hotels we have ever stayed at. Steven and the rest of the family who own the hotel go out of their way to ensure that the guests are made to feel special during their stay for example  we were loaned  flashlights to walk along the beach at night.  The location is excellent (only 1 mile from the harbour area)  and the atmosphere is very friendly.  The family even made our anniversary more special by upgrading us and leaving a lovely gift in our room which was totally unexpected  Continental breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and was a bonus as it was included in the price. The rooms were spotless and cleaned daily. The car park was free.

We feel so lucky we found this place! The rooms were spacious, very clean and comfortable. The staff went out of their way to be be sure we had everything, including supplies for the beach, best places to go in the area, and places to eat. Free parking and breakfast were a definite plus. It was so nice waking up and eating breakfast on the porch enjoying the ocean view! This is how hotels should be run! Looking forward to the next time we can get to Dana Point!

I spent two nights at this lovely spot in Dana Point, enjoying the view of the ocean from the deck and enjoying time with friends from PA and CA who also stayed there.  The only drawbacks were the tiny breakfast room (but good food selection), and also trains traveled through the area across the street on a regular basis.  (The motel provided earplugs for sleeping, but I didn't need them.)  The room was clean, comfortable and quite affordable for the area, with restaurants within walking distance.  Great stay!!
Highly recommend this jewel .  Management excellent with wonderful rooms and gardens.  Breakfast was wonderful and pleasant atmosphere.  Will mark this as a must return.  You will too.

Summary Heading: Excellent service and great hotel for the money.
Summary: The service was outstanding, this is a family owned hotel and it sure makes a difference. Rooms are neat and clean with modern furniture and flat screen tv¬¥s. Breakfast and parking are included. We left some items and inmediately received a call from the front desk to our house, the items were delivered to our home in Georgia in less than 2 days. We appreciate the gesture. Would go again. Steven, Fernando and the whole staff are very nice.

I read about this hotel on TripAdvisor and saw the good reviews.  And they were right on. My cousin and I stayed here overnight in June 2012 for a family reunion in nearby Laguna Beach.  The room was spacious, clean, and updated.  The bathroom was just fine - and had a nice makeup mirror and hair dryer.  We also had a microwave, fridge, and small sink.  The owners are very welcoming and delightful.  Breakfast next day offered waffles, eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, tea, juice - it was terrific.  The ocean-view we had did also mean some highway traffic and occasional train traffic - but it was minimal.  I would definitely stay here again - and it was very affordable!  There is also a terrific Italian restaurant down the block - Agostino's - delicious food and reasonable

We stayed at this hotel Memorial Day weekend 2012 through Thursday morning that week. The manager and his wife are very friendly and helpful. We always needed extra towels and hangers as there was four of us staying in our room. They were very nice to always give us the towels everyday and provided the extra hangers when we checked in. The room was very clean and fresh. Which means a lot to me as I used to have a cleaning business and I am very particular when it comes to hotels and their cleanliness. Our room was on the first floor with a beach view and we enjoyed seeing the ocean every day and being so close that all we had to do was walk across the street to the beach. The Amtrak metro trains do go by about every 1/2 hour but they go by so quickly that you hear them and then

My fiance and I opted for this place based on trip advisor recommendations and, for the most part, it was spot on. Awesome location across the street from the beach. The street noise posed little problem and the sound of the waves are what you hear most of. The place is small, clean, and quaint.  Most importantly, the lady loved it and suggested it become our new "place." The bathrooms are small and the breakfast a little uninspiring, but everything else is great. The service was friendly, the room was spacious and cozy, and the parking situation is very good. I would definitely recommend staying here and I have full intention of returning myself.

I stayed here for 3 nights in April and can only echo what others have said on this site: friendly, helpful staff; beautifully landscaped and well-maintained grounds; generous continental breakfast (although I would have like to have seen some peanut butter for my toast); decent coffee.  My spacious, tastefully decorated room faced the beach ‚Äì I could hear the waves crashing - and was super clean.  The bed was comfy with lots of soft, sleep inducing pillows.  Yes, the train comes by at night and blasts its whistle, but for me this enhanced the romantic atmosphere.  And so many nice eateries only a few minutes away in Dana Point.  I travel to this area at least once a year and will certainly stay here again.

What a Great Stay. I work in the hospitality industry in a very large hotel and know what guests expect. Steve and Fernando provided excellent service and were helpful and friendly. The room was very comfortable and so were the beds. The hotel is close by to the beach and to whale watching and the reason for our vacation. The following day we were greeted with a nice breakfast which got the day going. The outdoor upper patio deck was a nice place to watch the ocean and to watch the sun rise and set. Wish I had a chance to try the hot tub. When we go back I will book a room again here!

We were expecting a mediocre hotel that we could spend the night in and move on. We were pleasantly surprised by the spacious room, updated bedding and wonderful staff. It's a family owned hotel and the location was ideal - right near the ocean. What a wonderful surprise.

Fernando is a wonderful and friendly host who has made this lodging a delight. Ocean breezes, the lapping of waves and vistas of the exercise crowd make this a spot for families or couples. This place is clean! The only drawback was a very loud refrigerator but Fernando is aware of this and provides earplugs for those who are bothered by the sound. My daughters came down from Van Nuys and up from San Diego to spend the day with us. Their needs were accommodated when a flat tire appeared. Fernando was there with the need tool.

We stayed in room 102, front facing the coast. This unit is just above the underground parking entrance. Sitting on the balcony you don't even notice it.. Very nice room looking across the PCH as all hotels do in the area.  Hotel is very clean and people very attentive and helpful. We had only one issue during our stay, seems like someone forgot about the daylight saving time change. There little contanal breakfast was an hour late, so we had to hit Fast food breakfast on our way out in the morning...  The hotel is right by the walkway going over to the park and beach. On the weekend people have Bon fires in pits that you can enjoy too from your room.

Wonderful, quaint with gardens in courtyard, across street from beach and plenty of walking,biking. Staff is terrific, very friendly and courteous,  Small hotel, older with plenty of charm and very clean. Trains track also across street, no problem for us and PCH is main route but not that busy.  Would make this place a regular when staying in Orange County.

I have stayed here for business trips to Dana Point twice, 2 trips of two days with about 1 year between stays.  Pros:  Very nice staff, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast, clean, good relative value, better amenities (towels, linens, etc.) than you would expect for the $  Cons:  Near Train tracks,  No services (restaurant, business center, etc.) or common facilities (pools, health club, etc.), Thin walls, Aging motel-like building  My first stay here was pretty uneventful in a good way.  Everything went smoothly and I had no real problems.  The trains coming by at 6AM onward were a bit of a surprise, but they thoughtfully provided ear plugs, which was a nice way to address the issue.  My second stay was less enjoyable.  The walls in my room were thin enough that I was able
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel and service.  We appreciate you finding enough value for a return stay and allowing us the opportunity to serve you again.  Our sincere apologies for the hot water not working properly, it was a small issue that was easily resolved and we assure you that everything is in working order.  Our business center is located in the office area and not easily seen for the location is intended to provide privacy during use.  The TV's we use are all current model 42" high definition Sony or Panasonic Plasma units and our commercial cable provider has recently changed their programming format which has caused a pause when using the channel up and down feature.  We have spoken with the cable company and are working hard to seek a solution to the issue.  Please feel free to conveniently call us from your room if there are any issues during your next stay.  We could have easily corrected all the issues which were experienced and regret that we did not have the opportunity to do so during your stay. Thank you for your repeat stays and we hope to see you in the near future

Summary: The hotel is fresh, clean, and decorated nicely.  Other hotel managers should come here for a sample of how a hotel should be run.  The staff was friendly, the off street parking was free, and the hotel is right on the pacific.   My only negative is it sits right on the PCH but there is nothing the hotel can do about that.  The trade off is great views of the ocean and an easy walk or drive to the harbor.

Summary Heading: Great stay with a lovely view
Summary: Over all impression--- Hospitality they showed! The staff is very friendly and well-trained. A small breakfast section but served everything, especially hot food.   Amenities were surprisingly good. Room was neat and modern.  Bed was extremely comfortable. Free wifi service. There were trains passing by that location in the night time but it didn't really bother me that much.  The facilities are excellent too. Parking area is well-marked and organized. Great jacuzzi hot tub with an ocean view.

Summary Heading: Good room at a great price near the beach
Summary: Staff were amazing, especially Stephen.  Our room (204) was 2 queen beds in the back which tended to be dark with no view of the ocean.  I would suspect the front rooms would be very nice.  The room was big and clean with standard amenities and free wifi.  The train didn't really bother us.  We did watch the sunset from the hotel's second floor public balcony and it was quite lovely.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us to serve you during your visit.  Our rooms on the front side of the hotel do have rare unobstructed spanning Pacific Ocean views where the sunset can be viewed from the comfort of your own private balcony.  We are grateful for your appreciation of our customer service and are always happy when can be a part of making a stay just a bit more special.

Summary Heading: Lovely rooms, fantastic staff, right near running trail
Summary: Staff is just so remarkably friendly, attentive and kind at this hotel.  They are a big part of why we recently intended to book again at the end of our cross-country trip to move to San Clemente.  We traveled with our dog this time and pets are not allowed on the property, however we will be recommending the hotel to friends.  If you can handle the train across the street (and the inevitable horn blowing), this is a great location with a lovely, unobstructed view - close to the ped bridge and running trail, Rte 1 access is in front of the hotel, good restaurants close by.  The rooms are lovely, hot tub is well-maintained and staff are happy to give you towels to use there.  Parking is free, the courtyard with music and waterfall is just precious and breakfast is available in

Me and my girl stayed there last July for three days.  I love that its clean,  nice rooms,  great friendly staff and we had rooms facing the highway and beach.   the Garden area is awesome.  And everything is close.  I want badly to go back and will.  We got to see the awesome fireworks display on July 4th    I love that is is not alot of rooms and so quiet.  And the deck rocks to hang at!!

We had a large room facing the ocean which was very clean and the staff was courteous, attentive and welcoming. The one thing I regret is that I didn't read that. like all the hotels in this strip, we were on the Pacific Coast Highway, across a train track - yes we had a beautiful view of the sea but sitting out on our porch (which of course raises the price of the room) was something we had really looked forward to but couldn't really enjoy because of the noise from the street. We have stayed in Laguna Before but thought we could get closer to the ocean in Dana Point - we did but it didn't really add to our enjoyment. The hotel is very nice on its own but I wouldn't pay the premium for the balcony or ocean view again.
Even though the view on the sea was only partial, the price offered at the very last minute was a very good value - the room huge and the service very nice. Highly recommended.

This hotel was very very ungracious about rescheduling my stay.   More than 24 hours ahead of time I contacted them and tried to reschedule.  They said fine but they would charge me 100% of my rate.  All sorts of hotels (regardless of posted "policy")  would have accommodated me.  I travel a lot, and have been so accommodated by many hotel chains.  But this "Best Western" would not.  Not so classy of them. I will never stay here again.  And I will tell my entire group (a club soccer team) not to book here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and your comments.  Unfortunately we do have to hold firm to our cancel or change policy when a request is made within the binding period.  Please understand that as a hotel we guarantee to hold the room for you and will not sell it to anyone else, even if we are able to receive a higher price.  In turn it is only fair that the guest guarantees to arrive for the room or give the hotel a fair opportunity to resell the room in case the guest cannot arrive.  Our apologies for not being more flexible with your cancellation, but if there was no policy in place for reservations, there would not be a reason to book reservations or for us to guarantee you a room at the rate in which was agreed.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, spectacular view, fabulous service!
Summary: This hotel has gorgeous garden decor outside, the rooms are spacious with a mini kitchen, and the ocean view is spectacular!  The staff is extremely attentive.  The beach is right across the street, and there are several restaurants within walking distance.  The Coast Highway is quite busy during the day, and the trains are right there (the whistle blows right in front of the hotel because there is a crossing nearby).  It is a little annoying, but the view from the balcony makes it all worthwhile.  I didn't notice the trains after about 10:30 at night.  Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: I would pick another location besides Dana Point
Summary: I give this motel an average rating only because I didn't like the Dana Point location.  The motel itself was awesome, but with the train whistle (yes, it's a bit annoying, not "quaint" like some have said) and PCH running right in front of the motel, I would've picked a motel elsewhere.  The front desk staff was a 5.  The beds, shower, TV, hot tub and cleanliness were all 5.  If you don't mind the location, chose this motel.  The location gets a zero from me.
Manager Response: Thank you for the high scoring on our rooms and customer service.  The majority of our guests don't mind the train and some find it enjoyable, but we do understand that the whistle may not be that way for everyone.  A crosswalk to the south of our hotel is the reason for the train whistle when traveling in that direction, fortunately we do not hear the small Amtrak when going north.  We have been working very hard with the city and a safety device has recently been constructed.  It is now in the process of creating a "silent zone" so the train may pass without tooting it's horn. Hopefully if you decide to return to our hotel in the future, the train will not affect your stay.

Summary: Just had a nice trip to Dana Point with my Mother. We usually stay at The Blue Lantern Inn which has been a favorite of ours for many years. This time we stayed at Dana Point Inn by the Sea for a change. We were not disappointed at all. Our room was beautiful ( #214 ) we had a beautiful view of the crashing waves and and lots of bird activity.The room has been recently redecorated and has a really comfy bed and a gorgeous shower with 11 spraying heads in it. ( Crazy, but true!) The train tracks are just across the street, but somehow the train noise did not bother us at all,  it just added to the fun of it The location of the hotel is ideal for a beach walk, or short drive to San Clemente for some great restaurants and the pier. We dinned at Olemendis Mexican Restaurant just
Manager Response: Libby V,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us.  We are pleased to see that you enjoyed our latest addition to guest rooms which was completed not long before your stay.  The beds we use throughout our hotel are Sealy Memory Foam Pillow Top mattresses and have been praised for their comfort, so we are happy to hear that you slept comfortably and enjoyed our small Coastliner trains that pass during the day.    The shower is what we call our "Ultimate Shower Experience."  As you step in, gorgeous stone/ tile treatments surround you as our 10 adjustable body spray begin to sooth and the gentle overhead rain washes away the stress that was left from the day.   Wired internet was available in your room during your time of stay and we are currently installing wireless access points to provide better coverage throughout the hotel.  A hot breakfast will also take the place of the continental the next time you are in town to enjoy our hotel. Thank you again for being a valued guest and we appreciate your candid comments.

Summary: My son and his wife live in the area and we were in town to take care of some family business, last minute. I called this hotel receiving excellent service from the front desk quickly making arrangements for our one night stay.   The exterior areas are beautiful and the rooms have recently been updated with granite in the kitchenette area as well as the bath. More importantly, the beds have the pillow top mattress which makes for a very good nights sleep. Even though the hotel is on the opposite side of the coast highway I still heard the waves crashing, which is a plus for me. The train tracks are also across the street but being from a small northern California town I loved hearing the trains pass by. I must note that they do NOT run all night so for those that don't find that

The Dana Point Inn By the Sea is a charming, family run hotel with so many pluses!  The rooms are lovely and large, the staff are courteous and friendly, the free breakfast offers many choices and is convenient, the beach view is lovely and access is just a short walk away.  The hotel wraps around a beautiful little courtyard garden complete with a fountain, and even the check in office and breakfast room are adorned with plants - someone must have a green thumb!  This is my second stay at this quaint inn, and it won't be my last!  Other than occasional trains passing by across the PCH, this hotel is very peaceful and quiet.  The Inn by the Sea is a gem!

We stayed for 2 nights in the middle of August and found this a very pleasant hotel.  We had a room, with balcony, facing the beach, well worth the extra.  The beach is a short walk along the pacific coast highway and over a bridge. The beach is pleasant and at the weekends and holiday periods there are lots of people using the available BBQs.  There are trains running between the highway and the beach, we didn‚Äôt find them a problem.  There are fewer at night when I think the local service shuts down, we didn‚Äôt have any problem sleeping ‚Äì ear plugs weren‚Äôt necessary.  The staff were pleasant and helpful.  Steven recommended the Chart House restaurant and booked us a table for each of the 2 nights of our stay.  Great views, good food.  Unfortunately the hotel breakfast was a bit

The hotel is just off the highway and a short walk to a bridge over the highway to the shore. Even with some fog, we enjoyed the access and walked twice during our overnight stay. The room was in excellent condition and we really enjoyed the courtyard in the middle of the surrounding hotel rooms. The fountains helped to mask the traffic noise of the nearby highway and made access to the rooms more private. We enjoyed the outdoor hot-tub on the property, which was screened nicely. The folks at the front desk were very pleasant and helpful; the continental breakfast was fine. It was fairly quiet since we were there off-season. We would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Just a motel, not a resort, not even a swimming pool
Summary: We were asked for a credit card when we checked in for "incidentals" - what "incidentals" we wondered. There is nothing to buy: no lounge, nor restaurant, no store, no rentals, not even a swimming pool.  Yet there was a "resort" fee per night attached to our check-out slip. That was not disclosed at their website or at Hotel.com website. Parking was supposed to be free, but the $14.00 per night resort fee takes care of that doesn't it?  Or maybe that is how they are trying to recover the investment of new TVs and bedding. It is a long walk & climb to the beach over Pacific Coast Hwy bridge. With chairs & kids not easily done. Driving and paying for parking is easier. The motel is on the opposite side of a busy highway (not the beach side) w/motorcyles, traffic & train, so trying
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel, we are reassured that your stay was somewhat pleasant from seeing your 3 dot scoring.    There is often confusion of the difference between a Hotel and a Motel.  A Motel is a location where your vehicle is able to park in front of the room door, hence the "Mo"=Motor (for Motor car).  Motels are mainly for the more budget minded traveler who is on the go.  A Hotel indicates a more home like feel, "Ho"= Home/ Hospitality.  Hotels are more for relaxation and for the traveler who is looking for a bit more luxury and home like atmosphere.  Our hotel has an underground parking structure separate from the rooms with luxurious accomodations, thus Hotel.  Incidentals are a requirement at every hotel, regardless of any type of extra services that the hotel may additionally charge for.  Mainly, incidentals are held for any type of damages that may be incurred during a stay.  We do not hold much in comparison to other hotels in our area and hope our minimal holding did not tie up any necessary funds.  Unfortunately the resort fee is clearly stated on Hotels.com during the time of booking.  We do understand that there is quite a bit of wording and sometimes things can be overlooked.  When booking with our hotel directly, we can often waive the resort fee.  We hope our explanation has clarified some confusion and will hopefully ease the process of your next hotel experience. If you decided to return to our area of Dana Point, please allow us to point out the beach access bridge only 3 buildings to the north or the surface access at the traffic light, 2 buildings to the south.  Please let us know if we can be of any assistance in the future and thank you for the opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary: We stayed here for two nights on our way to Long Beach.  The room (209) was large, clean, and although the Inn was full on the first night of our stay, it was very quiet.  We were satisfied with the breakfast, as there was enough variety there that I didn't have to have a 'hot' breakfast.  There was plenty of parking under the building.  I knew that the trains passed close to the building, so I got a good laugh when I saw the ear plugs supplied by the Inn (but I didn't need to use them).  The staff were very accomodating and professional.  If in the area again, I would be more than happy to stay here.

Summary Heading: great location except for the train
Summary: short walk over a bridge to decent beach, usually not crowded, can walk about a mile to harbor with restaurants and shopping, very nice short term getaway, very nice place, great staff.

Summary Heading: The most helpful staff and cleanest rooms on the coast.
Summary: I had read a couple of reviews about this property that were not very encouraging. We were ready for anything and as it happened we were surprised by what we found.  The manager greeted us warmly and remembered we were with a wedding party.  He grabbed a map of the area and show us how to navigate our way around the town, how to see the sights, and where to eat.  We found our room to be VERY clean, dusted, vacuumed, and scrubbed.  No reissued glassware here.  We went out on our deck, had a beverage and counted trains.  They come by every 45 minutes or so but we hardly noticed.  As a matter of fact once inside the room we tried to guess if they were headed north or south. Would we stay there again?  Yes!  We had fun.

Stayed for 2 nights and had rather high expectations for this property as a MOTEL.  And, that is what it really is.  It didn't disappoint as a MOTEL.  Very comfortable and clean room.  It appears that it has been recently updated.  Good location and nice staff.  If you want the amenities of a Hotel, you will need to stay in the bluff area, which is not as close to the beach.  Train noise is not really an issue.  The complaints you read about are over-blown...

Summary Heading: Very attentive Owners and staff, wonderful stay!
Summary: Upgrade for the ocean view! Nice relaxing time on the balcony. Staff was so helpful and pleasant, will definitely stay again when I need to get away. Beautiful gardens and fountains. Thank you to the wonderful owners and staff.

Summary Heading: The BEST experience at any hotel I've ever had
Summary: The owners and staff at the Best Western at Dana Point go out of their way to help the customers and make sure that your experience is as enjoyable and easy going as possible. They are kind, friendly wonderful people. I will make sure to return the next time I have a martial arts retreat at Dana Point or for my next family visit.

Summary Heading: Nice little beach hotel, will return again.
Summary: This is a cute little hotel right across the street from the beach. For the price it is a great find. You can tell the hotel has been recently updated with new carpets and furnature. It was a much nice place than the hotels I have stayed at in Hermosa Beach and Santa Monica. The only thing I was dissapointed in was that the hot tub was closed for renovations. I will be back next year!

Summary Heading: Nice room, low quality breakfast for price
Summary: Room was well-appointed. Location was across from beach, but out of interesting parts of beach scene.  Buffet breakfast was poor quality for the room's price - we skipped it.  Won't return next year for our annual Laguna Beach anniversary weekend.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  Although we have done our best to provide the best quality expanded continental breakfast, we do understand the demand of a hot breakfast.  We are in the process of adding these items and hope you will give us another opportunity in the future.  We appreciate your business and apologize for not meeting your expectations.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a week in February for a family wedding. We had two adjoining rooms which were both beautifully decorated and immaculately clean. The hotel staff was always cheerful and pleasant.  Breakfast every morning was excellent. Freshly made waffles, pastries, oatmeal, cereal . . . something to make every member of the family happy. We enjoyed our time so much that we even extended our stay by an extra day.  From reading the previous reviews, I was a little nervous about train noise, but we had rooms in the back and none of us were ever woken up by the train, not even the 6 month old baby. The beds were incredibly comfortable and we slept soundly. We will certainly stay here again when we are back in town.

This is the first time I stayed at a Best Western.  My husband & I usually enjoy B&Bs or boutique hotels, but since I was with family, we chose the Best Western.  I was pleasantly surprised with the place, the location, cleanliness, service, continental breakfast, ease of parking, friendly owners of the place.  The room was spacious, the closet, sink & mirror area had been remodeled, however, the toilet & shower room was a bit tight, although clean, can use a little more updating. We stayed in a room at the back of the building with garden view for one night.  it was quiet from the PCH traffic, the train noise is not  noticeable and we all had a good night of sleep until the baby next door woke us up at 5 a.m.  There are areas on the 2nd floor with outdoor furniture that you can

Summary Heading: Great rooms, views, and customer service.
Summary: When we arrived to dana point we were going to stay somewhere else, we had no idea about this best western until we were scared away by the hotel we had made prior reservations for.  When we pulled up to the best western I was like this is more like it I can totally stay here!  We walked in to the office to see if there were any rooms avaliable, we had mentioned that we were supposed to stay somewhere else we just had to say the name of the hotel and then the manager said "o ya a lot of people make reservations there, then see it in person and then run for there lives." He apologized and upgraded us at no additonal charge to the best room with the best view! And then on top of that suprised us with dinner reservations at Chart House, making sure we had the best table in the

Summary Heading: A lovely place to stay.  I will be back.
Summary: The gardens are unexpectedly lovely with lush plants, fountains and garden statues.  The room, bed and furnishings were sparkling, squeaky clean, quiet, and very comfortable, stylishly decorated.  Everything looks new.  Nice big TV.  I was upgraded to a room w/partial ocean view.  It was spectacular to be able to look out at the beautiful Pacific Ocean with sail boats passing in the distance and clear blue sky.   A very serene and special window scene.  Granted the train runs by the inn, but it did not bother me.  I've saved the best for last.  The staff is incredibly helpful and kind.   I highly recommend staying there.

I have stayed in a lot of Best Western Hotels and by far this one was the BEST. The front desk went beyond helpful to accommodate my and my schedule. Rooms are extremely clean and the grounds as well.

Summary Heading: Room was very nice, but the TRAIN???
Summary: Property and hotel staff were very nice and accommodating and the room was very clean and comfortable. The only very disappointing quality was that the hotel in right next to train tracks and the train runs often and during the night and in the early morning hours.  It was very startling to be woken up at 2:00am by a raging train. I guess it would have been appreciated that the staff mentioned that little issue upon booking the room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us.  It is unfortunate that the trains run near the hotel but we do have good news.
